loans.name: Alam

texts.ru: Аламу 38 лет, женат на прекрасной женщине, которая является домохозяйкой. Алам имеет  4 детей. Детям 16, 14, 11 лет, а маленькому 6 месяцев. Они учатся в средней школе и мечтают, чтобы их дом был как замок, но доход Алама от услуги таксиста не достаточно для этого.  Из-за не удобства дома, у детей всегда насморк зимой. Алам запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент и т.п. для ремонта дома. Алам и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Alam is 38 years old and is married to a wonderful woman who is a homemaker. Alam has four children aged 16, 14, 11 and the youngest is 6 months old. They study in secondary school and wish that their house was like a castle, but Alam's income from his taxi services are not enough for that. As a result of the discomfort in the house, his children always have head colds in the winter. Alam is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, etc. for home repairs. Alam and his children await kind lenders who will help them solve their housing problems.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Lilia Esperanza

texts.es:
LILIA ESPERANZA tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene 1 hijo de 39 años de edad, vive con el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

LILIA ESPERANZA  se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas o en San Carlos cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las plagas el cogollero. El sueño es comprar terreno para semrar más hectareas de terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Lilia Esperanza, 58, is single and has a 39-year-old son; she lives with her son in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Bruniquilde” communal bank located in Recinto Calabi that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture.

Lilia Esperanza grows corn and rice.  She requests the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and weed killer.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas or in San Carlos every 15 days.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy the farm supplies.  

The challenge she faces is infestations in her crops and her dream is to buy a field in order to plant more hectares of land.  In her free time she likes to play and be with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Yanina Yanela

texts.es:
YANINA YANELA tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, vive con la hija en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

YANINA YANELA se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hacen.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es poder guiar a la hija por un buen camino. El sueño es superar las cosechas para poder incrementar el negocio y tener ingresos para solventar los estudios de la hija.En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar a la hija jugar pelota, dialogar con la familia.
texts.en:
Yanina Yanela, 33, is single and has a 12-year-old daughter; she lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Bruniquilde” communal bank located in Recinto Calabi that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture.

Yanina Yanela grows corn and also raises chickens.  She requests the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure and weed killer.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas every 15 days.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizer she so needs.

The challenge she faces is to guide her daughter along a good path and her dream is to increase her crop yields so that the business will grow and she will have income sufficient to pay for her daughter’s schooling.  In her free time she likes to teach her daughter to play ball and to chat with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like oil and to repair a large table that makes his job easier.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es:
Ananias se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la actividad de la crianza de cerdos, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy temprana edad se la enseñó para que trabajara a su lado. Gracias a la experiencia que ha adquirido, ahora es reconocido por tener muy buena calidad en los animales que vende, y esto le ha permitido vender los animales a muy buen precio y ayudarse así a superar las dificultades económicas de su familia. Ananias se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad a quien le ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, y para que su familia pueda tener el sustento necesario, trabaja fuertemente en su negocio todos los días con el ánimo de sacarlo adelante. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, y para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, Ananias busca un préstamo para comprar 6 bultos de cuido para alimentar los cerdos.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio donde pueda ofrecer una estabilidad económica para su familia y desde el cual tenga la oportunidad de brindarle a su hijo el acceso a una educación de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Ananías has spent a great part of his life raising pigs because that’s what his father did too and he taught him when still very young so that he could work alongside him.  Thanks to the experience he’s gained, he’s now well-known for the high quality of the animals he sells.  This has allowed him to sell the animals at very good prices thus helping him to overcome his family’s economic difficulties.

Ananías is married and has a 13-year-old son who he wants to provide with a good quality of life and so that his family can have the sustenance they require he works hard in his business every day to move it forward.  Looking to solve the problem he has with capital and to be able to respond to pending customer orders, Ananías is looking for financing to buy six bundles of pig feed for his pigs.

His dream is to have a large business in order to provide his family with economic stability and from which he can have the wherewithal to provide his son with a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber and work tools.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando tiene una gran experiencia en la actividad de la crianza de pollos y cerdos, pues desde muy joven se dedica a esta actividad gracias a que su padre se la enseñó. Durante mucho tiempo trabajó para una empresa y desde hace unos años decidió independizarse, pero debido a las dificultades económicas que tienen en su hogar, su negocio ha visto grandes problemas para poder salir adelante. Hace unos meses estaba engordando unos cerdos, pero debido a que el precio de la carne disminuyó considerablemente, su negocio hizo que perdiera mucho dinero y ahora tiene grandes dificultades económicas. Es por esto que como no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Orlando acude a un préstamo para comprar pollos y el cuido necesario para su engorde.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio que le permita ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Orlando has vast experience raising chickens and pigs because he started this activity while still a boy thanks to his father’s teachings.  For a long time he was employed by a firm and a few years go decided to become independent but due to economic difficulties he had at home his business has had big problems getting ahead.

A few months ago he was fattening up some pigs but because prices dropped considerably, the business lost much money and now he’s facing significant economic difficulties.  This is why he does not have sufficient capital and why Orlando is calling upon a loan to buy chicks and feed needed to raise them.  His dream is to have a business that will make it possible for him to provide his wife and three children with a better quality of life and better economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe-making supplies.

loans.name: Annah  Mwende

texts.en:
Annah is 31 years old and a single mother of two children who are in school. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for two years and has employed one person. Besides, she does crop farming to generate additional income. 

Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, she hopes to grow her business and employ more people. She has requested for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Ngoto

texts.en:
Ngoto is 49 years old and married with five children in school. He does livestock farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years and has employed one person. He also does crop farming to supplement his income. 

He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to expand his business. He dreams of increasing the size of his farm in the future. He has requested for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 40. She is a mother of nine children who is married and lives in Congo town. Her children are between the ages of 12 and 24, and are currently in school. Her husband is a businessman.  

She has been involved in this business for the past five years. She sells coal, rice, palm oil, peppers, sardines and other items in her community. She learned to sell from her mother. She is proud of her business because she earns her own income and helps her husband with the family expenses. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more bags of coal, peppers, palm oil and sardines for the business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal, peppers, palm oil and sardines for the business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Congo Town with her husband and five children. She is 48, her children are between the ages of 12 and 25 and her husband is a driver. Some of her children are in school, while some are independent and working. For the past three years she has been selling dry fish, rice, pepper, cooking oil and many other items. With initial capital from her husband she started this business and has learned to sell from her mother. She likes to do this business because she feels independent and is able to contribute with the expenses in the home. She has requested this loan to purchase more dry fish, rice and cooking oil to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish, rice and cooking oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian lives in West Point. She is 31 years old and married. Her husband works for an NGO and they have three children between 6 and 12 years old. For the past 10 years now, she has been selling cold drinks (soft drinks) and bread. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start her business and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bread

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 36 years old and lives in Kakata Town, Liberia.  She is married and has five children between 9 and 21 years old, all living at home.  For the past seven years she has been operating a small food center (restaurant) where she sells Liberian dishes.  She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of money, which allows her to look after her children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice oil and other spices for her business.  In the future, she plans to make her shop a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice oil and spices for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has two children, aged three and nine. She describes herself to be hardworking. Catherine operates a general store where she sells plastic items such as buckets, containers, school bags, baskets, mattresses, etc. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a strategic business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Catherine will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy plastic items, buckets, baskets, mattresses, etc. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy plastic items, buckets, baskets, mattresses

loans.name: Babulia

texts.en:
Babulia is from the village of Patardzeuli, Kakheti Region. She is 65 years old and lives with her husband and 30-year-old son. The family earns its living through a small dairy farm. In particular, they own four milk cows. Babulia milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. The family sells milk and cheese locally. All members of the family work hard from early morning till late evening to improve their living conditions.

Babulia requested a loan to purchase feed for the cattle. She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, the family will be able to count on an expected amount of milk. Babulia will produce dairy products again and increase the income of the family. Babulia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle

loans.name: Darwin Omar

texts.es:
El señor Darwin de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en su propia casa se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa nueva y usada de manera ambulante el viaja todo los días  en su motocicleta a los barrios, caseríos y lugares aledaños a su comunidad a vender la ropa, sus clientes son los amigos y conocidos que el tiene en los lugares que a diario visita.
Don Darwin esta solicitando 12,000.00 lempiras para compra de ropa nueva y usada, con el apoyo de este préstamo Don Darwin desea comprar  ropa clasificada faldas, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros ya que este es uno de los productos que mas demanda tiene.
Don Darwin esta muy contento de trabajar con Prisma por la puntualidad en la entrega de sus préstamos y por la atención que se le brinda.
Don Darwin su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Darwin, age 40, lives with his wife and three children in his own house.  He has been selling new and used clothes in an itinerant manner for several years.  Every day he travels on his motorcycle to neighborhoods, rural communities, and the outskirts of his community.  He does this to sell clothes to his customers, who are the friends and acquaintances that he has in the places he visits daily.

Darwin is requesting 12,000 lempiras to buy new and used clothes.  With the support of this Kiva loan Darwin wishes to buy skirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other garments, which are the products in the most demand.

Darwin is very happy to work with Prisma because of the punctual delivery of the loans and for the service that is offered.

Darwin’s dream is to continue working and improving his business in order to give his family a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July, 2012.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Bernard  Abiud

texts.en: Bernard is 33 years old and a father of one child who is in school. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. In addition, he is a vegetable vendor. He previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future. He has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Steve Alejandro

texts.es: El cliente Steve tiene 33 años vive en el departamento de La Paz en la Zona de Miraflores, comenzó a trabajar con esta actividad hace de 5 años en el servicio venta de comidas para eventos (fiestas, cumpleaños, reuniones sociales, etc.) Steve se independizo a  los 20 años, vive actualmente  en casa  de su abuelo al que cuida y acompaña, pero el genera ingresos para pagar sus gastos y también la universidad donde estudia la carrera de Derecho, de esta manera pudo salir adelante con su actividad con mucho sacrificio y perseverancia llego a cumplir sus objetivos. Ahora con este crédito pretende hacer prosperar su negocio con este crédito que será un impulso para el mismo. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de vajilla y manejo de cocina para su negocio de esta manera ahorrara en alquilar estos productos , para así poder mejorar su negocio y lograr muchos más sueños que el anhela conseguir.
texts.en: The member, Steve, is 33 years old.  He lives in La Paz Department, Miraflores Zone.  He started his catering business 5 years ago.  He caters for events (parties, birthdays, social gatherings etc).  Steve went out on his own when he was 20 years old.  He currently lives in his grandfather's house.  He takes care of his grandfather and keeps him company, but he generates enough income to take care of his own expenses, including his schooling.  He is studying Law at the University.  It took a lot of sacrifice and perseverance, but Steve was able to move forward with his business and to meet his goals.  Now, with this loan, he plans to make his business prosper; the loan is the driving force.  He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a dinner set and kitchen appliances for his business so that he will save on renting those products.  He will then be able to improve his business and make even more of his dreams reality.

loans.use: to purchase a dinner set for his catering business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita tiene 39 años de edad casada con el Sr. Félix se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, papaliza, haba, oca con practica de rotación de cultivos en terreno de 2 Has que es herencia de sus padres, en la actividad tiene bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, ellos viven en la comunidad de Cayarani a 58 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Doña Margarita necesita dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) el ahorro que tenía invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda , Doña Margarita nos comenta que ahora sembrara en más superficie así van tener mayores ingresos económicos para el estudio de sus hijos, garantizando la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y de otros.
texts.en: Señora Margarita is 39 years old and she is married to Sr. Félix.  They make their living in agriculture, which is the source of their income.  They produce potatoes, papalisa, (an Andean root vegetable), broad beans and oca (an Andean tuber) using crop rotation on 2 hectares of land that she inherited from her parents.  Doña Margarita has a lot of experience managing crops, using phytosanitary treatments, harvesting and selling.  They live in the community of Cayarani, which is 58 km from the city of Cochabamba.  Doña Margarita needs money to purchase agricultural supplies like compost (chicken manure), as she used her savings to build their home.  Doña Margarita tell us that she will she will do more surface planting in order to generate more income for her children's schooling and to guarantee food security for her family and for others.

loans.use: to purchase compost (chicken manure).

loans.name: Kenia Yakelin

texts.es:
La señora Kenia tiene 32 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el viven sus dos hijos y su esposo quien la apoya en su actividad comercial, trabajo que realiza desde hace 5 años en su aldea donde vive.
Doña Kenia su negocio esta en un punto de fácil acceso, y esto se presta para que sea muy visitado por muchas personas. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, sartén. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es comprar producto para contrarrestar la demanda diaria de cada uno de sus clientes.
Doña Kenia los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio, y comprar una maquina para hacer tortillas, como también generarse mejores ingresos y tener una mejor vida.

Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Kenia is 32 years old and lives in the southern part of Honduras together with her two children and her husband. He supports her in her business activity, which she has been doing in the village where they live for five years.

Kenia's business is in an easily accessed location, which means that a lot of people visit it. She needs the loan so that she can buy corn, lime, firewood, and a frying pan. She expects that the loan will enable her to buy enough supplies to meet the daily demand of every one of her customers. 

Kenia's future plan is to continue growing her business and to buy a tortilla-making machine so that she can generate a better income and have a better life.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, and a frying pan for her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, la amabilidad de sus pobladores y sobre todo porque se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Julio es muy trabajador, ya que es padre de 2 lindos pequeños cuyas edades comprenden 2 y 3 años, a los cuales ama muchísimo y por quienes se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con ello y en ocasiones jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país y por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día julio trabaja en su pequeño negocio como cerrajero, el elabora puertas, ventanas, entre otros a base de madera y metal; el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá realizar la colocación de piso en su vivienda, ya que actualmente su piso es de tierra, así el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y podrá seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Julio is 36 years old.  He lives in Ica, a city known for its warm and cozy climate, the friendliness of the people and above all, for its agriculture, especially the cotton, grape, asparagus etc. production.  Julio is very hard-working.  He is the father of two beautiful children, ages 2 and 3 years old.  He loves them very much and for their sake he works hard, to get them ahead.  When he has some free time, Julio likes to go walking with his children or sometimes he plays soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also really likes traditional Peruvian food.  One of his favorite dishes is “Ají de Gallina,” (spicy creamed chicken).  Because of his family's limited resources, Julio was only able to go to secondary school.  But he would have liked very much to have studied at the university level. 

Day after day, Julio works in his small business as an iron worker.  He makes doors, windows and other items out of wood and metal.  He works about 8 hours a day, and he believes that his business is doing well because he is very responsible and has a great desire to get ahead. 

Julio is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help, he will be able to put down flooring in his home.  Currently, he has an earthen floor.  So the new flooring will improve his family's quality of life and he will be able to keep working every day toward making his greatest dream come true:  "To finish building his home."

loans.use: to make improvements to his home (putting down flooring).

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old married man. He has one child. He is a hardworking and aggressive man. He operates a motorcycle and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. 

James describes his biggest business challenge as the rising cost of fuel. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to purchase another motorcycle. His business goal is to improve his business by buying another motorbike within five years. 

James hopes that in the future, he will have several motorcycles. James also runs a small grocery store, which helps increase his income. Previously, he had taken a loan of KES 20,000, which he paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, age 24, is single and lives in his family's house with his parents. Joel runs an internet cafe where he offers a variety of services such as printing, photocopying and browsing. 

With this loan, Joel intends to purchase printing papers and a photocopying machine.

In the future, Joel intends to open a computer training unit. For this reason, he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Yehu.

The biggest business challenge he faces is the breakdown of his machines.

loans.use: to purchase printing papers and a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old married woman. She has one son who is 1 year old. She describes herself as a respectful and accommodating woman. 

Esther operates a general store where she sells homes products such as flour, cooking fat, margarine, cereals and fruits such as mangoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located near four schools and her primary customers are students, employees from the nearby schools and local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenges as the high price of home products and insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be a humble and loyal woman. 

She operates a retail store where she provides secretarial services such as printing, typing, scanning, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stationery and additional work machinery. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail store.

loans.use: to buy stationery and work machinery.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.es:
La Señora Pricila es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo que también le ayuda en su negocio y sus 2 hijos. Ella y su familia viven En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 10 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Doña Pricila el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, calzonetas y otros de esta manera incrementara más sus ventas. Doña Pricila con el préstamo espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. También espera obtener mejores ingresos para tener mejor forma de vida.
Los sueños de Doña Pricila es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de la familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Pricila is a very hard-working person who dedicates 100% of herself to her business.  She lives with her husband, who helps her with the business, and their 2 children.  Doña Pricila and her family live in Choluteca Department in the south of Honduras.  She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years. 
Doña Pricila will invest the loan in the purchase of second-hand clothing, like pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear and other items, to increase her sales.  With the loan, Doña Pricila hopes to exceed her current sales and to meet her customers' needs.  She also hopes to increase her income in order to have a better quality of life. 
Doña Pricila dreams of being able to improve her business, to grow it, and to be able to help her husband with the household and family expenses. 
Choluteca, Honduras - July, 2012

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear and other items for her business.

loans.name: Annah  Loko

texts.en:
Annah is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. For five years, she has been practicing livestock farming to earn a living. She also does crop farming to generate more income. 

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of becoming a large scale farmer in the future. She has requested for a loan of 5,000 KES to buy a goat.

loans.use: to buy a goat

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 45 years old. She is divorced, has no children, and lives in the town of Kaloleni, Kenya.

Kadzo has been selling street food for three years, including dumplings, flat breads, peas, etc.

The loan she has applied for is to buy more products to supply her business and fill orders placed with her. This loan will help her to capitalize herself and continue working. Her goal is to make her business grow, so that she can continue improving her quality of life. Kadzo intends to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, baking powder, etc.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
La señora victorina vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hija y su esposo quienes la apoyan en su actividad comercial, trabajo que realiza desde hace 16 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante ya que visita varias aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su misma comunidad los cuales le encarga y le compran todas las semanas.
Doña Victorina el crédito lo necesita para la compra de camisetas, camisas, jeans, bóxer, faldas, calzonetas, pantalones, blusas etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento es que sus ventas crezca día a día, ya que comprara variedad de producto para satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes, quienes le encargan mercadería seguido.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Victorina es hacer que su negocio crezca, como también generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor vida.

Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Victorina lives in southern Honduras. Her daughter and husband live with her and support her business, which she has been working on for sixteen years in the community where she lives. She is a street vendor and visits several villages and small communities near her own from where she receives orders and makes sales every week. 

Victorina needs this loan in order to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, boxers, skirts, underpants, pants, blouses, etc. The effect she expects from this financing is for sales to increase more and more, since she will purchase a variety of products that will meet the needs of each of the customers who frequently order merchandise from her.

Victorina's plans for the future are to expand her business, as well as to generate better income, so that she can have a better life.

Choluteca, Honduras - July, 2012

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, boxers, skirts, underpants, pants, blouses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester Habita en el Municipio de la Concepcion en el barrio de San  Caralampio, junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio de venta de Ropa, tiene mas de 8 años de estar trabajando en este tipo de negocio y gracias a esto pueden llevar el alimento diara a su hogar. con este Financiamiento comprara nueva Mercaderia: Zapatos, Ropa para niños, Ropa para Adolecentes y Ropas para adultos. con esta nueva inversion doña Maria Ester tendra mejores ingresos para su hogar y sus hijos seran  mas beneficiados y sobre todo por que  ella sueña con tener mejores condiciones en su vida y brindarles mas seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Ester lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood of La Concepcion. 

Together with her husband, she works selling clothing. She has more than 8 years of experience in this kind of work. Thanks to this they can put food on the table. 

With this loan Maria will buy new products: shoes, children's clothing, young-adult clothing, and adult clothing. 

With this new investment, Maria Ester will have greater revenue for home, her children will benefit more, and, above all, achieve her dream of better living conditions to give a greater security to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Maryury  Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de  17,  13 y 10 años de edad que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica al  comercio.

Ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la  venta de todo tipo de ropa, ella instala un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, su esposo se desplaza hasta Bahía y calceta lugar en los cuales también ofrecen sus productos  más que todo en  los días de ferias ya que es allí donde más personas llegan a estas ciudades. Su mercadería  la van a comprar a Perú, Quito,  Guayaquil o Ambato y esto lo realizan cada que necesitan. Tienen más de 20 años que se dedican a esta actividad y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y seguros.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local comercial.
texts.en:
The Tosagua communal bank meets every two weeks in Tosagua, known as a dynamic city where most of the inhabitants are farmers and raise animals since it’s an area with lots of vegetation.

Mayury, 38,  lives here.  She is married and they have three daughters: 17, 13 and 10 who are studying in the university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is in the business.

She and her husband sell all kinds of clothing.  Mayury set up a small stand in the center of the city where many sales people offer their products.  Her husband goes as far as Bahia and Calceta where he also sells their products, especially on market days when more people come to the cities.  They go to Peru, Quito, Guayaquil or Ambato to buy their merchandise whenever they need it.  They have been working in this business for more than 20 years and it’s going well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the bank for 5 years and she likes it because the loans come quickly and they are safe.

Her dream is to have a big commercial stand.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: James  Odemba

texts.en:
James is 50 years old and married with six children who are in school. He sells newspapers and soft drinks to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years. He also does construction to generate more income. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become more business oriented because he has been trained on business management skills. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a construction machine.

loans.use: to buy a construction machine

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam operates a retail shop to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan of 30,000 KES which helped her to buy maize flour and bread for her business. This helped her business to improve and with the additional income, she added stock to her shop. She has requested for another loan to expand her shop and buy additional maize flour and rice for her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and rice

loans.name: Jesee  Karwego

texts.en:
Jesee is 32 years old and married with two children. For the last year, he has been selling clothes to earn a living. He sells clothes specifically to young people and has two employees. 

He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. Jesee dreams of expanding his business and becoming a prominent businessman in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 11 years. She describes herself to be inquisitive. 

She operates a retail business where she sells poultry. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located near schools and hotels and her primary customers are local residents and hotels. She describes her biggest business challenges to be a shortage of funds for improving her business and stiff competition within her business environment. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy poultry for selling so as to meet the customer demand. Her business goal is to be a large-scale poultry farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent business premises. 

This is her first loan. She is also helped with business income by her husband, who supplies clean water to the local residents and town dwellers.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, 26, lives together with her friend at Kakata. She has a child who is one year old. Catherine stopped her education in the tenth grade. For the past ten years she has been selling peppers, onions, Vita (juice drink), palm oil, rice, and other items. She started this business with a little capital that she received from her friend.

Her favorite part of her business is the interaction with customers every day. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she attends to the needs of her son and improves the business.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more peppers, rice, Vita, onions, and palm oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, rice, Vita, onions, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an honest and hardworking woman who has achieved some of the goals she set for herself. With the previous loan, she was able to improve her business and start a kiosk that has increased her sales. Her hope is to expand her businesses and continue providing education to her children.

With this loan, Jane will be able to purchase fruits and vegetables and add stocks of sugar and flour to her kiosk. She promises to make her repayments on time and take another loan so as to continue improving her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, sugar and flour for her kiosk.

loans.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es:
Amalia Rufina tiene 60 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con sus dos hijos de treinta y ocho, treinta años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  MAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Amalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.
texts.en:
Amalia Rufina is 60 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and their two children, who are thirty-eight and thirty years old.  They live in Pueblo Viejo Canton, which is a part of Ventanas, de los Ríos Province.

The members of the communal bank "Unido Somos  Mas" (United We are More) live in El Marañón Precinct, Puerto Pechiche Parish, which is part of Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank make their livings in short-cycle agricultural labors; they plant corn, rice and beans.

Amalia makes her living in agriculture as well.  She plants corn, rice and beans.  She purchases her supplies in the farming supply store Karlita and sells her products at Castillo's Stores.

Amalia is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice and beans and to purchase seeds, urea, agricultural supplies, organic fertilizer and liquid fertilizer for her crops. 

The loan will be a financial help for Amalia and allow her to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are plagues, diseases and changes in the weather.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice and beans, and to purchase seeds, urea, supplies, and natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Oblogo Group

texts.en:
The group Ogblogo is made up of 12 female members. They have been together as a group for three years, and this is their second loan with ID-Ghana. They sell the following commodities; provisions, corn, cassava, sandals, rice, beans, cooking oil, plantain, fish, charcoal, vegetables and detergents. They meet every Friday to discuss business and loan repayments.

Doris, a 48-year-old businesswoman and single mother of an 18-year-old, needs a new loan of GHC 600 in order to buy more items such as provisions, soap and sandals. She is very glad to be helped by Kiva, and her future plans are to increase her operating capital and start building her own house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as provisions, soap, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Angel Gustavo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive el señor Ángel, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. El estudia idiomas en la universidad. Lleva un año  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante y con esto poder continuar con sus estudios.

El tiene un local en la casa de los padres en el cual ofrece el servicio de internet cabinas telefónicas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 ya que a esta hora el tiene que ir a  la universidad, siempre pasa ocupado ya que también realiza trabajos de tipiado y trabajos  en la computadora, tiene tres años con su local y gracias a sus ganancias él puede seguir con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para pagar los servicios de internet y pagos del teléfono, además con esto espera comprar ciertos bocadillos y gaseosas para vender en su local. Está en el Banco Comunal 5 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tosagua meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, which is known to be a very dynamic place where most residents work farming and raising animals because it is an area with lots of vegetation.

That is where Ángel lives. He is 25 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home. He studies languages at the university. He has been with the communal bank for one year and he likes it because they provide him with support so that he can get ahead and stay in school.

He has a business in his parents' home, where he offers Internet services and telephone booths. He works there every day from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, which is when he has to go to university. He is always busy because he also does typing and computer jobs. He has had his business for three years and the income it provides allows him to stay in school.

He is going to use this loan to pay for Internet services and phone bills. He also intends to purchase certain snacks and soft drinks to sell at his business. He has been with the communal bank for five cycles and he enjoys the help the loans provide.
 
His goals are to keep going and finish school.

loans.use: to pay the Internet and telephone bills and to purchase snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Israel 1 Group

texts.en: Mesmin, age 26, is single and has no children. He represents the Israel 1 group. Mesmin owns a small dry cleaning business, which he has been operating for 2 years. He will use his portion of the loan to buy another machine that cleans clothes. This is Mesmin’s 3rd loan from Kiva partner  HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record with HOPE. He hopes to expand his business and, one day, to open a small hotel in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to pay for a new washing machine.

loans.name: Graca

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe e uma sobrinha que vivem com ela. 	
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, porta, cimento, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e concluir o ensino superior, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é estudar mais de modo a concluir o ensino superior no tempo previsto.
texts.en:
She's single and has a son who attends school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her mother and a niece, both of whom live with her.
She's a teacher and a staffer of the Ministry of Education. With this loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (zinc sheets, beams, a door, cement, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she wishes to finish building her house and to graduate from college. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is studying harder in order to complete her higher education within the timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (zinc sheets, beams, a door, cement, etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Israel 2 Group

texts.en: Georgine, 45, is married and has 3 children aged 15 to 19. Two of her children are currently attending school. Georgine also cares for her elderly father. She represents the Israel 2 group. She sells a traditional African food called foufou. She has been selling this in a local market in Brazzaville for 1 year. Georgine plans to use her portion of the loan to buy more foufou from her supplier.  She has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, a Kiva partner. She has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy more foufou (a traditional African food)

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu 1 Group

texts.en: Arlette, age 29, is single and has no children. She is representing the Gloire de Dieu 1 group. Arlette sells women’s make-up and hair supplies. She has had this business for 1 year. She will use her portion of the loan to buy hair extensions, fake eyelashes, and lipstick. Her business strategy is to offer lower prices for customers who buy more at one time. She is able to sell her products quickly and at a profit. This is Arlette’s first loan with HOPE Congo, a Kiva partner.  The HOPE organization and her fellow group members believe she will use this money wisely, and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, fake eyelashes, and lipstick

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu 2 Group

texts.en: Esperance, 46, is a single mother of 2 children, aged 20 and 26 years old. She also cares for her elderly father. Esperance is representing the Gloire de Dieu group 2. She owns a small business selling construction materials, which she has been operating for 1 year. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy sand, stone, and gravel. This is Esperance’s first loan with HOPE Congo, a Kiva partner. The HOPE organization and her fellow group members believe she will use the loan wisely and repay it. Esperance hopes to send her daughter to study overseas one day.

loans.use: to buy cement ,sand, stone, and gravel.

loans.name: Rosa Hermita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer y comerciante.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su esposo para que este lo emplee en su negocio pues él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, él en su carro recorre con sus productos por la ciudad y los campos donde tiene muchos clientes. Ella lleva 8 años con sus ventas mientras que su esposo mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, frutas y legumbres para que su marido venda. Esta desde el inicio   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para ella.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tosagua meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, which is known to be a very dynamic place where most residents work farming and raising animals because it is an area with lots of vegetation.

That is where Rosa lives. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children from this relationship, who are all independent adults. Her husband is a driver and merchant.

She became a merchant in order to earn her own income so that she could get ahead and help her husband with home expenses. She sells all types of clothing. Her sales method is door-to-door, but her best customers also come to her home to make their purchases. She also gives part of the loan to her husband so that he can use it for his business, since he sells fruits and legumes. He travels the city and the fields in his car with his products and has a lot of customers. She has been in business for eight years and her husband has been in his for much longer.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants and blouses, and fruits and legumes for her husband to sell. She has been with the communal bank from the start and enjoys it because the loans allow her to better finance her business. 

Her dream is to buy her own car.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, fruits, and legumes.

loans.name: Rosa Solanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 7 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella junto con el esposo se dedican a la venta de Cd de películas y música pero al por mayor, ellos tienen un local en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan los comerciantes minorista a surtirse de estos productos para luego llevarlos a vender a los diferentes lugares de la ciudad, su esposo viaja cada semana hasta Guayaquil lugar donde compra estos productos pero los de mejor calidad para que sus clientes estén conformes con sus productos, llevan más de 8 años en este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para surtir su negocio de CD de música y películas nuevas ya que en este negocio hay que andar con lo último que salga en audio y videos. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Rosa, 32, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 14, 12, 10 and 7 years old.  The two older ones attend secondary school and the younger ones attend elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband sell music and film CDs at wholesale. They have a store at home where retailers come to stock up on these products to then go resell in various parts of the city.  Her husband travels weekly to Guayaquil to buy said products but of better quality so that their customers will be satisfied with their products.  They’ve been in business more than 8 years and they do very well.

This loan is to stock their business with music and new film CDs because in this business one has to have the latest music and video releases.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the speed with which loans can be obtained.  Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Luvi Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Luvi, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de  17 años, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa dos de ellos estudian en Universidad  y el menor en colegio. Su esposo es mecánico.
 
Ella es licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación y trabaja de maestra en un colegio de la localidad, también se dedica al comercio ya que tiene un  bazar en su casa, allí vende todos tipo de productos como ropa, zapatos, regalos, tarjetas, perfumes entre muchos otros productos, trabaja todos los días y cuando ella está en el colegio dando clases sus hijos son los encargados de atender el negocio hasta cuando ella llegue,  tiene más de 6 años con su bazar y está muy contenta ya que tiene muchos clientes que a diario compran en su negocio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, regalos, tarjetas, perfumes entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local más grande y más surtido de productos.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Luvi, 49, lives here.  She’s married and has four children, three adults and a 17-year-old.  All of her children still live at home and attend university; the youngest is in high school.  Her husband is a mechanic.

She has a bachelor’s degree in education and works as a teacher in a local school.  She’s also a merchant since she has a store at home where she sells all types of products like clothes, shoes, gifts, greeting cards, perfume and many other products.  She works every day and when she’s at school teaching, her children tend to the business until she gets home.  She’s had the store for more than six years and she’s very happy because she has many customers who come by daily to buy from her.

She will use this new loan to buy clothes, shoes, gifts, greeting cards and perfume, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because she started her business with one of its loans.  Her dream is to have a larger, better-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, gifts, greeting cards, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items for her shop as well as wood planks.

loans.name: La Benediction Group

texts.en:
Colere, age 27, is single and has no children. He represents the La Benediction group. Colere has a small boutique where he sells clothing. He will use the loan to reinforce his clothing inventory. 

His business strategy is to offer friendly and polite customer service. He also wants to “charm” his customers and make them feel special when they are shopping. 

Colere has received four previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to have a large store one day with many different types of clothing.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to increase his inventory.

loans.name: María Cesibel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 9, 7 y 2 años,  los dos  estudian en colegio y  uno en escuela. El marido es maestro albañil.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días realizando recorridos puerta a puerta  más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora sus hijos están en la escuela y ahí se le hace más fácil realizar sus ventas, ella deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Lleva 5 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

María, 31, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 12, 9, 7 and 2 years old.  Two attend secondary school and one is in elementary school.  Her husband is a master bricklayer.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own income and help her husband cover household expenses sells clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day going door to door especially in the morning which is when her children are in school and it’s easier to do her selling then.  She sells on credit and collects payments weekly.  She’s been in business five years and does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank five years and likes it because she started the business that today makes it possible for her to get ahead with her first loan.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Yojana Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Yojana, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  15, 11 y 9 años  de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que él en temporadas no tiene trabajo se dedica a la venta toldos, sabanas, toallas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas por dia,  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince u ocho días de acuerdo a como quieran sus clientes. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar edredones, sabanas, toallas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante. 

Su sueño es tener un carro para salir a realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Yojana, 32, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 15, 11 and 9 years old.  The two older ones attend secondary school and the younger one is in elementary school.  Her husband’s a master bricklayer.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income to help her husband meet household expenses since there are times when he has no work sells bedspreads, sheets, towels, comforters, etc. from door to door.  She works every day two to three hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects payment biweekly or weekly according to her customers’ wishes.  She’s been in business four years and does very well.

This loan is to buy comforters, sheets and towels, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because she used her first loan to start this business that today makes it possible for her to get ahead.  Her dream is to own a car to go out to do her rounds in.

loans.use: to buy comforters, sheets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Amen 1 Group

texts.en:
Francoise, age 59, is a widow with six children, ages 27 to 43 years old. She is representing the Amen 1 group. 

Francoise bakes and sells beignets in a local market. She has been operating this business for over 20 years. She has gained a reputation in her community for selling tasty beignets. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her beignets, including flour, sugar, and yeast. 

Her business strategy is to offer good customer service to all customers. She is always friendly and helpful with her customers. 

This is Francoise’s first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva’s partner. Francoise and her group members trust she will use the loan well and repay it.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her beignets, including flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto habitante del Municipio de la Concepcion, junto a su esposa se ha esforzado mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijo y sobre todo en lograr su sueño que es mejorar de vida, actualmente tiene un cultivo de Piña pero necesita darle mantenimiento ya que por las condiciones del clima y las plazas que asechan  a ese tipo de producto requiere mucha dedicacion y de capital para invertir en los siguientes insumos: Fertilizante, Completo, Urea, etc. Gracias a  este nuevo financiamiento don Roberto podra darle el Mantenimiento debido a su cultivo y asi podra vender a un buen precio y sus ingresos  mejoraran en gran manera.  muy agradecido con Afodenic y fondos Kiva por la confianza que le han brindado.
texts.en: Roberto is a resident of the municipality of Concepcion. Along with his wife, he has worked hard to be able to help his children get ahead and especially work towards his dream of improving their quality of life. He currently has a crop of pineapple, but as a result of the climate and the types of bugs that are attracted to this crop, it requires a lot of dedication and he needs to provide maintenance to it. He needs capital to invest in the following supplies: fertilizers, urea and other agricultural products. Thanks to this new loan Roberto will be able to provide maintenance to his crop, and as a result will be able to sell it for a good price which will improve his profits in a big way. He is very thankful to AFODENIC and Kiva for the trust they have in him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su razón principal en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años María se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella se ha hecho cargo de su familia; María es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser Profesora, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinas deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones prepara una deliciosa Chanfainita para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su hermana, María puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de desayunos de manera ambulatoria, todos los días desde tempranas horas ella inicia su labor y puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un triciclo, una cocina pequeña, mesas y sillas para su negocio; de esta manera María contará con el transporte necesario el cual acondicionará y con el equipo necesario para poder vender sus desayunos, así ella espera incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su restaurant y con ello seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is a 43 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her 2 children, whom she loves and who are the main purpose in her life.  Unfortunately, for various reasons, María are her partner separated many years ago.  Since then, she has been responsible for her family.  María is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  Regrettably, she wasn't able to study a professional career, but she would have really liked to be a teacher.  In her free time, she enjoys preparing delicious desserts and on special occasions, she makes a delicious "Chanfainita" (a Peruvian stew containing cow's lung, potatos, etc.) to share with her family.

With a lot of persistance, enthusiasm and thanks to the support of her sister, María started up her own small business selling breakfasts as a street vendor.  Everyday, beginning in the early hours of the morning, she starts her work and can work approximately 10 hours a day.  She thinks it is going well because of the good seasonings she uses and the kind treatment she gives to her customers.

María is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help being offered to her, she will be able to purchase a tricycle (cart), a small stove, tables, and chairs for her business.  In this way, María will have the necessary transportation and equipment to be able to sell her breakfasts.  Thus, she hopes to increase her sales and her income, which will allow her in the not too distant future to open a restaurant, with which she will continue working and struggling so that she and her family can move forward together.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle (cart), a small stove, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Cunegunda Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  18 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella tiene un asadero de pollos en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00h. Ella también por las mañanas  se dedica a lo que es venta de ropa y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), estas ventas también las realiza en su local si es que algún cliente necesita algo. Tiene más de 19  años con su negocio y siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, sodas y varios víveres para preparar los alimentos así como también ropa y productos Yanbal. Lleva 11 años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Tosagua Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  It's known for being a very dynamic place where, because it's an area with a lot of vegetation, the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals.

Monserrate, 38, lives here.  She's married and from this relationship has two daughters, ages 18 and 4.  The older one is a college student.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a rotisserie chicken restaurant in a place she rents downtown.  She works there every day from 2 p.m. until 10 p.m.  Also, in the morning she works selling clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She also sells these things in her place if a customer needs something.  She has had her business for more than 19 years and it always has gone very well for her.

This loan is to buy chicken, soda, and various provisions to make the dishes, as well as clothing and Yanbal products.

She has been in the communal bank for 11 years.  She's the fiscal regulator and she likes it because of the help with loans that the institution gives her.

Her dream is to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soda, provisions, and Yanbal products

loans.name: Carmen Orlinda Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron hace varios años atrás, el que tiene vivo ya es mayor de edad y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir con los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ventas y también por las tardes ella prepara y vende corviches, tortillas y empanadas para lo cual improvisa un pequeño kiosco en la afueras de su casa lugar hasta donde acuden sus clientes en las tardes y noches que es cuando vende sus alimentos,  tiene más  de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Carmen, 62, lives here.  She’s married and had three children but two of them died several years ago.  The surviving one is an adult now but still lives at home.  Her husband’s retired.

She’s a housewife who in order to have her own source of income to contribute towards household expenses works selling all types of clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day at her sales and in the evening makes corviches [deep-fried plantain dough stuffed with fish, peanuts, onions and spices], tortillas and turnovers to sell.  To do so, she improvises a small kiosk outside her house where her customers come by in the evening and at night which is when she sells her food.  She’s been doing this for more than 15 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfume, shoes, creams and cosmetics, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because the group is very united and trustworthy.  Her dream is that she and her family have good health.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Estela Ramona

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Estela, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, cuatro ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno para lo cual se desplaza hasta los campos aledaños a comprar el ganado y luego lo transporta a los centros de faenamiento en la localidad donde vende las vacas a los comerciantes de carne de este lugar, realiza esto por tres a cuatro días por semana ya que también lleva las vacas hasta la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez dos veces a la semana.

Este crédito es para comprar ganado. Lleva cinco ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño es comprar un camión más grande para que su esposo realice su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The “Tosagua” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the residents work in agriculture and in animal husbandry; it’s a zone with much vegetation. 

Estela, 45, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has six children.  Four of them are adults now and two who are 16 and 12 years old attend secondary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She, like a good housewife, is requesting the loan so that her husband can use it in his business.  He buys and sells cattle.  To do so, he heads out to neighboring fields to buy the cattle which he then transports to slaughter houses where he sells the cows to meat merchants there.  He does this for three to four days per week since he also transports cattle to the city of Bahía de Caraquez twice a week.

This loan is to buy cattle.  She’s been in the communal bank for five cycles and likes it because the loans are quick and don’t have so many requirements.  Her dream is to buy a larger truck so that her husband can do his work.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Shelly Dominixts

texts.es:
Shelly es una joven de 20 años la cual es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura y también en la ganadería, posee varios atractivos turísticos entre los cuales encontramos la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando Shelly tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Pizza”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Shelly solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Medico.

Con mucho empeño Shelly trabaja en un supermercado de la ciudad como empleada, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que por las noches y con el fruto de su trabajo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Secretariado ejecutivo; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Shelly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, con la cual podrá realizar sus trabajo y prácticas, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herramienta y le es difícil el cumplir con la realización de sus trabajos, así de esta manera seguirá estudiando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Shelly, 20, is a very hardworking, enthusiastic young woman.  She lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture and animal husbandry are also common here.  It also has several tourist attractions like the Huacachina Lagoon which is visited by many tourists year-round.  When Shelly has free time available she enjoys listening to music very much and takes advantage of some occasions to enjoy one of her favorite dishes: pizza.  Because of Shelly’s limited economic resources she was only able to study up to fifth grade in secondary school but would have liked to study to become a doctor.

Shelly works very hard as an employee in a local supermarket.  She works about 8 hours per day and at night, thanks to her efforts at work, is taking an executive secretary course.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s responsible and very much wants to get ahead.

Shelly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help  they are giving her she will be able to buy a computer that she will be able to use to do her work and homework since she currently does not own this tool and it’s difficult to do her assigned work without it.  In this way, she will continue studying and striving to make her greatest dream a reality: to be a great professional and her parents’ source of pride.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
