texts.fr: jeanne set une femme âgée de 28 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants tous sont scolarisés.Elle est commerçante et vend les arachides en gros et en détail dans un mar ché de la capitale  depuis 04 ans.Sa gentillesse ,son acceuil et son dynamisme lui ont permis d'acquerir une clientèle considérable qu'elle ne parvient plus à satisfaire à cause de la rupture permanente des stocks.Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les marchandises en gros(deux sacs d'arachides) afin de relevé son chiffre d'affaire et mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.Les bénéfices engendrés lui permettront d'etendre son activité,assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 28-year-old single woman and the mother of two children who both attend school.  

She has been selling peanuts, retail and wholesale, in a market of the capital city for the past four years.  Thanks to her kindness, her warm welcome and her enthusiasm, she has managed to build a very large customer base.  However, she can no longer meet all of her customers' needs because she is constantly out-of-stock.

She is requesting a loan to buy some merchandise in bulk (two sacks of peanuts), in order to increase her turnover and to better meet her customers' demand.

She will use her profits to expand her business, to ensure that her children go to school and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of peanuts.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru:
Абдувахоб проживает в городе Истаравшан. Он женат. Ему 54 года. У него двое детей. Абдувахоб живет с женой. Его жена портниха. Сам Абдувахоб занимается торговлей и починкой швейных машинок. У него имеется собственная мастерская, где он ремонтирует и занимается купле - продажей швейных машинок. Этим видом деятельности Абдувахоб занимается 15 лет. Он является хорошим мастером. 
Абдувахоб просит кредит для приобретения новых швейных машинок, с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Abduvahob lives with his wife in the city of Istaravshan. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a seamstress, and he sells and repairs sewing machines. He has his own workshop, where he fixes, buys and sells the machines. 

Abduvahob has done this kind of work for 15 years, and has shown himself to be a skilled repairman. He has requested a loan to acquire new sewing machines, with the goal of increasing the variety of his merchandise.

loans.use: to acquire new sewing machines

loans.name: Monandniso

texts.ru: Монанднисо торгует на вещевом рынке женскими плащами и пальто.   У её бизнеса сезонный характер и поэтому, она нуждается в нашем кредите пока у неё не сезон.   Монанднисо выдала дочь замуж и у неё много расходов по поводу свадебных мероприятий.   Её муж находится в России на заработках и ежемесячно присылает деньги,  но его доходы тоже непостоянные.   Она получает кредит в шестой раз и старается не подводить нас и целенаправленно использовать кредит.  На полученный кредит она хочет купить ювелирные изделия на преданное дочери.   Она всегда  рассчитывает на нашу поддержку и благодарит нашу организацию за понимание.
texts.en:
Monandniso sells women's rain jackets and coats at the local market. Her business is seasonal, so she is in need of a loan until the off-season ends. Monandniso has arranged a marriage for her daughter, and is facing many expenses associated with the wedding. Her husband is in Russia as a migrant worker and sends money home every month, but his income is also irregular. 

This is Monandniso's sixth loan, and she strives to use the loans effectively and not let the microfinance institution down. She wants to use this loan to buy jewelry for her daughter's dowry. She always counts on the institution's support, and thanks the organization for its understanding.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for her daughter

loans.name: Phoebe  Asiyo

texts.en: Phoebe is a hardworking business lady. She is married and has two children who are in school. She sells second-hand clothes to make a living. She has been operating this business for three years. Her prospective buyers are mainly men and women. Previously, she used to be employed. Phoebe dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Tersita is 52-years-old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

Teresita has a farming agriculture products business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 10,000 to repair the farm house. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve living conditions by using the profits of the farm products.

loans.use: to repair the farmhouse.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 36-years-old and lives in the town of Kaloleni in the coastal region of Kenya. He is single and has no children. For the past nine years, Gideon has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells rice, biscuits, soda, flour, etc.

To help expand his business, Gideon has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more cooking fat, rice, flour and other goods for his business and will help him to generate greater profits and allow him to buy more goods to sell. Gideon hopes that in the future he will be able to sell more quality products and open another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more cooking fat, rice, flour and other goods for his business.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael sells used shoes to earn a living. She is requesting her second loan from Faulu Kenya for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy shoes to sell. Her previous loan was also used to help her buy shoes. With the loan, she was able to improve her business as her profits increased and with  the additional income, she added more stock.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Genrri

texts.es:
Genrri tiene 27 años, es un hombre alegre, emprendedor y con ganas de superación. Su pareja es Inés, quien es comerciante, tienen un hijo de 6 años, por quien se esfuerza en salir adelante. Su casa es propia, la cual compró con el apoyo de su pareja.
Su trabajo es brindar servicio de trasporte de pasajeros. Tiene dos motocarros que compró con sus ahorros, de los cuales uno conduce él, mientras que el otro lo da en alquiler. Lleva en este negocio más de 6 meses. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, organiza su propio tiempo y horario, genera sus propios ingresos económicos con los cuales puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar, y brindarle la mejor educación a su hijo. Hace poco tiempo ha establecido un negocio de venta de frutas, pero no está abastecido totalmente, es por eso que quiere hacer crecer este negocio y obtener mayores ganancias en beneficio de su familia. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento. Sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, y está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal, ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará frutas (naranjas, aguaje, mandarina y otros) con los que implementará su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Genrri  is 27 years old, and is a cheerful and enterprising man who is eager to excel. His partner is Inés, who is a businesswoman. They have a six-year-old child, for whom they work hard to succeed. His house is his own, which he bought with the support of his partner.
His job is to provide the service of passenger transport. He has two pedicabs that he bought with his savings, one of which he drives himself, while the other he rents out. He has been in this business for more than six months. What he likes about his work is that it is independent, in that he organizes his own time and schedule, and that he generates his own economic income with which he can support the economy of his home and provide his son with a better education. Recently he established a business selling fruit, but it is not completely stocked. It is because of this that he wants to grow his business and obtain higher earnings to benefit his family.
This is his second loan with MFP, and that is why he is thankful to all of the people who continue trusting him to again give him access to this funding.  He knows that he will again have to be very responsible and above all very punctual, and he is happy to belong to his communal bank since he sees that they are very supportive.
With the requested loan of 1200 Nuevos Soles, he will buy fruit (oranges, aguajes, tangerines, and others) with which he will set up his stall.

loans.use: to buy fruit (oranges, aguajes, tangerines, and others) with which he will set up his stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abesamihigo A /rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo A. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les réalisateurs des performances». Il a 54 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 10 ans à 34 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie d’acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la capacité de son agriculture de riz et demande d’autres prêt pour financer de plus son affaire. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur  cultivateur de riz dans la vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Abesamihigo A group, the name of which means “those who perform”. He is 54 years old and married, and he has six children, from 10 to 34 years old. All of them have had schooling. He has one person to support other than his children, and he has three years of secondary education. 

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his fourth one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to buy more fields to increase capacity, as well as to request further loans to increase his business financing. In the next few years, Jean Bosco would like to be the best rice farmer in the region. With the profits, he plans on educating his children and paying their medical expenses

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 54 años, es una mujer alegre y luchadora. Está casada con Amancio, quien es jubilado, vive en su casa propia, la cual construyó con el apoyo de su esposo. Tienen cuatro hijos, viven con ellos y su nuera.

Tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, ahí atiende todos los días, desde muy temprano, de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, con quienes tiene una relación de amistad y respeto durante los 10 años que viene funcionando su bodega. Generalmente atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su nuera. Adquiere su mercadería quincenalmente de la ciudad principal de su distrito, ubicada a una hora de viaje desde el lugar donde vive. Le agrada su negocio, ya que le permite estar en casa durante el día y participar en las actividades escolares de sus hijos menores. Así mismo, el ingreso económico que obtiene le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta la fecha tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y realizar la ampliación y mejora de su pequeña tienda.

Este es su crédito numero 9 con la institución MFP y está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores. Le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo del que forma parte, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará más abarrotes, al por mayor, como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas descartables y bebidas envasadas, etc.
texts.en:
54-year-old Gladis is a cheerful and tenacious woman.  She is married to Armancio who is retired.  Gladis lives in her own home which she built with her husband's support.  The couple have four children.  They live with their children and their daughter-in-law.

Gladis has a small grocery store in her home where she serves her customers every day from very early in the morning.  She is very friendly and kind to all her customers who are mainly neighbors.  She has enjoyed a friendly, respectful relationship with them during the ten years that she has been running her store.  She generally works alone but sometimes has help from her daughter-in-law.  Gladis buys her stock every two weeks in the main city in her district, which is one hour's journey from her home.  She likes her business because it allows her to be at home during the day and help her younger children with their school work.  Also, the income she makes helps her to cover her household's basic expenses.  Given the good results that she has had up to now, she plans to continue in her business and both expand and improve her small store.

This is Gladis' ninth loan from MFP and she is very determined to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  She very much enjoys belonging to her group as all the members are very punctual and responsible.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, candies, soda, drinks, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as sugar, milk, noodles, candies, soda, drinks, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Mkwalia Group

texts.en:
Mwashabani, who is in her late 30s, is single with two boys who still go to school. She has had a cafe business for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

She requested a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cafe stock and pay her boys' school fees, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more cafe stock. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big grocery business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mkwalia," which has eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  buy more cafe stock.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is 42 years old, married, and has five children. 

She operates a restaurant to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. Besides, she does farming to supplement her income. 

Dorcus dreams of expanding her business in the future and employing more people. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42 years old, married, and has four children. 

He operates a food stall in a conducive environment to earn a living. He has been in this business for six years and has employed three people. Besides, James does farming to supplement his income. 

James dreams of operating a restaurant in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married and has one child, who is in school. 

She operates a pharmacy to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for four years. She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She has also learnt how to save and manage her business because she has been trained on business management. 

Elizabeth dreams of operating a clinic in the future. She has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to buy medicines.

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 42 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Angeline has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 38,000 to be used in purchasing feed for the hogs.
 
Angeline has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Angeline hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married, with three children. She sells clothes in a competitive business environment to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for 11 years. In addition, Mary does crop farming to supplement her income. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save and to keep records of her business transactions. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With 20,000 KES, Mary will buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora. Está casada con Asunción, quien es jubilado, con él tiene cuatro hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad. Ahora vive en compañía de su esposo, dos de sus hijos y un nieto, en la casa que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja.

Su trabajo es la  venta de ropa y calzado de diversas marcas y modelos, los cuales trae según el gusto y el pedido que su cliente. Afortunadamente tiene buena acogida y no ha tenido problemas al realizar la cobranza, ya que su clientela son básicamente personas que trabajan en instituciones privadas y reconoce fácilmente a aquellos que demuestran responsabilidad. Todas las prendas que venden son de reconocidas marcas y eso le permite obtener buenas ganancias por cada venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo por casi 5 años, trabaja sola y con mucha alegría. 

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen lo posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará prioritariamente zapatos para hombre y mujeres, para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
60-year-old Isabel is a very cheerful, dynamic and entrepreneurial woman.  She is married to Asunción who is retired.  The couple have four grown-up children.  Isabel now lives together with her husband, two of her children and a grandson.  They live in a house that she managed to build with her other half's help.

Isabel's business is selling different brands and styles of clothing and footwear.  She buys her merchandise based on her customers' orders and requirements.  Fortunately, her business is popular and she doesn't experience any problems in collecting payment for her goods because her customers are all people who work in private institutions and she finds it easy to spot those who are responsible.  All the items of clothing that she sells are well-known brands and this allows her to make good profits on each sale.  She has been in this line of work for almost five years.  She works alone and really enjoys what she does.

This is Isabel's fourth loan from MFP.  She is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue achieving her aims.  Once again, she is very much committed to making her loan repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.

Isabel will use most of the 2,000 soles she has requested to buy men's and women's shoes so that she can continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. 

She sells clothes in a busy environment to earn a living. She has employed two people in her business. She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. 

Esther has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 41 years old and is from Kaloleni. He is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 5 years.

Wilson has operated a retail fish-selling business since 2010. He asked Yehu for this loan in order to buy more stock of fish. He also sells juice and ice cream from his home.

His ambition is to open a cereal shop. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve his ambition by increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old and married. 

To earn a living, he runs a motorcycle transport business in a competitive environment. He has engaged in this business for three years. 

Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, Joseph hopes that his business will improve in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn is 57 years old. She is married and lives with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rope for more than two years, earning roughly $2 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 each day. 

Noeurn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a very hardworking woman, with a lot of experience in her work. She is still in her retail shop, which has given her a better chance to cover most of her household expenses. 

Emily is requesting a new loan, which will enable her to improve her shop. With the previous loan, she managed to add inventory to her store. This loan is intended to be used to purchase sugar, tea leaves, beans, flour, and other basic commodities. She hopes to expand her business and own several other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, beans, flour, and other basic commodities for her store.

loans.name: Phannara

texts.en: Phannara is 30 years old. She is married and lives with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phannara is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold, who does tailoring for a living, had previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material to make clothes. He is now requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy an electric sewing machine. Arnold's dream is to help establish a clothing industry in the future.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine and cloth material to make clothes.

loans.name: Tubandanye Group

texts.fr:
Régine fait partie du groupe Tubandanye et  habite à Ruyigi. Elle a 50 ans et est mariée à Sillas, commerçant de restaurant. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants,  dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  restaurant depuis  3ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de produits vivriers (haricot, oignon, huile de palme,…) à revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus.

 Les gains de son commerce font vivre  sa famille.
texts.en:
Régine is a part of the Tubandanye group and lives in Ruyigi. She is 50 years old and is married to Sillas, who runs a resturant. She has been involved in the restaurant for three years.

Together they have six children, with two going to school. 

She is on her 8th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of staple foods (beans, onions, palm oil,...) to cook and sell in the restaurant to earn more income. Profits from this business will go towards supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy staple foods (beans, onions, palm oil,...) to use in her restaurant

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
Judith, who is in her early 30s, is married and has a son and a daughter who go to school. She has been selling soft drinks, groundnuts and cake of different types since 2005. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requested a fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a business freezer, a machine used for processing groundnuts, and ice-cream equipment, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She hopes for a loan to open her new soft-drinks business. Judith's dream is to one day be able to open her own company to supply soft drinks and related items.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Venezuela," which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open her new soft drinks business.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon is 64 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. 

Mon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a sewing machine for her children to run a sewing shop. This purchase will help her children generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a clothes shop and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her children to run a sewing shop.

loans.name: Sareith

texts.en:
Sareith is 37 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $3 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Sareith is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed in order to produce a calf to sell. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed in order to produce a calf to sell.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen operates a grocery store for a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to buy tomatoes, onions and bananas. This helped her to grow her business, and with the income she generated she was able to support her family. 

Maureen dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a new loan of 50,000 KES to buy onions, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ripe bananas to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 22 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is a single man.  He has been in the farming business for the past two years with the monthly income of about KES 3,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Wilson will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his siblings up to university level.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old and a businessman He is married to Margaret who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child.  He has been running an electronic shop for the past six years with the monthly income of about KES 5,400 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Daniel will use the loan to buy more stock of electronics. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 74 years old and lives in Lutao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 5 children. She has a general store selling a variety of consumable products. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as toothpaste and shampoo as well as food and beverages.

Narcisa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as toothpaste and shampoo as well as food and beverages.

loans.name: Shumi

texts.en:
Shumi is fifty seven years old and supporting two members of her family. She is blessed with two children. She has been in the business of dress making. Shumi will use the loan to purchase more stock of cloth materials for her business.

She has been in this business for a period of three years now and it earns her a monthly income of fifty two thousand.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the anticipated profit to add more materials, with hope that in future she will be an international designer.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cloth materials

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en: Fidelis is 40 years old, married with six children who are in school. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. Besides, she does farming to generate more income. Fidelis dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Sok Lim

texts.en: Sok Lim is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has been working at a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Lim is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase rice to store and resell when the price is higher. In addition, a part of this money will be used to pay for the electricity connection. This money will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store and resell when the price is higher

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea is 49 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working at a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $9 each per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chea is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her expand her rice farm and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has been running a retail shop for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 13,000 which he uses to support his family. Having repaid his previous loans, he is now requesting his third from KADET LTD to purchase a water tank.

With the anticipated profit from the business, Anhony will educate his children. His dream is to open a wholesale shop which will help him to better meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She sells various goods, such as lotions, soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil, from a kiosk that operates from 6 AM until 8 PM every day. She currently operates this store on her own but her children assist her during the weekend.  Salma has operated her kiosk for one year.

Salma is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy various goods, such as flour, soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She plans to use the profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a little house in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar. His wife, whose name is Tungalag, is 49 years old and works for a private pawnshop. His daughter is a translator. 

Ganbold has conducted a taxi service since 1997, in which he transports passengers from the international airport to the center of the city. Usually he transports foreign passengers, and he knows a few foreign languages to make them comfortable. He has such experience at driving quickly and safety. His father was driver, too, and he likes his business. 

Ganbold's car is getting old.   He would like to change his car for a new one, and as time passes, the price of fuel is getting high in Mongolia. Therefore he needs 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a new car "Prius" for his taxi service. 

Ganbold's goal is to grow and expand his business. He is an honest, hardworking, and friendly man.

loans.use: To purchase a new car "Prius" for his taxi service

loans.name: Otto Olmedo

texts.es:
OTTO OLMEDO tiene 57 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene hijos, vive con la esposa y con el nieto de 13 años de edad en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

OTTO OLMEDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada semana. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura y al vender los productos podrá cancelar la deuda.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las pequeñas enfermedades de la familia. El sueño es trabajar este año para mejorar la condición de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce los fines de semana en la casa con todos los hijos.
texts.en:
Otto Olmedo is 57 years old, married, and has children. He lives with his wife and 13-year-old grandson in Ventanas, a city in the province of Los Ríos. 

He is a member of the "Bruniquilde" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members earn their livings in agricultural work. 

Otto Olmedo earns a living cultivating maize and beans. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure, and weed killer. 

He will buy these products in the city each week. With the help of the loan, he can invest in agriculture and upon selling the crops he can eliminate the debt. He faces challenges such as minor illnesses in the family. 

His dream is to work this year to improve his living conditions. 

In his free time, he likes to spend time with all of his children on weekends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, manure, and weed killer.

loans.name: Sara Priscila

texts.es:
Sara tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de dieciciete y quince años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Sara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una camioneta para poder trasladar el producto que se cosecha. En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse de los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en: Sara Priscila, 37, is in a common-law marriage, and lives with her husband and their 2 children, ages 15 and 17. They live in the Pueblo Viejo canton, which is part of Los Rios province. The members of the "Unidos Somos" (We are United) communal bank live in Puerto Pechiche parish, in El Marañon district, which is part of the Puerto Viejo canton. This members of the communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. Sara works in agriculture, and grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at Karlita Agricultural Supply, and sells her produce at Castillo market. She is applying for the loan to grow corn, rice and beans and to buy seed, urea, agricultural supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer for her crops. The support of the loan would help her to cover her financial needs. She faces challenges such as pests, crop diseases, and variations in the climate. With the help of the loan, it will be easier for her to acquire the necessary agricultural supplies. Her dream is to buy a truck to transport the products that she harvests. In her free time she likes to do housework.

loans.use: To grow corn, rice, beans and to buy seeds, agricultural supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana Elisa

texts.es:
Juana  tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión Libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de diez y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  en el mercado de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para hacer una casa para la familia. En su  tiempo libre se ocupa de los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en: Juana Elisa is 32 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 10 and 7) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Ventanas Province in Los Ríos. The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans. Juana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies wholesale and sells her products at a market in Ventanas. Juana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops. With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Acquiring this loan will help her secure supplies more easily. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house for her family. During her free time, Juana Elisa enjoys keeping herself busy by performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Armando Pedro

texts.es:
Armando tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión Libre junto a su esposo y su hija de un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Armando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder ampliar la casa que en la actualidad posee para el bienestar de la familia. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Armando Pedro is 27 and lives in a common law relationship with his wife and their one year old daughter. They live in Pueblo Viejo canton, part of the Ventanas province in Los Rios. The members of the UNIDOS SOMOS Communal Bank are located in the El Marañón area of Puerto Pechiche parish in Pueblo Viejo canton. This group works in short cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans. Armando plants corn, rice and beans. He buys his products at Karlita Agricultural Supply and sells them at the Castillo Market. He is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, agricultural supplies, manure and liquid fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. He confronts challenges such as pest infestations and diseases and changes in the weather. It will be easier to obtain supplies with the help of this loan. His dream is to be able to expand the house he currently has in order to make his family more comfortable. In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice and beans and buy seeds, agricultural supplies, manure and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en: Chrispine is 29 years old, married with two children who are in school. To earn a living, he operates a retail shop in a busy environment with reliable customers. He has been in this business for one year. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his saving culture because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Chrispine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy bales of maize flour and sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy bales of maize flour and sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is from the village of Owaon. She is 55 years old. Elma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Elma raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years with an approximate average monthly profit of 7,000 PHP. 

In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Elma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Elma's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog fattening.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is kind Iraqi woman who gave a warm welcome to her home for the loan team visiting her. She is 57 years old and has 3 children living with her and her husband. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Aisha is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 12 years experience with the small home-based sewing and tailoring business and has earned a good reputation with her basic but great quality services. She would like to improve her work and offer more to her customers. She would like to renew her work area, buy an overlock machine, and a table for ironing.

To be able to pay for these purchases she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD.

loans.use: to renew her work area and buy an overlock machine and a table for ironing

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en:
Kalume is 36 years old. He is married and has four children. He began his own business in animal sales one year ago, selling at the market. Now, he is one of the best and most successful businessmen in the local market. Thanks to his work, he attracts a lot of customers. He earns additional income from farming, which is mostly done by his wife.

Kalume wants to buy more goats so he can develop his business. However, he does not have the money to do this. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more goats for sale. In this way, he will be able to provide his family with quality living conditions. He promises to make his payments on time. He awaits your support and thanks you.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old and married with one child. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for two years. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Joyce has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management skills. She dreams of operating more outlets in different locations in the future. 

Joyce is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is now 38 years old and happily married to Rose. They are blessed with two children. He is a taxi operator and will use the loan to buy a new engine and other spare parts for his taxi.

Joseph has been in this business for four years now. This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD. He will use the anticipated profits to diversify his business. He hopes to support his family comfortably.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Angel Esteban

texts.es:
Angel Esteban tiene 48 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y sus cinco hijos de ceinte y dos, veinte y uno, dieciocho, quince y cinco años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Angel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y poder comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca y poder sembrar aún más para aumentar los ingresos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Angel Esteban is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and five children (22, 21, 18, 15, and 5 years old) in the Pueblo Viejo canton in Ventanas in the Los Rios province. The members of the community bank Unido Somos are located in the El Marañón area of the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This group works with short cycle farmers who plant corn, rice, and beans. Angel is a farmer who plants corn, rice, and beans. He purchases his products at the Karlita Agricultural Supply store and sells them at Castillo market. He is asking for this loan because in order to plant corn, rice and beans, he needs to buy seeds, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer for the crops. The support of this loan will help him economically and enable him to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as infestations, diseases, and changes in weather, and with the help of the loan, it will be easier to purchase supplies. His dream is to be able to purchase a farm and plant more crops to increase his income. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Alberto Noe

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y a su hija de dos años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Alberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Alberto Noe is 27 years old. He lives in a civil union with his wife and two-year-old daughter in the Pueblo Viejo Canton, which is part of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank "UNIDO SOMOS", ("We Are United"), which is located in the El Marañón district in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton. This group works in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans. Alberto works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. He buys his products at the Karlita agricultural supply center, and sells them at the Castillo market. He is requesting the loan to grow corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, supplies, manure and liquid fertilizers for his crops. The support of the loan will help him financially to meet his needs and to face challenges such as pests, crop diseases, and the variability of the climate. With the help of the loan, it will be easier for him to buy supplies. His dream is to be able to buy another field for planting and to be able to produce a larger crop. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to grow corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, supplies, manure and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old, married and has four children. Aside from being a farmer, he also manages a small furniture-making business. He makes cabinets, tables and chairs. From his business, he is able to generate income for his family but it is just enough for their sustenance. He aims to improve it and save funds for future expenses of the family. He is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy wood, varnish and sand paper for use in his furniture-making business. This will help improve his output and he may be able to offer the furniture at a higher cost. 

Someday, Jose hopes to achieve continuous income and give a better way of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish and sand paper for use in his furniture-making business

loans.name: Jacinto Inocente

texts.es:
Jacinto  tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz, fréjol y comprar  semillas,insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para los posterior venderlos a un buen precio.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio, comprarse una finca y maquinaria para poder producir más.

Le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Jacinto, 32, and his wife have two children, 11- and 7-years old, respectively.  They live in Pueblo Viejo, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.

The UNIDO SOMOS community bank is located in El Maranon, a rural town in Pueblo Viejo.  The bank's members earn their livings from farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice and beans.

Jacinto, too, grows maize, rice and beans.  He buys what he needs from Comercial Agro and sells what he produces to Castillo.

Jacinto is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc.--for his next planting of maize, rice and beans.  The investment will provide the inputs he needs to bring in a good harvest and get the best price for his crop.  Your loans will help him to make enough money to support himself and his family and overcome the various challenges he faces, from plant diseases to poor weather.  For the future, he wants to buy more land and machinery so that he can expand his farming business.

In his spare time, Jacinto likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Abadahemuka /shr Group

texts.fr:
Philippe fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka.Le nom du groupe signifie «Les fidèles». Il a 35 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 1 ans à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Philippe est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités de la culture de riz et d’utiliser des fertilisants sélectionné pour augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Philippe voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans la vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philippe is a member of the Abadahemuka group. The group’s name means “the faithful.” He is 35 years old and married, with six children ranging from one to 13 years of age. Four of the children are in school. His educational level is six years of primary school.

Philippe is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.
In order to develop his agricultural business, he plans to request other loans in order using choice fertilizers to increase his production. In the years to come, Philippe would like to become one of the best rice farmers in the valley. He plans to use his revenues to  cover the education and healthcare costs for his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay labour costs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Perfecto Wellington

texts.es:
Perfecto  tiene 54 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 25, 22 y 14 años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Perfecto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz,fréjol  y comprar semillas, insumos, urea, fertilizantes, insumos agrícolas para antener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar maquinaria para poder ahorrase en el alquiler de la misma para poder trabajar el terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Perfecto, 54, and his wife have three children, 25-, 22- and 14-years old, respectively.  They live in Pueblo Viejo, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.

The UNIDO SOMOS community bank is located in El Maranon, a rural town in Pueblo Viejo.  The bank's members earn their livings from farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice and beans.

Perfecto, too, grows maize, rice and beans.  He buys what he needs from Comercial Agro and sells what he produces to Castillo.

Perfecto is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc.--for his next planting of maize, rice and beans.  The investment will provide the inputs he needs to bring in a good harvest and get the best price for his crop.  Your loans will help him to make enough money to support himself and his family and overcome the various challenges he faces, from plant diseases to poor weather.  For the future, he wants to buy the farm machinery that he needs so that he can avoid the expense of renting it.

In his spare time, Perfecto likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Christian Erdulfo

texts.es:
CHRISTIAN TIENE 22 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS.

CHRISTIAN ES ESTUDIANTE DE LA UNIVERSIDAD Y A LA VEZ ES PROFERSOR PRIVADO DE NIÑOS  EL DINERO NECESITA PARA COMPRAR UNA COMPUTADORA PARA LOS TRABAJOS QUE LE EXIGE LA UNIVERSIDAD, EL DINERO LO VA AYUDAR A COMPRAR EN EFECTUVO LA HERRAMIENTA DE ESTUDIO.

EL SUEÑO ES PODER SEGIUR ESTUDIANDO TENER UNA PROFESION Y TENER UN TRABAJO ESTABLE PARA PORDER AYUDAR A SUS PADRES. EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA DORMIR.
texts.en:
Christian is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas. 

Christian is a university student and, at the same time, a private tutor for children. 

He needs the loan to buy a computer because of the work required by the university. The money will help him buy his "studying tool" in cash. 

His dream is to continue studying, make a career for himself, and get a stable job so he can help his parents. 

In his free time, he likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Hilmi

texts.en:
Hilmi is 40 years old and married, with three children between the ages of six and sixteen years old. 

Hilmi has worked in milk production for more than three years. He represents a company called "Abi."  He sells and distributes milk products in different markets in his local area. To better support his family and earn extra income, he works during the night as a steward in a restaurant as well. 

For the first time, Hilmi is requesting a loan to repair the freezer for his milk and support his milk production.  The loan will enable him to store milk products and prevent spoiling or decay for a longer time.  He hopes in the future to expand his business and obtain an employee. His goal is to offer better living conditions and better education for his children. 

He thanks all KIVA lenders!

loans.use: To repair his freezer for milk

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 27 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living, she sells cosmetics and shoes in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has been in this business for three years. 

Dorcas is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy cosmetics and shoes. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved economically because she has been trained on business management. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD of KES 10,000, after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Ygnacio Cecilio

texts.es:
Ygnacio  tiene 66 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y los nietos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 8 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Ygnacio  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener buena salud y que les vaya bien en la cosecha de los cultivos.
Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Ygnacio, 66, and his wife live with their grandchildren in Pueblo Viejo, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  They have 8 children.

The UNIDO SOMOS community bank is located in El Maranon, a rural town in Pueblo Viejo.  The bank's members earn their livings from farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice and beans.

Ygnacio has grown maize, rice and beans for 15 years.  He buys what he needs from Comercial Lopez in Ventanas and sells what he produces in Ventanas and El Maranon.

Ygnacio is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his next crop.  Your loans will help him to make enough money to support himself and his family and overcome the various challenges he faces, from plant diseases to poor weather.  For the future, he hopes for good health and a successful harvest.

His greatest pleasure is working his land.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old and married, with five children who are in school. 

She sells clothes to earn a living. She has engaged in this business since the year 2000. Jane has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her improve her business. She has also learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy clothes for sale. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 29 years old, has been selling fruits to earn a living for six years, a business she operates in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Lucy says that through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management skills. 

Now requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits, Lucy dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her business.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 37 years old and works hard operating a livestock business, selling at the local market. Since 2007, he has been running his business which has been profitable and sustains his family. He lives with his wife and daughter in their own house in the Kaloleni district. Antony mostly sells cattle though he at times, goats. He buys his animals, raises them for awhile and then sends them to the market. He says that his aim is to own a wholesale business in the future. With this loan, he will be able to purchase more cattle for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 26 years old, married and has two children who are in school. Edwin does tailoring in a busy environment. He has been engaged in this business for two years and employs two people. Edwin also does farming to supplement his income. Edwin's dream is to expand his business in the future and employ more people. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a machine and fabric.

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en: Khamis is a 48-year-old married man with 10 children living in Kaloleni, Kenya. He has been running a coconut-selling business for six years. He started with 3,000 KES and now has over 30,000 KES as working capital. His hardships are the seasonal nature of the business and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home, while his business goals are expanding his business and to own a wholesale operation. Khamis wants a loan to buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Kasoso Baji

texts.en:
Kasoso still runs a bakery business, and the business is doing well, for the past 20+ years with great success. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase more sugar, more baking flour, and  cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business and pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to have a well known business and a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase new ovens, baking flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Francisca Bremilda

texts.es:
Francisca  tiene 64 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los nietos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 7 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Francisca  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta realizar sus tareas dentro de su hogar y ayudar al esposo en la cosecha.
texts.en:
Francisca, 64, and her husband live with their grandchildren in Pueblo Viejo, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  They have 7 children.

The UNIDO SOMOS community bank is located in El Maranon, a rural town in Pueblo Viejo.  The bank's members earn their livings from farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice and beans.

Francisca has grown maize, rice and beans for 8 years.  She buys what she needs from Comercial Lopez in Ventana and sells what she produces in the markets at Ventanas and El Maranon.

Francisca is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her next crop.  Your loans will help her to make enough money to support herself and her family and overcome the various challenges she faces, from plant diseases to poor weather.  For the future, she wants to buy a house of her own.

She enjoys taking care of her house and helping her husband on the farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
“Sombreros, carritos de madera, bolsos típicos, boleros y collares en eso invertiré el dinero” menciono Cecilia del Carmen, integrante del grupo Chocolate originarios de Masaya cuna del Folclor Nicaragüense. Ella desde hace 15 años es comerciante de artesanías y productos típicos negocio que ha ido aumentando por medio de los créditos.
Las otras integrantes son Ángela del Socorro quien desde hace 9 años  vende palomitas y chicharrón de soya; y Epifanía de los Reyes se dedica al comercio de artesanías
texts.en:
Hats, little wood wagons, typical bags, jackets and necklaces, are what Cecilia del Carmen mentions that she will use her loan for.  She is a member of the Chocolate group, from Masaya, the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore.  She has been selling handicrafts and typical products for 15 years and her sales have increased because of the loans.

The other members of the group are Ángela del Socorro who has been selling popcorn and fried soy pork,  and Epifania de los Reyes who sells handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy typical products such as hats, little wood wagons, typical bags, jackets and necklaces

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, a primary milk producing area. He has two children.  He has been doing this work for 12 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy poultry. Jason is currently running a business, and these are his first farm animals (which is why the photo does not reflect any chickens).

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "He is able to plan his work, and no one harasses or follows him around -- it gives him satisfaction!" His biggest challenge is "lack of enough capital for expansion and bad debtors."

Jason was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "He learnt from his friends who are members of Juhudi Kilimo."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "how to make use of the loan wisely and avoid default."

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Jason replied that he will generate more income and take his children to good schools.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jason owns the following:  a cow, poultry, and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in his household a mosquito net, a TV, and a DVD, but he does not have electricity, solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 39 years old and married with one child.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by planting seedlings in the Philippines. Liberata is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional seed and fertilizer for her business.

Liberata has been planting seedlings for 27 years and earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married with one child in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sugar, spices, soap, and shampoo. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Las Nicaragüenses Group

texts.es:
“Antes me dedicaba a la agricultura, con los créditos empecé a destazar cerdo” dijo Nemesia del Carmen  de 67 años, coordinadora del grupo las Nicaragüenses. Ella desde hace 14 años se dedica al destace de cerdo y la venta de sus derivados (nacatamales, chicharrón,  frito…etc).
Las otras integrantes son Alma quien desde hace 8 años tiene una pulpería y Yolanda quien tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
"Previously, I was a farmer; with the loans I began to butcher hogs," said Nemesia del Carmen, who is 67 years old, and coordinator of the 'Las Nicaraguenses' group. She has been butchering hogs for some 14 years, selling the resulting product for making 'nacatamales' [the national dish], pork cracklings, fried pork, etc.

The other members are Alma, who has operated a general store for roughly 8 years, and Yolanda, who has had her small store for some 6 years.

loans.use: buy hogs for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for fishing.

Letecia has been in this business for 21 years.  She also earns income from her general store.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for fishing

loans.name: Raymond Elysee

texts.fr: Elysée est un homme de 38 ans, marié, père de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 25 ans, trois de ses enfants vont à l'école.Il est commerçant et a ouvert un bar dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis trois ans. Son activité fonctionne bien grâce à son accueil chaleureux et sa petite expérience, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroît au fil du temps. Il a juste un problème d'insuffisance de son stock de boissons dû à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail dans les dépôts de boissons du quartier. Grâce à ce crédit, il pourra s'approvisionner en gros auprès des fournisseurs agrées, ceci lui permettra de diversifier ses boissons, de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaires.Il économisera une partie des bénéfices générés par cet investissement pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants, le reste sera réinvestit dans  son activité.
texts.en: Elysée is a 38-year-old married father of four children whose ages vary between 6 and 25. Three of his children attend school. He is a merchant and opened a bar in his area of the capital city, which he has managed for three years. His business runs well thanks to the welcoming atmosphere and his experience, and he has obtained a faithful customer base that is growing with time. His only problem is a lack of stock in terms of drinks, thanks to the small amount of capital he has, which then forces him to buy at retail from the drink stores in the area. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to obtain supplies in bulk from a set of arranged suppliers, which will allow him to diversify his stock of drinks, satisfy his customers, and increase his profit margin. He will save a portion of the profits generated by this investment in order to pay for his children's education, and the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To buy cases of drinks.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et de bonneteries sur étalage depuis 2004, Fati âgée de 53ans est mariée à un retraité et ils ont 02 enfants. Pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt pour acheter des articles de bonneteries et des pagnes. Avec les profits, elle souhaite augmenter son stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and hosiery at a stall since 2004, Fati is 53 years old and married to a retired person. They have two children. In order to respond to her customers' needs, she is seeking a third loan from WAGES to buy hosiery items and pagnes. With the profits, she hopes to increase her stock and ensure the flourishing of her family.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and hosiery.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afi est âgée de 47ans. Elle n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Depuis 1997, elle vend des produits de détails (eau minérale, produits d’alimentation générale et cartes de recharges) Son activité se fait dans une boutique et par moment elle a des ruptures de stock. Pour pallier à ce problème, elle demande un prêt à WAGES pour acheter en quantité considérable des marchandises. Elle veut devenir grossiste et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Afi is 47 years old. She has no dependent children. Since 1997, she has been selling retail products (mineral water, general foodstuffs and mobile phone recharge cards). Her business takes place in a boutique and once in a while she has stock shortages. To mitigate this problem, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a considerable quantity of merchandise. She wants to become a wholesaler and take better care of herself.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Abajyamugambi Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
