Joël fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi Zone 2. Il a 26 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Joël est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie d'augmenter les crédits demande pour finance et augmenter la capacité de son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un meilleur agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de fonder un bon foyer.
texts.en:
Joël belongs to the Abajyamugambi Zone 2 group. He is 26 years old and unmarried. He completed six years of primary school. Joël grows rice. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his credit in order to buy fertilizer and pay for manual labour.
In order to expand his rice growing, he is planning to increase the loan he is seeking in order to finance and increase the capacity of his farm. In the coming years, he would like to be one of the best rice growers in the region. With his profits, he intends to establish a good household.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi vit avec sa femme coiffeuse et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 11 et 06ans et sont scolarisés. Koffi est revendeur. Il exerce son activité de vente d’amplis, de radio et de télévision sur étalage. Avec ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite dans notre institution, il désire acheter des radios, des télévisions et des ampli. Avec les profits, il souhaiterait acheter un terrain avec le profit réalisé, devenir grossiste et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Koffi lives with his wife, a hairstylist, and their two children in Lomé. The children are 11 and 6 years old and are both in school. Koffi is a retailer and runs a business selling amps, radios, and televisions at a stall. With this first loan that he is seeking with our institution, he wants to buy radios, televisions, and amps. With the profits, he would hope to buy a plot of land, become a wholesaler, and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: To buy televisions, radios, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane Makoko Group

texts.fr:
Théobald fait partie du groupe Dushyigikirane/Mkk. Le nom du groupe signifie «assistance commune ». Il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de  1 an à 6 ans .Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Théobald est agriculteur du riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture du riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits et acheter d'autres champs pour agrandir l'étendu de son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs du riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Théobald belongs to the Dushyigikirane/Mkk group. The name of the group means "collaborative assistance". He is 30 years old and married with two children who are 1 and 6 years old. He has one additional person in his care apart from his children. He completed six years of primary school.

Théobald is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labour for his rice farm.

In order to increase his rice farming, he plans to seek additional loans and buy additional fields to enlarge the extent of his agriculture. In the coming years, he would like to expand his rice fields to satisfy the market. With the profits, he intends to pay for his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Revendeur d’articles scolaires dans une boutique depuis 1987, Komla est père de famille. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils ont en charge des enfants. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité et il n’a pas de difficultés principales. Avec ce troisième crédit, il va acheter des articles scolaires pour vendre et tirer des profits. Avec cette augmentation, il souhaiterait voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Reseller of school supplies in a boutique since 1987, Komla is father to a family. His wife is a reseller and they have dependent children. One person helps him with his business and he has no large difficulties. With this third loan, he is going to buy school supplies to resell and make a profit. With this increase, he would like to see his family thrive.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to resell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 37 years old and married with three children, who are in school. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for five years. In addition, James practices livestock farming to supplement his income. Through the loans that he previously acquired, his business has improved, and with the additional income, he was able to support his family. He dreams of expanding his business and creating employment opportunities in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Jannelyn

texts.en: This time, Jannelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 to buy more livestock. The sari-sari store business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Jannelyn and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi âgée de 31ans est mariée à un maintenancier en informatique. Ils n’ont pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est secrétaire. Elle a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle, elle vend des articles informatiques et fait la photocopie et des saisies de texte. Elle est une ancienne cliente de l’institution et n’a pas eu de problèmes dans le remboursement de ses crédits passés. Elle sollicite ce cinquième prêt pour acheter des appareils informatiques (ordinateur et photocopieuse). Avec le profit, elle voudrait aider ses petits frères dans leurs études et devenir grossiste dans la vente des appareils informatiques.
texts.en: Ayawavi is 31 years old and is married to a maintenance technician. They have no dependent children. She is a secretary. She opened a boutique where she sells information technology items and does photocopying and typing. She is an old client of the institution and didn't have any problems in paying back her previous loans. She is requesting this fifth loan to buy information technology equipment (computer and photocopier). With the profits, she would like to help her younger brothers with their studies and become a wholesaler in the sale of information technology equipment.

loans.use: to buy information technology equipment (computers and photocopier).

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is 50 years old and is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elsie has a sari-sari, or convenience store, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items like shampoo, canned goods and other items.

Elsie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like shampoo, canned goods and others to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Julieta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 46 years old, married and has seven children. The family's income comes from rice farming and a hog raising business. Nida usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month, which goes toward the family's meals and allowances of her two children who still attend school. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy vaccines and medicines to sustain her hogs. Nida hopes to keep ensuring good nutrition of the hogs so she can sell them at a higher cost upon maturity. Her income will be used to pay school fees and to save for future expenses of the family. 

Someday, with good profits from the businesses, Nida hopes to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Stanslus

texts.en:
Stanslus, 48 years old, has worked for over ten years and has demonstrated responsibility and honesty.  His wife who is a nurse helps support the family, which is very hardworking.  They are a very united family.

Stanslus operates a small pharmacy that serves the whole vicinity.  He’s asking for a Kiva loan to buy more drugs to stock his clinic. He intends to open a bigger clinic in future.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to stock his clinic.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married, with five children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed, and repaid, 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for 20 years.  She also earns an income from a restaurant and motorcycle transport.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Paris lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Iliana quien tiene un taller de costura desde hace 2 años, ya que antes tenía una pulpería y poco a poco fue amentando. 
Las otras integrantes son Vilgen quien tiene una fritanga  y Yahosca quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en: The “Paris” group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Iliana who has had a sewing workshop for two years.  She used to have a grocery store and gradually enlarged it.  The other members are Vilgen who sells fried fast-food and Yahosca who has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Lemon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lemon lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Norman Alberto quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada desde hace 5 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de pacas.
Las otras integrantes son Deysi del Socorro quien vende nacatamales desde hace 10 años y Mayra Libia vende ropa usada desde hace un año.
texts.en: The Lemon group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Norman Alberto who has been selling used clothes for the last five years.  He will invest the loan to buy bundles of clothes.  The other members are Deysi del Socorro who has sold nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] for the last ten years and Mayra Libia who has sold used clothes for the last year.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Dufashanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Bibiane fait partie du groupe Dufashanye II et  habite à Bujumbura.C'est une veuve de 52 ans. 
Elle a 4 enfants, âgés de  18  à 25 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du lait depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de lait à revendre, pour  gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait refaire le commerce d’importation  des chaussures (son ancien métier) de l’Ouganda. Elle voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier ; après leurs études, elle voudrait les initier au commerce.
texts.en:
Bibiane, who lives in Bujumbura, is a member of the Dufashanye II group.  She is 52 years old and a widow.  She has four children, ages 18 to 25, who all attend school.

She has been selling milk for the past two years.

This is her first loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from Kiva, she will be able to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of milk for resale, so that she can make more money.

In the coming years, she would like to start importing shoes from Uganda again (which was her former occupation).  She would also like to ensure that her children go to school, and once they complete school, she would like to teach them business.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of milk for resale.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Sara  tiene 48 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos de veintiseis, veinticuatro, veintinueve años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Sara se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar más terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Sara, 48, lives with her husband and three children who are 26, 24 and 29 years old in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  

She’s a member of the “Vencedores Unidos” (United Winners) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Sara grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells the products in Comercial Peña.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizer for the crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenge she faces are crop infestations and diseases.  Her dream is to buy more land to work better.  In her free time she enjoys going out on excursions and spending more time at work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for the crops

loans.name: La Corona Group

texts.es:
Silvia comerciante de recargas, Aracely quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y Jairo quien vende comida conforman el grupo La Corona. Aracely es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años vende productos derivados del cerdo desde carne, nacatamales, moronga, chicharrón…etc.
El crédito lo invertirá en el negocio con el propósito de salir adelante
texts.en:
The group La Corona comprises Silvia, who sells refills; Aracely, who works butchering pork; and Jairo, who sells food.

Aracely is a hard worker and an enterprising woman who has been selling pork products such as meat, tamales, blood sausage, pork rinds, etc. for ten years. She will invest this loan in her business in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase pork.

loans.name: Las Tres Rosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las tres Rosas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elvira de 50 años quien tiene un pequeño Cafetin en el parque, los productos de mayor demanda son las gaseosas y chiverías, en los que invertirá el crédito.
Las otras integrantes son Victoria quien tiene una pulpería y Dominga quien vende pinolillos y nacatamales.
texts.en:
The Tres Rosas group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Elvira. She is 50 years old and has a small cafe in the park. The products most in demand are soft drinks and yogurts, in she will invest the loan.

The other members are Victoria, who has a store and Dominga, who sells pinolillo and nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and and yogurt

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 31 years old and married, with two children, both in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for two years now.  She has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle repair shop business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from selling second-hand motorcycles.  Rebecca is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to  buy additional spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle repair shop business.

Rebecca has sustained her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
María  tiene 38 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo   y con sus hijos,  Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Beatriz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para poder comprar un tractor para trabajar en el campo.

Le gusta limpiar la casa, cocinar para la familia que se reúnen los domingos.
texts.en:
María, 38, is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

María Beatriz has been growing corn and rice for several years now.  She buys the products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her increase income for her family’s consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to have enough money to buy a tractor to work her land.  She likes to clean her house and to cook for the family when they get together on Sundays.

loans.use: in order to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Aida Galud

texts.es:
Aida  es soltera tiene 21 años no tiene hijos  vive con ha hermana en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Aida se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Aida, 21, is single and does not have children.  She lives with her sister in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

She’s a member of the “Vencedores Unidos” (United Winners) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Aida grows corn and rice.  She buys and sells her products in commercial peña.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizer for the crops.  With support from the loan she’ll have economic help to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like crop infestations and diseases.  Her dream is to have land of her own to work better.  In her free time she likes going out and to spend more time at work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Gs Los Amigos Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario de 39 años de edad, es soltero tiene un negocio de pulpería en su lugar de residencia, en la ciudad de san Lorenzo, Valle. Es el líder del grupo solidario LOS AMIGOS, sus compañeros lo eligieron por ser la persona que coordina el grupo y por el apoyo en cuanto a el recordatorio en sus pagos.
Don Mario esta solicitando el préstamo de 5,000.00 para surtir la pulpería ya que desea comprar frescos, pollo, lácteos, jugos, manteca, embutidos, condimentos, lácteos y otros productos de consumo básico,  
Don Mario espera que con el préstamo sus ventas crezcan ya que tendrá mas producto para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Mario Su sueño es tener el mejor negocio de la comunidad.
Valentina que necesita el préstamo para comprar frescos, churros, huevos y pollo que son los productos que más vende, y don Santos que se dedica a la venta de leña seca y arena en su coche.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Mario is 39 years old, single, and has a grocery store set up at home in the city of San Lorenzo, in Valle. He leads the solidarity group Los Amigos. His fellow members elected him because he is the one who coordinates de group and supports them by reminding them of their payments.

Mario is requesting a 5,000 loan to stock his grocery store. He wants to buy soft drinks, chicken, dairy products, juice, lard, cold cuts, and other essential goods. He expects this loan to allow his sales to increase, since he will have more products to offer his customers. Mario's dream is to have the best business in his community. 

Valentina needs the loan in order to buy soft drinks, churros, eggs, and chicken, which are her best-selling products; and Santos works selling dry firewood and sand from his car.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2012

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, chicken, dairy products, juice, lard, cold cuts, spices, and other essential goods for his business.

loans.name: Gladys Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene su propia casa en donde vive con sus dos hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad del comercio San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 13 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de pan , rosquillas y quesadillas, su venta es en los mercados de San Lorenzo y con personas amigas, Doña Gladis es una mujer que ha salido adelante sola y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con este negocio de venta de pan.
Doña Gladys esta solicitando 12,000.00 lempiras para compra de harina, leña, aceites, huevos, latas, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo desea seguir mejorando su negocio y con las ganancias mejorar su casa.
Doña Gladys su sueño es que sus hijos se le gradúen de la universidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old. She is a single mother who owns her own home where she lives with her two children who depend on her. She lives in the merchant community of San Lorenzo, in southernHonduras. She has worked their for 13 years in the business of making and selling bread, rolls and  quesadillas. She sells in the San Lorenzo markets and to friends. Gladis is a woman who has gotten ahead and who has gotten her children ahead with htis business selling bread.

Gladys is asking for 12,000.00 lempiras to buy flour, firewood, oil, eggs, tins, etc. With the suopport of this loan, she wants to keep improving her business and with her earnings improve her home.  

Gladys' dream is for her children to graduate from college. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, oil, eggs, tins, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely del Carmen de 59 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de chatarra (aluminio, hierro, papel, sacos….etc.) el crédito que solicita es autoestima el cual utilizara para realizarse un chequeo de rutina.
texts.en: Aracely del Carmen is 59 years old. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells scrap (aluminum, iron, paper, bags, etc.). The loan she is asking for is for herself. She will use it to undergo a routine medical exam.

loans.use: to have a routine medical exam.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retail business.  Merlinda has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from food vending.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Araceli

texts.es:
Marcia  tiene 37 años de estado civil Soltera vive con la hermana no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Marcia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar mas y mejor el cultivo de maiz.

Le gusta siempre tener negocios extras.
texts.en:
Marcia, 37, is single and does not have children.  She lives with her sister in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

She’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Marcia has been growing corn and rice for several years now.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the crops.  The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family’s consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to increase and improve her corn crops still more.  She always likes having extra businesses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lidia Janeth

texts.es:
Lidia   tiene 19 años de estado civil Soltera vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Lidia Janeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Lidia, 19, is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

She’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Lidia Janeth has been growing corn and rice for several years now.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the crops.  The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family’s consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to buy a car.  She likes playing sports and watching television.

loans.use: to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María  tiene 42 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una refrigeradora para su casa porque la comida se esta dañando.
Le gusta lavar la ropa en el rio y planchar.
texts.en:
María, 42, is married.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

She’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

María Teresa has been growing corn and rice for several years now.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the crops.  The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family’s consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to buy refrigerator for her home because the food is spoiling.  She enjoys washing clothes in the river and ironing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid feritlizers

loans.name: Luis Heriberto

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 25 años de estado civil soltero vive con la madre y no tiene  hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luis Heriberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para salir de viaje a otro país.

Le gusta ver la televisión los programas de las tradiciones de otros países.
texts.en:
Luis, 25, is single and does not have children.  He lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

He’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Luis Heriberto grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the crops.  The loan has helped him to increase his income for his family’s consumption and to invest.  His dream is to have money to go on a trip abroad.  He likes watching television shows about traditions in other countries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 37 años de estado civil Casado vive con la esposa  y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Segundo Arturo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  poder comprarse un terreno para así poder seguir produciendo más.
Le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo, 37, is married living with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

He’s a member of the “Venceremos Unidos” (We Will Triumph Together) communal bank located in Recinto Anchoveta on the way to Recinto La Templanza that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is involved with agricultural activities related to short cycle corn and rice crops.

Segundo Arturo has grown corn and rice for the last three years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in a market there and in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizer for the crops.  The loan has helped him to increase his income for his family’s consumption and to invest.  His dream is to be able to buy a parcel of land in order to produce more.  He likes going out on excursions with his children.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 52 años, es un hombre alegre y emprendedor. Está casado con Leily con quien comparte su negocio, tienen tres hijos ya adultos. Viven en su casa propia, la cual logró construir con la ayuda de su pareja.  
Su trabajo es brindar el servicio de motosierra. En la zona donde vive es frecuente que soliciten este servicio para talar árboles para las construcciones, o en el corte de madera en trozos. Sus clientes lo reconocen ya que siempre realiza su trabajo con mucho esmero y dedicación, lo que le ha servido para ser recomendado. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 6 años y algunas veces lo hace con la ayuda de dos personas que manipulan, junto a él, la pesada herramienta. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que este tipo de trabajo es muy bien remunerado por la exigencia y el esfuerzo que demanda su realización, esto le genera un ingreso económico con el cual asegura el sustento para su hogar. Se siente contento porque su labor le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y tiene deseos de comprar otras herramientas para ampliar su servicio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500) comprará combustible en galones para su herramienta y víveres para los alimentos de sus trabajadores durante las jornadas laborales.
texts.en:
Jaime is 52 years old. He is a cheerful and enterprising man. He is married to Leily, with whom he shares his business. They have three grown children. They own the house they live in, whih he was able to build with his spouse' help. 

His job is offering a chainsaw service. In he area he lives in people frequently ask for this service to cut down trees for construction, or to cut wood into pieces. His customers recognize that he always does his job with dedication and hard work, and this has helped him get recomendations. He has been doing this activity for 6 years and sometimes he does it with the help of two people who with him operate the heavy tools. What he likes about this activity is that this type of work is well paid because it is in demand and requires a lot of effort. This generates income which ensures support for his home. He is happy because his labor has brought much satisfaction and he wants to buy more tools to expand the service.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the opportunity and trust put in him. He also is committed to making his payments on time. He also likes being a part of the communal bank he belongs to. He has seen that its members are responsible and supportive people. 

With the amount he has asked for (S/. 2500) he will buy gallons of fuel for his tools and groceries to feed his workers during the workday.

loans.use: to bu gallons of fuel for his tools and groceries to feed his workers during the workday.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, vive al sur occidente de la ciudad,  lugar donde, se  dedica  al comercio, desde hace 6 años; los principales artículos son prendas de vestir, cubrelechos,  sabanas y artículos para el hogar, que vende en las modalidades de crédito y de contado entre vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos que hacen parte de su lista de clientes. Con su negocio ha logrado el propósito por el cual lo emprendió que no fue otro que el de generar ingresos para responder a los gastos de su hogar; trabajando en él aproximadamente 8 horas diarias, ha logrado sostenerlo y su meta de prosperidad es hacerlo crecer cada vez mas hasta convertirlo en un gran almacén donde ofertar todos los productos que la clientela de su barrio requiere. Diana compra semanalmente de contado de acuerdo a la solicitud que recibe d su clientela y su inversión depende mucho de la recuperación que tenga de sus cuentas por cobrar; esto hace que muchas veces no sea tan oportuna como su cliente lo requiere; esta es la razón para acudir a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cubrelechos, ropa femenina y accesorios para el hogar, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades previstas, con las que proyecta aumentar cada vez mas su bienestar y el de los suyos.
texts.en:
Diana lives in the southwestern area of the city, where she has been working in retail for six years. The main items she sells are clothing items, bedspreads, sheets, and home accessories. She makes credit and cash sales among neighbors, friends, family members, and referrals, who make up her list of customers. Her business has allowed her to achieve the goal she set when she started out, which was none other than to generate enough income to cover her home expenses. By working approximately eight hours a day, she has managed to keep her business going, and her goal for prosperity is to expand more and more until she makes it into a large shop where she can offer all the products the customers in her neighborhood need. 

Diana makes cash purchases every week according to the orders she receives from her customers. Her investment depends a lot on how much she has recovered from outstanding accounts. This often prevents her from being as efficient as her customers require, which is why she has turned to a Kiva loan. This is the first time she requests financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy bedspreads, women's clothing, and home accessories, so that she may increase sales and, accordingly, her projected earnings, which she plans to use to keep increasing her own well-being, as well as that of those around her.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads, women's clothing, and home accesories.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Mrs.Oyuntuya aged 39, lives with 2 daughters in a Gobi province of Mongolia. Her husband died in 2008. Her 2 daughters go to secondary school. They live in a ger /Mongolian national yurt/. In August 2012, she started her own body-stocking and bags sales business. She had saving of 1.500.000 MNT to start her business. Before, she worked as a seller in a grocery for 6 months where she learned sales management. She operates her business on a rental 2-meter counter of a store for the elderly. The rental payment is 100.000 MNT. She is asking a 3.800.000 MNT to import more body-stocking and bags from China.

loans.use: To import bodystocking and bags from China

loans.name: Nemehbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Nemehbayar, who is 33 years old, lives with his parents and his younger brother in a little house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar. His father works as a specialist at the Ministry of Defense. His mother is owner of taxi server small company. His younger brother is a college student. 

During the past two years he has worked in the Narantuul black market as a collector. Also he drives taxi in his mother company. He needs 5,250,000 MNT to purchase a hybrid car for his family needs. He is a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To purchase a hybrid car for his family needs

loans.name: Baljinnyamgarav

texts.en: Mr. Baljinnyamgarav, who is 36 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Khan-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar. His wife is a server. Baljinnyamgarav is an experienced taxi driver who has been working in that capacity for the last six years. He has been using a gasoline-powered car, but would like to buy a natural gas powered car because it is more economical and eco-friendly. He needs 6,000,000 MNT to purchase this type of car to continue operating his taxi service. He is a hard working and honest man, who wants to make a better life for his wife and family.

loans.use: To buy a natural gas powered car

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Mr Batsuh lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Darisuren, sews Mongolian national clothes at home. His three daughters (Munhtsetseg, Suvdgerel and Hongorzul) are 22, 20 and 18 years old. His older daughters are college students and his youngest daughter is a secondary school student.  Mr Batsuh is trained as a plumber. He wants to repair cars in his courtyard and would like to buy equipment from China.  He is a hardworking man and his family members are hardworking people. He needs 3,000,000 MNT to buy equipment for his new business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his new business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been doing the boutique business for the past seven years successfully. 

This is Catherine’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, shoes, trousers, and handbags to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her child. 

She hopes to own a bigger, more profitable boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 22-year-old man. Ibrahim is engaged and lives in Lebanon with his parents and four siblings. In addition to Ibrahim and his father, considered the main income provider for the family, two of Ibrahim's siblings are also working.

Despite his young age, Ibrahim is thinking about having his own family and children and is threfore obliged to work continually to support those plans. He has been working in the construction field since 2006. Ibrahim works independently, dealing with a fair number of clients who are seeking his services.

Although Ibrahim is satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial position. He is therefore asking for a youth loan from Kiva's Partner, Ameen s.a.l, to allow him to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools. In the near future, Ibrahim also plans to take on an additional Kiva loan to expand and better develop his work. These actions show how Ibrahim works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools and improve his business.

loans.name: Julicia

texts.es:
Julicia tiene 28 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Convive, desde hace 12 años, con Cesar, quien es padre de su hija llamada Keysi, quien tiene 8 años y por quien se esfuerza para salir adelante.
Ella tiene una discoteca que ha implementado en un espacio de su casa. Su ganancia se basa principalmente en el consumo de bebidas que sus clientes realizan, para ello ofrece todo tipos de bebidas y algunos bocaditos. También alquila su local en días particulares para eventos institucionales o privados. Lleva con este negocio más de 10 años, con la ayuda de su cónyuge. Adicionalmente tiene otra fuente de ingreso, que es el alquiler de habitaciones. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene buena rentabilidad y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia. Por ese motivo ella sigue esforzándose para mejorar la calidad de los servicios que brinda. 

Este es su crédito numero 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que lo hacen posible. Además, está muy decidida a cumplir, una vez más, con sus pagos de manera puntual, como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores. Le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo que integra, ya que reconoce que todos los miembros son personas muy puntuales y responsables.
El préstamo solicitado, de 3800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de 90 cajas de cervezas y 10 cajas de gaseosas para tener su local abastecido.
texts.en:
Julicia is 28 years old. She is a cheerful and enterprising woman. She has lived for 12 years with Cesar, who is the father of her daughter named Keysi, who is 8 and her reason for working to get ahead.  

She has a discoteque that she has set up in a space in her home. Her profits are basically from the consumption of beverages of her customers. She offers all types of beverages and some snacks. She also rents out her locale on certain days for institutional or pivate events. She has had this business for more than 10 years, with the help of her spouse. In addition, she has another source of income, renting out rooms. What she likes about her job is the good profitability, which gives her what she needs to offer her family everything it needs. That is why she is still working to improve the quality of services she offers.

This is loan number 5 with the MFP institution. She is grateful to all of the people who have made this possible. In addition, she is very determined to onece more make her payments on time, as she did with the previous loans. She really likes belonging to the group she is a member of, since she acknowledges that all of the people are punctual and responsible.

The loan she has asked for is for 3800 nuevos soles. She will invest all of it in buying 90 cases of beer and 10 cases of soft drinks to stock her locale.

loans.use: to buy 90 cases of beer and 10 cases of soft drinks to stock her locale.

loans.name: María Mazzarello

texts.es: “Deseo mejorar mi hogar” dijo María Mazzarello quien trabaja como responsable de suministros generales desde 1994 de uno de los colegios de Masaya.  El crédito que solicita es para mejoras a la vivienda, con este crédito compondrá el techo de su hogar.
texts.en: “I want to improve my home,” said María Mazzarello. She has been working as a general supplies manager for one of the schools in Masaya since 1994. The loan she is requesting is for home improvements. She will use it to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheeting to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 36 years old and married, with two children.

Percy is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Percy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Percy has been raising pigs for three years now.  She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hawar's Group

texts.en:
Hawar is a 20 years old, young Iraqi woman. She is divorced and has no children. Given limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hawar is one many Iraqi women who are working from home.

Hawar is using her sewing skills to generate some income and assist her family in meeting its financial needs. Having started to assist her family at a very young age, she already has four years of experience with this little business activity. 

Hawar would like to make some improvements to the business and buy a better quality sewing machine and a table for ironing. She would also like to make sure that she is able to work during the hours when her city experiences power outages so she would also buy a small generator.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, Kiva's partner, offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan individually. As a group, the members of any group loan collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients. Within groups, each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a better quality sewing machine, a table for ironing and a small generator.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther provides tailoring services in order to earn a living. She has previously been awarded a 30,000 KES loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her buy clothing materials for her dressmaking business. That loan helped Esther grow her business. With the additional income she earned as a result of that growth, Esther was able to support her family. 

Currently, Esther has requested an additional 60,000 KES loan to buy more materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que cuenta con una librería en un local que está en anticrético; Lizeth  atiende su negocio todo el día por más de diez horas, y con lo que gana debe ayudar con los gastos en pago de servicios y alimentación de su familia ya que es la única que solventa los gastos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una fotocopiadora ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos ofreciendo servicio de fotocopias a sus clientes  y de esta manera conseguir más ingresos para  aumentar su mercadería en la librería.
El sueño de Lizeth, es tener más ingresos y poder independizarse para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Lizeth’s single and has a school age son.  She lives in her parents’ house in a single room; the house is located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.

She currently earns income from a bookstore she has in a locale under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  Lizeth tends to her store all day for more than 10 hours and uses what she earns to help with her family’s utility and food costs since she’s the only one who covers expenses.

She needs the loan go buy a photocopying machine because she wants to improve her income by offering photocopies to her customers thus earning more income to increase her stock in the store.

Lizeth’s dream is to earn higher income to become independent and have more comfort and improve her quality of life.  This is her first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Natty

texts.es:
Natty, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en casa de su pareja en la zona Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz ocupando solo una habitación.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que cuenta con una movilidad propia que trabaja como taxi y el chofer le entrega una renta por día, la cual usa para el pago de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de motor de su vehículo, pues necesita un cambio inmediato para continuar generando ingresos ya que es la única fuente de trabajo con la que cuenta para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Natty, es aumentar sus ingresos y poder construir su casa para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la novena vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Natty’s single and has a school age son.  She lives in her partner’s house in the city of La Paz’s Alto Llojeta zone occupying a single room.

She earns income because she own a car she leases out to provide taxi services and the driver pays her a daily rental fee for it that she uses to pay for food, schooling and basic utility costs for her family.

She needs the loan to buy a motor for her vehicle because it needs to be replaced immediately in order to continue generating income since this is the only source of work she has to support her family.

Natty’s dream is to increase her income to be able to build her house and have more comfort and improve her quality of life.

This is her ninth loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her taxi.

loans.name: Dolis

texts.es: Dolis  de 37 años de edad es la propietaria de una peluquería en ubicada en el barrio La Playa, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y 16 años. Su negocio nació a la edad de 34 años, después de haber sido empleada en una peluquería al norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla y a la que dedicaba mucho de su tiempo, sin poder cumplir efectivamente con las obligaciones de su hogar,  las que la obligaron a Dolis a renunciar a su trabajo; allí  como empleada, adquirió mucha experiencia y  con ella emprendió su aventura de negocios en su propia casa; Su primer apoyo lo recibió de su suegra, quien compró su primera silla y espejo, para que  se desempeñara en su oficio. Poco a poco ganó una extendida clientela, que hoy la acompaña y a quienes ofrece los servicios de corte de cabello, blower, tintes, aliser y masajes capilares. Desde hace 1 año se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un crédito y con él compró un nuevo lava cabezas, y una vitrina para almacenar sus productos, además de materiales para prestar el servicio con eficiencia. Su oferta va dirigida directamente al consumidor final y tiene servicio a domicilio para su clientela, pero este no es los sus clientes solicitan con frecuencia. Su horario se ajusta a las necesidades de la clientela y usualmente abre las puertas de su negocio a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 9 de la noche de lunes a domingos. Con su anterior crédito ha mejorado la presentación de su negocio y cuando sus clientes ingresan al negocio, captan la imagen de calidad en su infraestructura y en su trato amable y la superioridad en lo que Dolis sabe hacer. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará 1 aire acondicionado, un mueble para organizar su sala de espera, todo esto contribuirá a que su clientela esté atenta al servicio, por que encuentran un ambiente refrescante, contrario al incesante calor, al exterior de su negocio, causado por el rigor con que brilla el sol del Caribe.
texts.en: Dolis is 37 years old. She is the owner of a hair salon in the La Playa neighborhood, where she lives with her spouse and two children, aged 5 and 16. Her business was born when she was 34, after having worked at a hair salon on the north side of the city of Barranquilla where she spent most of her time. As an employee there, she gained a lot of experience and started her business venture in her own house. She received her first support from her mother in law who bought her first chair and mirror so she could ply her trade. Little by little she gained more clientele to whom she offers the services of haircuts, blowouts, coloring, straightening  and scalp massages. A year ago, she approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to access a loan and with it bought a new hairwasher, a display case to keep her products in and materials to operate efficiently. She deals directly with the consumer and does do housecalls, but that is not something her clients ask for frequently. She adjusts her schedule to the client's needs and ususally opens her doors at 8 in the morning and closes at 9 at night. Monday through Sunday. With the previous loan, she has improved the look of the business and when her clients come in they see the image of quality in her infrastructure and the friendly treatment and in the superior quality of what Dolis knows how to do. Right now, she is applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will purchase an air conditioner, and some furniture to organize her waiting area. All of this will contruibute to her clientele being more aware of the service because they will be in a refreshing ambience away from the incessant heat outside the business caused by the strength of the Carribean sun.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and some furniture for her waiting room

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en: Jovilyn's business is raising hogs to sell.  She has been doing it for two years.  Jovilyn was involved in an early marriage.  She is now 23 years old and her spouse is a farmer.  Together, they are raising two lovely children.  Jovilyn has insufficient funds to sustain her hog business, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed, medicine and vaccines for her hogs.  This will help ensure their good nutrition and enable her to sell them at a profitable price.  She promises to pay back her loan in full and keep improving her business for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vaccines for her hog business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has no children.  He has been doing farming business for seven years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business. 

Joel has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy irrigation pipes.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Lack of supervision and exploitation, he is free to experiment into new fields and thus grow!" His biggest challenge is "lack of enough capital for expansion." The animals on the farm have been given the name "Karait."

Joel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "heard from a friend."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: '"has learnt about how to invest in profitable ventures."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Joel replied:  "He will be able to increase his assets and definitely increase his income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joel owns the following:  a cow, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a motorcycle, an automobile.   Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, a DVD, but does NOT have electricity or solar power.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 50 years old and married, with six children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed, and repaid, 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the charcoal retail for eight years and also earns an income from retailing vegetables and a general store.

Rosalinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica. Su pareja es Daniel, desde hace 7 años, con quien tiene dos hijos menores de 7 y 2 años, quienes son su inspiración para progresar.
Su trabajo es la venta de materiales de construcción y accesorios para este fin. Tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa para su ferretería. Inició hace 4 años, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida. Trabaja todo el día y sus ganancias al final del día son muy alentadoras. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite sustentar los gastos que se genera en su hogar, y pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Además al no ser productos perecibles puede almacenarlos sin ningún problema. Tiene planes de seguir incrementado su negocio con más artículos y abrir otro local. 

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.2000) comprará más mercadería para su ferretería, principalmente tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe y madera triplay, ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo este esto.
texts.en:
Lola tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica. Su pareja es Daniel, desde hace 7 años, con quien tiene dos hijos menores de 7 y 2 años, quienes son su inspiración para progresar.
Su trabajo es la venta de materiales de construcción y accesorios para este fin. Tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa para su ferretería. Inició hace 4 años, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida. Trabaja todo el día y sus ganancias al final del día son muy alentadoras. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite sustentar los gastos que se genera en su hogar, y pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Además al no ser productos perecibles puede almacenarlos sin ningún problema. Tiene planes de seguir incrementado su negocio con más artículos y abrir otro local. 

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.2000) comprará más mercadería para su ferretería, principalmente tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe y madera triplay, ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo este esto.

loans.use: Comprará más mercadería para su ferretería, principalmente tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe y madera triplay, ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo este esto.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
El comité Barrio Alegre esta conformado por 11 miembros mujeres todas vecinas de la misma comunidad. Gran parte del grupo son amas de casa que que se dedican a la venta minorista de productos de primera necesidad. El comité se caracteriza por ser unido y se complementan en sus actividades.
Una de las integrantes Liz se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como son las verduras, ella vende lechugas, tomates, mandioca, calabaza y de los productos lácteos vende queso; es con esta actividad como ella aporta a la canasta familiar.
El crédito solicitado sería para invertir en su micro emprendimiento y comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías para poder venderlas.
texts.en:
The “Barrio Alegre” (Cheerful Neighborhood) committee has 11 members, all women, who are neighbors in the same community.  Most of them are housewives who sell various basic staples at retail.  The committee is noted for being united and they complement each other’s’ activities.

One of the members is Liz who sells basic staples like vegetables; she sells lettuce, tomatoes, manioc, squash and dairy products like cheese.  She’s able to provide her family with their basic needs this way.

The requested loan will be used to invest in her micro business and to buy a larger amount of merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Marelith

texts.es:
Marelith tiene 33 años, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática y muy trabajadora. Está casada con Hipólito, quien es agricultor, y con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad. 
Tiene una chacra de 14 hectáreas donde produce plátanos y otras frutas regionales. Para sus cultivos tiene la ayuda de un obrero que contrata temporalmente, y todo lo obtenido lo vende en el puesto que tiene en el mercado principal de la ciudad. Este puesto lo tiene desde hace 5 años, pero desarrolla la agricultura desde muy joven. Se inició ayudando en otros puestos, ahora tiene su propio establecimiento y ahí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo mayor, quienes la apoyan en la carga y el transporte de la pesada mercadería. Ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir ampliando su negocio, es por eso que ahora desea complementarlo con la venta de algunas verduras, las más solicitadas por sus clientes.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia puntual y responsable en el pago sus cuota como lo hizo en los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Y le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal en el que trabaja, ya que todos sus miembros son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.
El préstamo solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su terreno y la producción de plátanos, que es su principal producto. Otra parte del dinero lo usará en la compra de verduras y tubérculos para la venta en su puesto.
texts.en:
Marelith is 33 years old. She is an enterprising and charismatic woman and a very hard worker. She is married to Hipólito, who is a farmer, and they have two children together, who are ages sixteen and six. 

She has nearly 35 acres of land, where she grows plantains and other regional fruit. She hires a seasonal worker to help with her crops, and sells all of her produce at a stall she has at the local main market. She has had the stall for five years, but has been farming ever since she was very young. She started out helping in other stalls, but now has her own location where she works with help from her husband and her oldest son, who help her load and carry the heavy merchandise. She is very eager to keep expanding her business, which is why she now wants to supplement it by selling some of the vegetables her customers request most.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing she has financial support in order to increase her work capital. She is also certain that she will continue to be a responsible member who pays her installments on time, as she did with previous loans. She enjoys belonging to the communal bank where she works, because all of its members are responsible and very supportive of each other.

She will invest the loan she has requested, 3,500 nuevos soles, in maintaining her land and growing plantains, which are her main product. She will also use part of the money to purchase vegetables and tubers to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining her land, where she grows plantains plantains, and to purchase vegetables and tubers to sell at her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 36 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora. Su pareja es Esteban, quien es taxista. Su casa es propia, la cual compró con el apoyo de su pareja, allí viven con sus tres menores hijos de 17, 13 y 7 años, y es por ellos por quienes se esfuerza en salir adelante.
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos regionales. Tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad donde ofrece plátano, maní, yuca y frutas. Además, aprovecha que el clima de su región es muy caluroso para preparar los más deliciosos refrescos elaborados con frutas frescas, principalmente de piña y maracuyá. Tiene trabajando en este negocio cerca de 2 años, tiempo suficiente que le ha permitido ser reconocida entre sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que le permite tener un ingreso económico para brindarles a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan. Eso le ayuda a estar más tranquila y trabajar con esmero y optimismo.

Este es su crédito número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que lo hacen posible. Está decidida a cumplir, una vez más, con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo que integra porque todos los miembros que participan son personas muy puntuales y responsables.
Con este préstamo, de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de frutas (aguaje, limón y naranja). Su inversión semanal es entre 400 a 500 soles, ya que los precios de estos productos varían según la temporada.
texts.en:
Lucia, 36, is a cheerful, enterprising woman.  Her spouse is Esteban who is a taxi driver.  They bought their house together and live there with their three minor children who are 17, 13 and 7 years old; they strive to get ahead for them.

Her work consists in selling regional products.  She has a stand in the local market where she sells bananas, peanuts, cassava and fruit.  She also takes advantage of her region’s very hot climate to prepare delicious drinks made from tropical fruit, especially pineapple and passion fruit.  She’s been working at this for about 2 years, time enough to become well-known among her customers.  What she enjoys about her work is earning income to provide her children with what they need; this allows her to have peace of mind and to work with dedication and optimism.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she thanks all those who make it possible.  She’s determined to once again make her payments punctually like she’s done in the past.  On the other hand, she enjoys being part of her group very much because all the members who participate are very punctual, responsible people.

She will use this 1800 new sol loan to buy sacks of fruit (aguaje, lemons and oranges).  Her weekly investment is approximately 400-500 soles because prices of these products vary according to the season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, es una mujer luchadora y con ganas de superación. Es madre soltera, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijas que ya son mayores, con ellas comparte el mismo deseo por seguir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos regionales. Su principal producto es el maíz en granos o maíz molido, aunque también vende arroz, plátano o animales domésticos. Tiene un local de venta instalado en su casa. Algunas veces lleva sus productos a otras ciudades para venderlos en los mercados o cuando tiene pedidos de clientes específicos y retorna a su pueblo después de una semana. Se dedica a este trabajo cerca de 25 años, pero en su local lleva 15 años, tiempo en el cual a llegado a ser muy conocida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da buenos ingresos económicos para solventar la economía de su casa; lo que no le gusta es que en ocasiones le falta dinero para invertir cuando se presenta una oportunidad de una buena compra. A pesar de ello tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y desea ampliar su negocio.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, como lo hizo en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas muy responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará diversos tipos de granos, por sacos, como arroz, maíz y frijol, e invertirá también en la compra de un lote de 10 racimos de plátano.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to better herself.  She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two adult daughters.  They share the same desire to get ahead.

She sells regional produce for a living.  Her main product is corn, in grains or milled, though she also sells rice, bananas, or domestic animals.  She has a shop set up in her home.  Sometimes she takes her produce to other cities to sell it in markets or when she has orders from specific customers and then she returns to her town in a week.  She has been doing this work for around 25 years, but she has been in her current location for 15 years, during which time she has become very well-known.  What she likes about her work is that it is profitable; it provides her with good income so she can cover her household expenses.  What she does not like is that sometimes she does not have enough money to invest when a good buying opportunity comes up.  Despite that, she is very motivated to keep working and she wants to expand her business.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as this makes her feel secure in moving ahead with her business.  She also promises to once again make her payments on time, as she did with her previous loan.  She likes being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. 

She will use the amount requested, 1,500 nuevos soles, to buy different kinds of grains by the sack, such as rice, corn, and beans, and she will also buy a batch of 10 bunches of bananas.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of grains by the sack, such as rice, corn, and beans, and to buy a batch of 10 bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en:
Saraphina is 59 years old and married, with seven children.  To earn a living, she does mixed farming. She rears dairy cows and grows food crops.  She has earned a living from farming for over 20 years.  She employs one person to assist her in her farm.

Saraphina has requested 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbage seedlings.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned about business record-keeping and financial management. This has helped her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cabbage seedlings.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón tiene 37 años, es un hombre luchador, carismático y muy trabajador. Su pareja es Zoila, quien es ama de casa. Vive con su pareja ya varios años y fruto de esa unión tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años, a quien ama muchísimo y es por quien se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante.
Hace 7 años compró su primer motocarro, desde entonces se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, todo este tiempo le ha servido para generar sus propios recursos económicos y además le ha permitido que los habitantes de la localidad en la que vive lo reconozcan como un buen conductor, ya que siempre brinda seguridad durante su recorrido. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, no tiene un horario de trabajo estricto que cumplir, y obtiene su propio dinero con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar. Pero principalmente le permite pasar momentos agradables al lado de su hijo en sus ratos libres; la única dificultad que encuentra son las continuas lluvias que se presentan en ésta época, lo que produce que las calles sin asfalto retracen su trabajo y deterioren algunas piezas de su vehículo. Aun así tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando hasta establecer una tienda de repuestos de motocarro.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó por ser una persona muy puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Y está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le están brindando para multiplicar su inversión.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará un motor nuevo que cuesta 800 soles. También cambiará el toldo y el tapizado que necesita su motocarro para que funcione en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Napoleon, 37, is a hardworking, charismatic man who fights for what he needs.  His partner is Zoila, who is a housewife.  He has lived with her for some years and they have a 6-year old son who they love very much and that is why every day he makes a big effort  to get ahead.

7 years ago he bought his first motorcar and since then he has transported passengers and this has generated his own income.  He is considered a good driver by the people of the area since he drives safely.  What he likes about his work is the independence.  He doesn’t have a fixed schedule that he has to adhere to and he makes his own money that he uses to support his household.  But principally he likes to spend happy times with his son when he can.  The only difficulty that he has found is the continual rains that come during this season. The unpaved streets slow his work and deteriorate some parts of his vehicle. But he still wants to continue working and set up a store for motorcar parts.

This is his 7th loan with MFP.  He is known as a very punctual and responsible person with his payments.  Napoleon is very grateful for the support that he has received in multiplying his investment.

He will use the 1500 new sols to buy a new motor that costs 800 sols.  He would also change the awning and the floor mats that his motorcar needs to function in top condition.

loans.use: to buy a new motor that costs 800 sols and to change the awning and the floormats that his motorcar needs to function in optimal shape.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
