She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads in various colors with pearls and sequins to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru:
Умар проживает в районе Б. Гафурова города Худжанд. Он живет с женой. Его жена домохозяйка. Сын Умара занимается капитальным ремонтом квартир. 
Умар предоставляет услугу. Он пять лет назад приобрел грузовой автомобиль на котором до сегодняшнего дня занимается перевозками. Умар очень хороший человек, он старается обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым. 
Умар просит кредит для ремонта грузового автомобиля и приобретения новой легковой автомашины. Он хочет продолжит свою деятельность, также хочет работать таксистом.
texts.en:
Umar lives in the Bobojon Ghafurov area of the city of Khujand. He lives with his wife, who stays at home. Umar's son renovates apartments for a living.
Umar works in the service industry. Five years ago he purchased a truck that he's been using to transport goods.
Umar is a good person and tries to provide for his family well. He has requested a loan to repair his truck and to buy a new car. He wants to maintain his business and also to start a taxi business.

loans.use: to repair his truck and to purchase a new car

loans.name: Diluvina

texts.es:
La señora Diluvina de 31 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que depende de ella y de su conyugue quien actualmente radican en la comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose ella junto con su conyugue a la venta de frutas, verduras en la inmediación del mercado de Nacaome.
Diluvina esta solicitando el préstamo de 5,000.00 lempiras para comprar algunas frutas como Sandias, Piñas, Papayas, Melones, Bananos, Naranjas, Cocos y Manzanas que sus clientes le están solicitando.
Diluvina con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento y atender mejor a sus clientes porque tendrá suficiente producto para suplir las necesidades de ellos.
El sueño de Diluvina es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Diluvina, 31 years old, is the mother of a son who is dependent on her and her husband. They are currently settled in the community of Nacaome in the southern part of Honduras. She and her husband sell fruit and vegetables in the vicinity of the Nacaome market.

Diluvina is applying for a loan of  5,000 HNL (Honduran lempira) in order to purchase fruit such as watermelon, pineapple, papayas, melons, bananas, oranges, coconuts and apples, which her customers have requested. With the help of this loan she wants to satisfy her funding needs and better care for her customers because then she will have sufficient products to meet their demands. 

Diluvina’s dream is to have her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August of 2012.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, pineapples, papayas, melons, bananas, oranges, coconuts and apples for her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 46 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Es madre de dos hijas a quienes crió y educó sola, ya que desde hace varios años se separó del que fue su conviviente por mucho tiempo. Vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho, pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y a su nieto de 4 años a quien cría.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa de segundo uso. Ella selecciona las prendas que están en mejor estado, luego separa las femeninas de las masculinas y finalmente distribuye aquellas que son de niños y adultos. Semanalmente se traslada, en compañía de una amiga, hacia los caseríos y centros poblados lejanos para vender su mercadería. Lleva en este negocio más de 13 años y le va muy bien. Adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede viajar por distintos lugares y traer también diversos productos que le regalan o intercambia con los pobladores de los caseríos. Recuerda que se inició con este negocio debido a los bajos ingresos que había en su hogar y esto ocasionaba que no pueda brindarles una buena educación a sus hijas, pero desde que empezó a trabajar con lo que hace hasta ahora, las cosas mejoraron mucho. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y agradece a todas aquellas personas que lo hacen posible. Se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más ropa para seguir con su negocio. También comprará frutas, golosinas y bebidas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old.  She is a friendly, good and hard-working woman.  She has two daughters, who she raised and educated on her own.  A number of years ago, she separated from her long-term partner.  She now lives in her own home and works a lot; she wants to give a better quality of life to her daughters and to her 4-year old grandson, who she is raising. 

Doris works selling second-hand clothing.  She selects the garments that are in the best condition, then separates the women's from the men's, and finally distributes the clothing, both children's and adult's.  On a weekly basis, Doris travels with a friend to the villages and out-lying towns to sell her merchandise.  She has been in this business for over 13 years, and it is going very well.  Additionally, Doris has a small grocery that she runs out of her home.  Doris likes her work because she can travel to different places and bring back various products that the people give to her or that she trades for in the villages.  Doris recalls that she started her business because her household's low income meant that she couldn't give her daughters a good education.  But since she started working at her current business, things have gotten a lot better. 

This is Doris's second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for all those who have made it possible for her to get a loan.  She feels satisfied with her communal bank; she feels that it's a united and supportive group.
With the sum she has requested of 2000 soles (USD $775), Doris will purchase more clothing for her business.  She will also purchase fruit, sweets and beverages for her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her business.  She will also purchase fruit, sweets and beverages to stock up her store.

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en:
Ser-Od is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in Hovd province of Mongolia. 

In 2005, Ser-Od started a sewing business. She produces the Mongolian national clothes and socks, slippers, and underlining made from wool. Mostly she takes orders from people and makes clothes. Her mom helps her business. 

Now she has many orders from customers for underlining because winter will come soon. She needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials to make underlinings. 

She is well-experienced in her own business. Her attitude is good.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make underlining.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal REYNA DEL CARMEN; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia Livia , la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día  a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y apoya a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de cds, restaurante, venta de ceviche, venta de artesania, crianza de animales menores, venta de zapatos.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This group belongs to the communal bank "Reyna Del Carmen"; this bank is located in the department of Cusco, Peru. 

One group member, Livia, is 27 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store, where she sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, sweets, soft drinks and more. Livia has been in this business a long time, which is going well thanks to the commitment that she puts in each day. She works Monday to Saturday from approximately 6:00 am to 9:00 pm. Livia is an earnest and responsible person and in this way she goes forward and supports her family. 

Livia is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as soft drinks. 

The other members of the communal bank make a living in the sale of CDs, ceviche, crafts, and shoes, and in animal breeding and running a restaurant. 

Livia is grateful for the loan given and commits to comply with the established repayment instalments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal PROSPEREMOS -CUSCO; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Felicitas  tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día  a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente ,el negocio de la socia se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y apoya a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de sacos de arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican a soldar maquinas, tienda de abarrotes, estudiantes universitarios, profesionales en contabilidad y socios que trabajan en empresas privadas.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Prosperemos-Cusco” Communal Bank. This bank is situated in the department of Cusco.

The member, Felicitas, is 46 years old, married and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, a grocery store. The member sells different kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, sweets and soft drinks, among others. The member has had this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort she invests into it every day. The member works Monday to Saturday from approximately 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. Her business is located in her home. The member is a responsible and hardworking person and in this way she hopes to get ahead and support her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice.

The other members weld machines, run a grocery store, study in the university, are professional accountants and work in private businesses.

This member is grateful for the loan provided her and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive, hace 19 años, con Antonio, y junto a él tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 10 años. Vive en su casa propia, la construyó en base a mucho esfuerzo y esmero. 
Su actividad es la venta de comidas típicas de la región (asados de carne, pollo, cerdo y pescado), para ello instala, en el frontis de su casa, una mesa, sillas y su cocina, donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 6 de la tarde. Lleva en este negocio 5 meses y trabaja sola. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades diarias que requiere la crianza de sus hijos. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando el precio de los insumos que utiliza suben repentinamente reduciendo sus ganancias. Tiene planes de seguir con su negocio ampliándolo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que cada uno de sus miembros son personas buenas y cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará todos los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus comidas (arroz, aceites, papas y otros).
texts.en:
Isabel, 50, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s lived with Antonio for the last 19 years and they have three children who are 17, 15 and 10 years old.  She lives in her own house that she built with much effort and drive.

Her activity is selling traditional regional dishes (grilled meat, chicken, pork and fish).  To do so, she installs tables, chairs and her stove in her front yard and there takes care of customers kindly and cordially.  She works every day from 6pm on.  She’s been in business five months and works alone.  She likes her business because she can earn income to cover some of her household expenses and the daily needs that arise in raising her children.  On the other hand, she’s not happy when the price of ingredients she uses rises suddenly cutting into her profits.   She plans to continue in business expanding it with better chairs and tables to provide more customer comfort. 

This is her second MFP loan and she’s grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue in business and advance with her plans.  She comments that she feels good in her communal bank because she considers each of the members to be a responsible, good person.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy all the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes (rice, oil, potatoes and others).

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 23 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Está casada, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus suegros, trabaja mucho pues sea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida. Su trabajo se inicia desde muy temprano, todos los días se dirige al mercado a comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los más ricos platillos con los que deleita a sus clientes. Empieza a las 5 de la tarde hasta que termine todo lo que preparó, vende en la vereda de la casa de sus suegros, donde instala una mesa, sillas y una cocina. Trabaja sola y lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 3 años. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede dedicarles el tiempo y la atención necesaria a sus hijos que aun son pequeños y necesitan de su cuidado. Durante el tiempo que tiene trabajando en este negocio aprendió a brindarle siempre una sonrisa al cliente y darle una buena atención, pues eso hace que vuelvan a su puesto y de esta forma conserva su clientela. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora e implementar su negocio con más mesas y sillas hasta conseguir un establecimiento más grande.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo, ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio. Además afirma sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que todos sus miembros son personas responsables y muy comprometidas.
Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará una mesa y cuatro sillas, cuyo precio promedio es 100 soles. Otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes e insumos para sus comidas.
texts.en:
Jessica’s  23-years-old.  She’s a kind, good, hardworking woman.  She’s married and has two children who are 7 and 2 years old.  She lives in her in-laws’ house and works hard to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She sells food.  Her work starts very early.  She heads out to the market every day to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her most delicious dishes to delight her customers with.  Once she has everything prepared, at five in the afternoon she sets up to sell along the sidewalk by her in-laws’ house where she sets up a table, chairs and a stove.  She works alone and has been doing this for the last three years.  She likes her work because she can give her children who are still little the necessary time and attention; they still need her care.  During the time she’s spent at this work she’s learned how to always welcome her customers with a smile and good service because that insures that they will return to her stand and she retains her customers this way.  She hopes to continue working like she’s been doing to date and to equip her business with more tables and chairs until she has a bigger establishment.

This is her second MFP loan and she feels happy with the financial support she’s getting because it will help her advance with her business.  She also affirms that she feels good in her communal bank because she considers all the members to be responsible and very committed.

She will use the requested 500 soles to buy a table and four chairs that cost on average 100 soles.  She will use the rest of the money to buy the ingredients and supplies for her meals.

loans.use: to buy a table, four chairs and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Adriana Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Adriana y su esposo el señor José son originarios de Nuevo Laredo tiene poco tiempo que se casaron y tiene un pequeño hijo, quien les preocupa su salud actualmente se encuentra enfermo y necesita que le realicen un operación, pero no cuentan con el dinero necesaria para poder atenderlo y mejorar la salud.
Solicitan el préstamo para poder atender a su hijo y que pronto este mejor de salud y mejorar su calidad de vida.
La señora Adriana anteriormente tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, por la enfermedad de su hijo, ya no pudo seguir con su actividad, quien se encarga de los gastos es el señor José con su trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el aria de gerente de personal, con este ingreso pagaran el préstamo y que para ellos la salud de su hijo es lo mas importante.
texts.en:
Adriana and her husband, José, are from Nuevo Laredo and they were married a short time ago.  She has a small son who is ill at present and she’s worried about his health; he needs surgery but they don’t have the money needed to provide the care and improve his health.

They are requesting the loan to be able to give medical attention to their son so that his health will improve soon and so will his quality of life.

Adriana used to have a business selling clothes but due to her son’s illness she was unable to continue with it.  José who works in the personnel department of a transportation firm is in charge of expenses.  They will use his salary to repay the loan because for them their son’s health is what’s most important.

loans.use: to pay her son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Jiovanni

texts.es:
Jiovanni tiene 38 años, es una mujer pujante y trabajadora. Vive en casa de su madre, junto a su esposo y 10 personas más; entre ellos, hermanos y sobrinos.
Su actividad consiste en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas aprovechando el intenso calor que caracteriza a su ciudad. Trabaja sola desde hace un año y comparte esta función con el negocio de venta de madera junto a su esposo. Está muy contenta con ambos trabajos porque puede estar en contacto constante con sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes con lo que ha formado una buena relación de negocio. Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por ello que más adelante desea establecer una distribuidora de bebidas para ofrecer cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor. Además desea tener su casa propia y vivir con la familia que ha formado con su esposo.

Este es su segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado. Además está muy decidida a cumplir, una vez más, con sus pagos de manera puntual como lo hizo en su crédito anterior. Le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo que integra, ya que reconoce que todos los miembros que participan son personas muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 2400 soles, comprará más madera, ya que tiene un pedido que desea cumplir a tiempo. Otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Jiovanni, 38, is a driven, hardworking woman.  She lives in her mother’s house with her husband and ten other people, her siblings and nephews among them.  

Her activity consists in selling soft-drinks and beer taking advantage of the intense heat that characterizes her city.  She’s worked alone for the last year and shares this activity with a business selling lumber with her husband.  She’s very happy with both jobs because she can be in constant contact with her friends, neighbors and customers that she’s formed good business relationships with.  Even though her business produces good income she still feels it’s not enough to cover all her household expenses which is why she wants to set up a beverage distributorship later on to offer beer and soft-drinks at wholesale.  She also wants to have a house of her own and to live with the family she’s formed with her husband.

This is her second MFP loan and she thanks all the people who make it possible so that she can continue towards her objectives and her programmed growth.  She’s also very determined to once again make her payments punctually like she’s done in the past.  She’s very pleased to be part of her group because she recognizes that all the members who participate are punctual, responsible people.

She will use the requested 2400 soles to buy more lumber since she has a pending order she wants to fill on time.  She will use the rest of the money to buy more soft-drinks and beer.

loans.use: to buy lumber, soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es:
Gino tiene 24 años, es un joven amable y emprendedor. Está casado y tiene un hijo de un año, quien es su inspiración para trabajar día a día. Vive en casa de sus padres, a lado de su esposa y sus hermanos.
Él se dedica a la edición de audio y video para programas televisivos y radiales de su región; además de alquilar su equipo y algunos otros implementos para fiestas y eventos sociales. Parte de su trabajo consiste en realizar comerciales, sesiones fotográficas, narrar algunos documentales, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la casa de su madre, ahí le dieron un espacio para que lo convierta en su oficina. Lleva 3 años en este trabajo y siente que le va bien, ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado. Le gusta su trabajo, se divierte haciéndolo ya que es algo que le fascina desde muy niño. Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está capacitándose en nuevas técnicas de sonido y diseño. Ha ganado muchos clientes y espera seguir con su etapa de crecimiento. Su meta principal es poner un estudio de sonido totalmente implementado, por lo pronto va comprando poco a poco algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para su trabajo.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su negocio. Además está a gusto con su asesor de crédito y con los miembros de su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes, la mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará algunos cables que necesita renovar, realizará la reparación de un parlante y comprará focos de luces a colores que necesita para alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Gino is 24 years old. He is a kind and enterprising young man. He is married and has a one-year-old son, who is his inspiration to work harder every day. He lives in his parents' house, along with his wife and siblings.

He works in sound and video editing for television and radio programs in his area. He also rents out his equipment and some other implements for parties and social events. Part of his work is making commercials, photo shoots, narrating some documentaries, etc. He works from his mother's house, where he was given a space to convert into his office. He has been doing this for three years and he thinks business is going well because his customers have multiplied. He likes his work and has fun doing it, because it is something that has always fascinated him ever since he was very young. He has learned a lot during the time he has been in this line of work and he is constantly training on new sound and design techniques. He has gained many customers and hopes to keep growing. His main goal is to set up a fully equipped sound studio, so for the time being has started buying a few of the instruments he needs for his work little by little.

This is his second loan with MFP. He is happy and grateful for the financial support he receives in order to keep his business going. He also feels comfortable with his loan consultant and with the members of his communal bank, because he knows them. Most of them are his neighbors and he considers them responsible people.

He will use the amount requested, 500 soles, to purchase some cables that need replacing and to repair a speaker. He will also buy colored spotlights he needs so that he can rent them.

loans.use: to purchase new cables, repair a speaker, and buy colored spotlights to rent.

loans.name: Ely Sabet

texts.es:
Ely es una persona muy luchadora que ha logrado superar grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Aprendió la actividad de la confección gracias a que su madre se dedicó gran parte de su vida a esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñó, y así consiguió trabajo con una diseñadora. La diseñadora la motivó para que estudiara y así aprovechó la experiencia que tenía para ser una gran diseñadora; ahora, que tiene tanto el conocimiento como la experiencia, ha montado su propio taller de confección desde su casa el cual inició con muy bajo capital comprando una máquina de segunda y poco a poco ha venido saliendo adelante comprando las herramientas de trabajo que requiere para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Ely es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 14 años y gracias a su taller ha tenido la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar y ofrecer a su hijo una mejor educación. Debido a que no cuenta con mucho capital, Ely busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas como telas e hilos y confeccionar un gran pedido que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar su propia marca de ropa y montar un almacén para poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y que han tenido que atravesar por tantas adversidades como ella.
texts.en:
Ely’s a person who is very tenacious and has managed to overcome great difficulties life has presented her.  She learned dressmaking from her mother who spent a great part of her life in this occupation and taught it to her when she was still very young.  This was how she got a job with a designer.  The designer motivated her to study and take advantage of the experience she had to become a great designer herself.  Now that she has both the knowledge and the experience she’s set up her own dressmaking workshop at home.  She started it with very little capital buying a second-hand sewing machine and has gradually been getting ahead buying work tools she needs to provide better service.

Ely is a single mother, head of household.  She has a 14-year-old son and thanks to her workshop has been able to improve her home’s economic condition and offer her son a better education.  Because she does not have much capital, Ely is looking for financing to buy raw materials like fabric and thread to fill a large pending order she has from one of her customers.  

Her dream is to produce her own line of clothes and to open a store to generate employment for people who are most in need and have had to go through adversities like she has.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Yuliana Alejandra

texts.es:
Yuliana se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, hace un tiempo decidió montar su propio negocio para poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar a tener una mejor calidad de vida. A pesar de que la venta de verduras y frutas la montó con muy bajo capital, Yuliana siempre ha tenido un gran empuje y dedicación que le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante poco a poco, y desde que tiene su negocio la calidad de vida en su hogar ha venido mejorando. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio para sus clientes, Yuliana busca un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y poder conservar algunos productos que se le están dañando.

Su sueño es poder salir adelante con este negocio y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yuliana’s married and has two children. Because the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, she decided some time ago to start her own business to contribute economically to her home and have a better quality of life.  

Even though she started her fruit and vegetable business with very little capital, Yuliana has been driven and dedicated and this  has led her to gradually get ahead.  Since she’s had the business her quality of life at home has been improving.  

Looking to offer better customer service, Yuliana is looking for financing to buy a refrigerator to store some products that have been spoiling.  Her dream is to be able to get ahead with the business and to provide her children with a better quality of life and access to better quality education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store products and avoid spoilage.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria se encuentra casada, tiene una hija de 8 años y es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y superar las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a confeccionar y gracias a unos ahorros decidió independizarse y montar su taller de confección en su hogar para poder estar al cuidado de su hija y de su negocio. Con su taller de confección tiene la oportunidad de contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y poco a poco ir superando las dificultades económicas que se presentan. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos, sus pedidos se han ido incrementando; es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana y aumentar su capacidad de producción para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder sacar su hija adelante brindándole una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Además, aspira a poderle brindar el acceso a una educación universitaria en un futuro.
texts.en:
Gloria is married and has an 8 year-old daughter.  She is a hardworking person who, with a lot of effort, has managed to get ahead and overcome the great adversities that life has presented her.  A long time ago she started to sew garments, and thanks to some savings, she decided to become independent and set up a sewing workshop in her home.  This way she could be there to care for her daughter and her business.  With her sewing workshop, she has the opportunity to make a financial contribution to the household so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life and gradually overcome the financial difficulties they face.  Thanks to the good quality of her work, her orders have been increasing.  This is why she is seeking a loan to buy a tabletop sewing machine, so that she can increase her production capacity to respond to her customers' orders.  

Her main dream is to be able to help her daughter get ahead by providing her with a good quality of life and access to a good quality education.  Also, she aspires to be able to provide her with access to a university education in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y esto le ha permitido salir adelante a pesar de las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Nancy cuenta con una gran experiencia en la actividad de la preparación de alimentos, pues trabajó durante muchos años en diferentes restaurantes, pero debido a que el padre de su hijo la abandonó hace un tiempo, se vio en la obligación de dejar su empleo para poder generar ingresos mayores que le permitieran tener el sustento necesario para sostener su hogar. Fue así como comenzó vendiendo fritos a las afueras de una tienda que le permitieron ubicarse y ahora un año después tiene la oportunidad de seguir creciendo en su negocio. Es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar un carro de comidas rápidas para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es poder sacar su hijo adelante brindándole una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking; this has made it possible for her to get ahead despite the great difficulties life has presented her with.  Nancy has a great deal of experience preparing food because she worked in various restaurants for many years.  However, because the father of her child abandoned them some time ago, she was forced to leave her job in order to earn higher income so that she could earn enough to support her home alone.

This is how she started to sell fried fast-food outside a store that gave her permission to set up there and now a year later she has the opportunity to continue growing in business which is why she’s looking for financing to buy a fast-food cart to offer more products to her customers thus increasing income for her home.  Her greatest dream is to raise her son and offer him a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to move forward.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart.

loans.name: Marleny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marleny aprendió desde muy joven la actividad de la confección y consiguió trabajo rápidamente en una empresa, y así contribuía económicamente con sus padres para tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Posteriormente se casó y se dedicó totalmente a las labores del hogar y a cuidar a sus 2 hijos, pero debido a que su esposo murió y quedó como madre soltera a cargo de sus hijos, se vio en la obligación de volver a trabajar y así comenzó nuevamente un tiempo trabajando para otras personas. Ya hace un tiempo logró tener unos ahorros que le permitieron comprarse una máquina básica para la confección y montó su propio taller de confección en su casa, y ahora ofrece a sus clientes toda clase de confección en productos para bebés. Debido a que hace unos días un hijo suyo se encontraba en graves problemas de salud, se vio en la obligación de abandonar su trabajo durante un tiempo, y ahora que puede retomar la actividad busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos y confeccionar algunos pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder terminar de sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación y lograr sacar su taller adelante para que crezca y pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Marleny learned dressmaking while still very young and quickly got a job in a firm.  She helped her parents economically so that they could have a better quality of life at home.  Later when she got married she was a full-time housewife caring for her two children but due to her husband’s death, she was left a single mother in charge of her children.  

She was forced to return to work and started to work once again as an employee of others.  Some time ago she managed to save up enough to buy a basic sewing machine and she set up her own workshop at home and now she offers her customers all kinds of services sewing infant wear.  Her son became gravely ill a few days ago and she had to stop working during that time.  Now that she can restart her work she’s looking for financing to buy supplies like fabric and thread to fill some pending customer orders she has.

Her greatest dream is to be able to finish raising her two children providing them with a good education and to succeed in moving her workshop ahead so that it will grow and be able to generate employment to those in greatest need.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides se dedica desde hace más de 20 años a la actividad de la agricultura gracias a que su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó desde muy joven. Actualmente se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, y con su cultivo de verduras genera los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de su familia. Debido a que el invierno le ha hecho perder grandes partes de su cultivo, pues no ha contado con el capital suficiente para poder reabonarlo y sacarlo adelante, Alcides busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos, y riegos para preservar su cultivo de los malos climas.

De esta manera podrá sacar productos de buena calidad y venderlos a un buen precio, de modo que su familia seguirá contando con los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento. Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y brindarle a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Alcides has spent more than 20 years working in agriculture because his father was also in this occupation and taught it to him when he was still very young.  He’s married now and has two children who are 4 and 7 years old and with his vegetable crops is able to generate income needed to support his family.

Winter has caused significant crop losses and he does not have the funds needed to re-fertilize and move forward, Alcides is looking for financing to buy supplies like fertilizer, insecticide, manure and irrigation supplies to protect his crops from the bad weather.

In this way he will be able to produce good quality products and sell them for a good price so that his family can continue to have the income necessary for their support.  His dream is to move the business ahead and provide his two children with access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 52-year-old married woman who has been in the work of sweater weaving for almost 10 years. She works hard on her weaver every day so she may earn a living for her family. Currently she has 5 children and her husband makes his living as a daily worker. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without any money. His heart was heavy with the burden of facing his family’s disappointed faces. Her children often slept without having any food.

When Kashf’s loan officers found her in these circumstances they informed her about microfinance and the facilities they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so she could start her work. She said she remembered doing it with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase threads of different colors for weaving. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To purchase threads of different colors for weaving.

loans.name: Libardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Libardo aprendió la actividad de la venta de legumbres observando a las personas y negocios de su municipio como compraban y vendían los alimentos, y desde hace un tiempo tiene una legumbrería donde vende verduras y frutas a sus clientes. Con este negocio genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para sostener los gastos de su esposa y sus 8 hijos, y debido a que su negocio no le ofrece siempre los ingresos suficientes para esto, a menudo tiene grandes dificultades económicas que supera poco a poco con el esfuerzo que hace trabajando. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, Libardo busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de verduras y frutas y continuar ofreciendo a sus clientes buenos productos.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y hacerlo crecer para captar mayor número de clientes. Además, aspira a poder sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas a su esposa y sus 8 hijos.
texts.en:
Libardo learned to sell vegetables watching people and business in his town who were food retailers.  For some time now he’s had a fruit and vegetable shop where he sells fruit and vegetables to his customers. He generates income with this business needed to support his home and cover expenses for his wife and 8 children.

Because the business doesn’t always produce enough income for this he often has great economic difficulties that he gradually overcomes by working.  Seeking to overcome his present difficulty with capital, Libardo is looking for a loan to buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables to continue offering good quality products to his customers.

His dream is to move the business forward and to make it grow in order to capture a larger number of customers.  He also hopes to move his family forward providing them with a better quality of life and better economic opportunities for his wife and 8 children.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Wilson

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 12 y 14 años de edad y desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la actividad de la construcción; gracias a esta experiencia que tiene ha podido tener muy buena reputación para lograr tener muy buenos clientes. Jose, debido a que nunca ha podido contar con un gran capital, siempre ha trabajado la mayoría de las veces con herramientas alquiladas, lo que hace que sus ingresos se vean fuertemente afectados por el pago de este alquiler, y es por esto que ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para comprar un soldador eléctrico y un taladro y así tener sus propias herramientas y no pagar los altos alquileres.

Su sueño es poder sacar su familia adelante ofreciéndoles una buena educación a sus hijos y una calidad de vida digna a toda su familia en el hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is married and has three children of  3, 12 and 14 years of age. For a long time he has been earning his living through construction work, and thanks to this experience he has a good reputation which has allowed him to obtain good customers. As he has never had much capital, Jose has usually worked with borrowed tools, and these hiring costs have impacted significantly on his income. For this reason, now that he has the opportunity, he is asking for a loan to buy an electric solder and a drill, and in this way to have his own tools and not pay the high rent. 

His dream is to be able to improve his family's situation; provide his children with a good education and a offer dignified way of life to all of his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric solder and a drill so as to have his own tools and not pay rent.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar su negocio adelante y superar las dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace un tiempo montó su propio negocio de venta de artesanías, el cual a pesar de haberlo montado sin mucho capital ha trabajado fuertemente y esto le ha permitido sacarlo adelante. Buscando superar sus dificultades de capital, Jorge busca un préstamo para comprar artesanías y surtir su negocio con productos que ya se han ido agotando. 

Su mayor sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hardworking person who with a lot of effort has managed to get his business ahead and overcome the difficulties he has faced in life.  Some time ago he set up his own business selling arts and crafts.  Despite having set it up without very much capital, he has worked hard and this has allowed him to get it ahead.

Looking to overcome his money difficulties, Jorge is looking for a loan to buy handicrafts and supply his business with products that have already been selling out.

His biggest dream is to be able to get his business ahead and give his family better economic conditions to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to supply his business

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela se encuentra casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 ya son adultos y tienen sus propias familias y trabajos y 3 de ellos aún son jóvenes a quienes les debe garantizar la educación y una buena calidad de vida en su hogar. Debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, Mariela decidió montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera estar al tanto del cuidado de sus hijos, por lo que montó una venta de productos de la canasta familiar desde su casa y esto le permite generar ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Debido a que ha tenido muy buenas ventas, pero ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Mariela busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir los productos que ya se le han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación de buena calidad y aspira a que en un futuro pueda ofrecerles el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Mariela is married and has 7 children. 4 of her children are adults and have their own families and jobs, while the other 3 children are still young enough that she must guarantee their education and a good quality of life at home.  Because the income that her husband earns is not sufficient to sustain the household costs, Mariela decided to establish her own business with which she would be able to take care of her children.  For this reason, she began to sell staple goods for the family's basic needs from her home, and this permitted her to generate income with which she can contribute economically to support her household costs.  She has had many good sales, but she still doesn't earn sufficient capital, so Mariela is seeking this loan to buy staple goods and to restock supplies of the products that she has already sold.

Her dream is to be able to offer to her children a good education, and in the future she aspires to be able to offer them access to a university education.

loans.use: to buy staple goods and restock supplies of products that she has already sold

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es:
JORGE TIENE 20 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIVE CON SUS PADRES EN CHIMBO NO TIENE HIJOS.

EL TRABAJA EN MAXICARNES COMO VENDEDOR EL DINERO NECESITA COMPRA EL ELECTRODOMESTICO EL DINERO LE AYUDADO A REALIZAR LAS COMPRAS EN EFECTIVO ES NECESARIO PARA AMOBLAR LA CASA DE LOS PADRES-

JORGE SUEÑA CON TRABAJAR PARA TENER DINERO PARA AYUDAR A LOS PADRES.

LE GUSRA HACER DEPORTE.
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo, and he does not have children.

He works at Maxicarnes [a store that sells meat] as a seller.  He needs the money to buy a household appliance.  The money helped him pay cash when he shopped.  It is needed to furnish his parents’ house.

Jorge dreams of working in order to have money to help his parents.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy a household appliance.

loans.name: Yonar Alexander

texts.es:
Yonar se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijas de 4 y 7 años de edad y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar tiene un taller de reparación de motores de guadañadoras y otras máquinas utilizadas en la agricultura. La idea de su negocio surgió cuando un cliente le dijo que este tipo de talleres no se encontraban muy fácil y eso hacía que los sobrecostos por transporte de las piezas de repuesto hicieran muy apetecido un negocio así cercano. Fue así que Yonar con la experiencia que tiene y haber estudiado mecánica decide montar su negocio de reparación de motores. Desde que montó su taller la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente y sus hijas han podido acceder a una educación de mejor calidad, sin embargo aún cuenta con grandes dificultades de capital en su negocio y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar repuestos que requiere para la reparación de los motores y una estantería para ubicar los repuestos y sus herramientas.

Su sueño es poder sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una mejor educación a sus hijas y una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar.
texts.en:
Yonar is married and has two daughters, ages 4 and 7.  To generate the household income he needs he has a repair shop for motors for lawnmowers and other agricultural machines.

The idea of his business came up when a customer told him that this type of shop was not easy to find.  This made the overhead for transporting the parts desirable for a nearby business.  This was how Yonar, with his experience and having studied mechanics, decided to set up his motor-repair business.

Since he set up his shop, his family's quality of life has improved considerably and his daughters have been able to get a better education.  Nevertheless, he still has a lot of problems with capital in his business, so he's looking for a loan to buy the parts he needs to repair motors and shelves for storing the parts and his tools.

His dream is to be able to get his family ahead, giving his daughters a better education and a better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy parts for repairs and shelves to store the parts and his tools

loans.name: José Napoleón

texts.es:
Don José tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos. Es agricultor por herencia de sus padres, desde la edad de 14 años y él a su vez se la ha transferido a sus hijos. 

Posee una pequeña tienda en su casa, la mercadería la adquiere en la ciudad; así, como también los insumos agrícolas para realizar sus cultivos. El préstamo que esta solicitando don José es para comprar agroquímicos, pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Él necesita de estos insumos, ya que el gobierno les suministro un paquete agrícola; pero  no le es suficiente. Debido a que él necesita asegurar el maíz para el consumo de su familia para el próximo año. 

Él desea remodelar su casa, mas que todo el techo, pues esta en malas condiciones se filtra el agua generando humedad dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
José, age 52, is married and has two children.  He has been a farmer since he was 14, work he inherited from his parents.  He, in turn, has passed this on to his children.

He has a small store in his house.  He gets his merchandise in the city.  He also gets the farming supplies for his crops there.

The loan that José is requesting is to buy agrochemicals and to pay for the labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.  He needs these supplies.  The government supplies them with an agricultural package, but it is not enough for him.  This is because he needs to assure that there is corn for his family’s consumption next year.

He wants to redo his house, the roof most of all, because it is in bad shape.  The water leaks, which generates humidity in the home.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals and to pay for the labor to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Jose Rafael

texts.es:
JOSE TIENE 53 AÑÓS EDAD ES SOLTERO NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN CHIMBO.

TRABAJA EN EL MUNICIPO DE CHIMBO COMO BODEGUERO, EL DIENRO LO SOLICITA PARA EL ARREGLO DE LA VIVIENDA PARA LA COMPRAR DE CEMENTO LADRILLOS HIERRO EL DIENRO LE AYUDADO A COMPRAR LOS AMTERIALES PARA ARREGLAR LA CASA.

JORGE SUEÑA CON SEGUIR TRABAJANDO EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRE SE DEDICA A CAMINAR CON ALGUNOS AMIGOS.
texts.en:
José, 53, is single and has no children.  He lives in Chimbo.  He works in the town of Chimbo as a shopkeeper.

He's requesting the money to buy cement, bricks, and iron to fix up his house.  The money helped him to buy the materials to fix up the house.

Jorge dreams of continuing to work.  In his free time he likes to walk with some friends.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and iron

loans.name: Heshw's Group

texts.en:
Heshw is a young Iraqi woman with great ambitions at the age of 18. She is living with her family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Heshw is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She started working a year ago and would like to make the little business more efficient, and be able to put her skills to use in more creative ways and offer a greater variety of choices for her customers. She would like to buy a better quality sewing machine, an embroidery machine and some small furniture items for her work area. To be able to make these purchases she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor, and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a better quality sewing machine, an embroidery machine and some small furniture items for her work area.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and a single mother of two. She does farming to earn a living. She has employed one person to assist her in her business. Mary works so hard in her business so as to provide for her family. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills.

Mary hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested for 20,000 KES to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is married to a beautiful woman by the name of Cellina, and they have one young child to whom he wants to provide a good quality of life. Antony, who is one of the successful businessmen in his town, has been operating a motorcycle taxi for two years. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers.

Antony is now requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase a new motorcycle. In this way, he will have the opportunity to provide better service and increase his income, which will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 35-year-old married man, father of one child. He has worked fixing auto bodies for the past 21 years. He was only 14 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living. Mahmoud opened his own garage in 2007, and is well-known in the area for his good quality of work. Mahmoud is working hard on expanding his business to make sure that his customers are highly satisfied.

Mahmoud loves his family a lot and works hard to provide them with the best living. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary furniture for his house. This loan will help him a lot, and won't affect his business capital. It will fulfill his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture for his house.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Marié à une coiffeuse, Kokou âgé de 26ans n’a pas d’enfant en charge. Après son apprentissage en couture, il a ouvert un atelier et est aidé par 01 personne dans l’exécution de ses activités. C’est depuis 2005 qu’il a son atelier et désire ce premier pour acheter des machines à coudre afin de bien répondre aux besoins des clients. a l’avenir, il veut assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille et satisfaire toutes les demandes des clients.
texts.en:
Married to a hair stylist, Kokou is 26 years old, and has no children in his care.  After completing a sewing apprenticeship, he has opened a shop and has one assistant who helps him with the business.

He opened his shop in 2005, and he is requesting a first loan to buy some sewing machines in order to adequately meet his customers' needs.

In the future, he would like to ensure the happiness of his family and be able to meet all of his customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Chea is aged 41 years and married. She has two dependent children, one son and one daughter, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 11 years and is supplementing the family’s income by planting beans and sometimes working for others for a fee. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day for the future. Low crop yield caused by insects is the main challenge for the paddy rice business. 

Chea’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and this is the groups first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to receive more yields and increase her income in order to build on her savings to buy an additional plot of farmland for the purpose of improving a better living and keeping her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 60-year-old divorced man and father of one child who he has spent his whole life taking good care of. Seventeen years ago, Ahmad opened his present shop for selling school bags and purses, in addition to scout's clothes. He has 40 years of experience in this field with a very good reputation. This long experience has helped him gain customer's trust and support.

To improve his business, Ahmad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with a new released collection highly requested for the summer season. Through this loan he will be capable of increasing his income and expanding his collection to please his customers.

He is the only one in the region who works in wholesale trade and is working hard on expanding his business.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new released collection.

loans.name: Kinuthia

texts.en:
Kinuthia is forty-five years old, married to Esther and they are blessed with three children. His wife operates a business and assists in the upkeep of the family. He will use the loan to purchase five piglets and expand his pig pen.

He has been in this business for a period of six years now and it earns him a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings. This will be his second loan with KADET LTD.

The anticipated profits from his business will be used to plough back into the business. He hopes to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets and expand his pig pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36 years old. She is a woman who has worked very hard to make a living. She lives with her children and is struggling to provide for them. She is a divorced mother who has never lost hope since the divorce. She operates a food stall selling a variety of dishes. In addition, she also sells tomatoes and vegetables from home and door to door during her free time.

As the primary source of income for her family, Rebecca's business is very important to her. She is requesting this loan from Yehu in order to further invest in her business and offer a wider variety of food stuff to her customers. She also plans to use this loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, meat, etc., which will hopefully increase her output potential and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 24 years old, a business man, and is married to Lillian, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been a hawker for five years with the monthly income of KES 19,500 which he uses to support his family.  

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. James will use the loan to buy more watches, belts, torches and albums. 


With the anticipated profit he will open a retail shop and educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more watches, belts, torches and albums

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cases of beverages.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy does tailoring to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to buy a sewing machine for her business. With the additional income, she was able to support her family. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 44-year-old mother of four children between the ages of 10 and 24. Two of her children are her own, and two from her husband’s widow. Her husband is no longer with the family and she raises her children alone, with perseverance, love and determination. Aisha raises chickens and needed a loan for certain expansions and changes.

Aisha took this loan to build a larger chicken growing area that includes water, electricity, and a chicken preparation portion.

Aisha's plans for the future are to ensure her children study and to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to pay for building a larger chicken growing area that includes water,  electricity, and a chicken preparation portion.

loans.name: Bunyodjon

texts.ru: Бунёджону 18 лет. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный парень. В школе он учился отлично. С детства он мечтал получить высшее образование и стать хорошим специалистом. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. С самых ранних лет он занимался скотоводством и выращивание сельхоз культур. Он окончил школу в этом году и поступил в университет, но доход его родителей не хватает для оплаты учебы. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 500 долларов США для оплаты учебы. Он очень надеется на вашу доброту!
texts.en: Bunyodjon is 18 years old. He is a very hard-working and goal-oriented person. He was an excellent student in secondary school. Since he was a child his dream was to go to college and become a true professional. His family had many struggles. From an early age Bunyodjon was raising livestock and growing produce. This year he has graduated from secondary school and has been admitted to the university, but his parents' income is insufficient to pay the tuition. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 USD in order to pay his tuition. He is very much hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Comfort Mah

texts.en:
She is a single mother with five children and they live in Mbengwi, Momo Division of the North West region of Cameroon. Being a single mother, she has faced many difficulties in life which include inadequate funds to take care of her children including providing them with medication, adequate education and other necessities of life.

Since she joined GHAPE in the year 1998, her life has become a success story. She can now be proud of educating her children, having a poultry farm to call her own, and she is also engaged in gardening. She has taken out and repaid her loans 14 times and says, if given the new loan, she will expand her business, add more chicks to her poultry farm and also do a table business. She holds the positive view that her business will succeed because of her longevity in the business. She has attended seminars on poultry farming and says the community will have quality products at low prices from her business. Her products will be available to them at all times. Also, she will give credit to trustworthy customers.

With the profit from her business, she will educate her children, provide medication for her family, add a room to her compound and also engage in the production of fruits like watermelon, pineapple, lime and lemon. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, convenient repayment intervals, availability of a loan when in demand, and the education of members before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase fowl, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
This is Mwanaidi, 28, a resident of Samburu, Kenya. She is the mother of three children and is married to Nyambu who operates a meat goat business. She works hard to continually provide money for their everyday expenses.

Mwanaidi raises and sells chickens. She tells us that she normally buys chicken from the villagers, then raises them before taking them to the market to sell. Her primary customers are cafe and hotel operators.

To help her continue operating her business, Mwanaidi is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Yehu. She will use the loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Mwanaidi hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jane  Gacheri

texts.en: Jane is 45 years old and married with two children who are in school. She does tailoring to earn a living. She operates her business in a competitive environment. She has been in this business for the last twenty years. She has employed one person to help her in her business. Since she has become a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. Jane dreams of opening more branches in different locations in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
She is a widow with six children and they live in Mbengwi Momo Division, North West Region, Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life including poverty and ill health. She faced the death of her husband leaving her with no choice but to provide medication, education and three square meals to her children alone.

She joined GHAPE in the year 1999 and has taken out and repaid loans 11 times. If given the new loan requested, she promises to buy chicks, feed for the chicks, chick medication and also get involved in a little bit of agriculture. From this activity, her community will develop widely. She will convince community members to buy the chicks and keep them to resell, so as to make profit. She will supply at low prices and also supply some on occasions warranting the need for chicken meat. She holds the positive view that her business will succeed because of her longevity in the business, experience and commitment.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children, provide medication for her children and also take care of other children of the family. She says GHAPE loans are preferable because of the low interest rate and no collateral before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fowl and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his drink stock.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 25 years old and a single businessman. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 11,200, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Benjamin will use the loan to open a cyber café. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will service his motorbike. His hope is to expand his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To open a cyber café

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwavita  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Sinaï, âgée d’environ 46 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient  tous. Son mari est chômeur. La  cliente fait le petit commerce des articles divers. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile. Vers 1998, elle démarra son activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard vers les  années 2006, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Les bénéfices de ses affaires lui servent de supporter sa famille. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises entre autres 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sucres, 10 paires des souliers, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, construire une maison  confortable.  La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The client Mwavita is an entrepreneur and leader of the business group Sinai. She is around 46 years old and mother of 8 children who are all studying. Her husband is unemployed. The client does business selling various items. She sets up her merchandise at home. Around 1998 she started her business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, around 2006, she benefited from her first loan from IMF Hekima, used to strengthen her capital. She uses the profits from her business to support her family. This new loan will be used for her to stock up on new merchandise, among other items, 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 10 pairs of shoes, etc. Her ambition is to grow her business and build a comfortable house. The client thanks IMF Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women unable to use traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 10 pairs of shoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is taking out another loan to expand her business. She has been selling paraffin for some time which has earned her good results. She is intending to incorporate diesel selling in her business. This is the reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a gallon of diesel to resell. Beatrice dreams of owning a petrol station in the future. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of diesel to resell.

loans.name: Shangilieni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chikwanine est présidente et doyenne du groupe de crédit  Shangilieni, elle lève sa main sur la photo, veuve, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son mari est décédé vers les années  2005 suite à une courte maladie. Pendant ce temps, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants. Cette charge pèse lourdement  sur croissance rapide de son business.  Elle est  vendeuse de boissons sucrées et sociétaire d’une petite Quincaillerie. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce ce business. Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son défunt mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit du programme de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  5 casiers de Fanta. Ainsi, la cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit de manière permanente sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle a parvenu à construire une maison en planche de 10 chambres, qu’elle met à location. Les recettes de loyer de cette maison lui permettent  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: The client Chikwanine is the president and most senior member of the lending group Shangilieni. She is raising her hand in the photo. She is widowed and mother of seven children who are all studying. Her husband died around 2005 after a short illness. During this time, she has provided for her children's expenses by herself. These expenses weigh heavily on the rapid growth of her business. She sells sweet drinks and is a member of a small hardware shop. She has been in this business for eight years. She started her small business with her own money, received from her deceased husband. Later, she benefited from a loan from the IMF Hekima program. This new loan will be used to buy five cases of Fanta. The client permanently thanks IMF Hekima for the loans she receives without any material security because thanks to these loans, she has been able to build a wooden house with 10 rooms, which she rents out. The income from the rental of this house allows her to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy five cases of Fanta.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 40-year-old woman and a lovely mother of three children. Her husband earns an income as a hotelier. For the past five years, Fatuma has been working hard at selling clothes door-to-door.

She requested a loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 to buy bales of clothes to sell. This purchase helps her to better meet the needs of her customers. This is her second loan from Yehu.

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of clothing. Fatuma hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to enable her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is a 35 years old businessman. He is married to Lucy, and they are blessed with three children, ages 17, 15, and nine years. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Hiram will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar and rice for his shop

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He owns a retail shop which he has been operating for five years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is price fluctuation and inflation.

Daniel is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase retail shop stock. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to see his business grow and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop stock.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 51 años con 6 hijos mayores de edad, es del municipio de leon ,un lugar en el occidente de nicaragua. Leon es una ciudad que se caracteriza por tener patrimonios culturales como su querida catedral. Olga es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha dia a dia para salir adelante con su familia a pesar de todas las crisis y adversidades propias del pais. su rutina diaria es levantarse todos los dias a las 5:00  de la manana para abrir su pequeno negocio y ofrecer sus productos a sus vecinos, los cuales llegan a buscar lo de la comida diario para mandar a sus pequenos hijos desayunados a clases, ella abre muy temprano el negocio para ganar clientela   y mejorar sus ingresos economicos. Olga tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, en un barrio de sus localidad la cual consiste en la venta de productos consumo diario al por menor  como: (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, condimentos, refrescos, tiste, leña, jabón, pan, leche de vaca, pastas dental, entre otros.) Olga tiene amplio record con la institución a manejado 22 créditos de una manera muy responsable y ha demostrado tener buena capacidad de pago. En la foto ella esta mostrando productos de los que ofrecen en su pequeno negocio. El financiamiento lo necesita para  invertir en  la compra de productos para la pulpería y así brindar un mejor servicios a los pobladores de su barrio. Olga se siente muy agradecida con prestatarios kiva por brindarle la oportunidad de este credito y asi poder tener una herramienta de trabaja digna para sobrevivir a pesar de la crisis economica en paises de escosos recursos como es nicaragua.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old and has  6 adult sons. She is from the municipality of leon, a place in the west of Nicaragua. Leon is a city that is characterized by cultural heritage as its beloved cathedral. Olga is a very hard worker, that struggle every day to get ahead with her family in spite of the country's crises and adversities.

Her daily routine is to get up every day at 5:00 a.m. to open her small business and to offer her products to her neighbors, whom come to get the breakfast for their small children so the go to classes well eaten. She opens early to attract more clientele and improve the business and her income.

Olga makes a living from her grocery store, which is located in a neighborhood of her municipality. In her grocery store she sells products for the daily consumption such as: (rice, beans, sugar, salt, spices, refreshments, sad, firewood, soap, bread, cow's milk, tooth pastes, among others).

Olga has an extensive record with the institution, she has managed 22 credits in a very responsible manner and has demonstrated good payment ability. In the photo she is displaying products that offer her small business. She needs the loan to buy products and provide a better service to the people of her neighborhood.

Olga is very grateful with Kiva's lenders for giving her the opportunity of this credit and thus be able to have a tool to make a living and to survive in spite of the economic crisis in countries with lack of as is Nicaragua.

loans.use: to supply her small local store and to buy household products of daily consumption.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and the mother of three children. She lives in her own house with her family and does not provide for anyone else.

She is a trader and owns her own business selling prepared fish. With this loan, she intends to increase her stock to satisfy demand by purchasing more fish and cooking oil.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business by diversifying her products and building a house to rent out. For this, she is committing to duly repay the loan in order to request more from Yehu.
