The challenge is that she sells in the open air, which inconveniences her during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks to equip another computer services shop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children; one of whom is in school. 

She owns a charcoal business that she has been operating for one and a half years.  She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group.  She joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on her business operations.

Christine is applying a loan of KES 21,100 to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. Her extra income will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard. She aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of his mechanics workshop so as to improve the service they offer.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus 2 hijos, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella se hizo cargo de su familia y ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacarlos adelante; Gabina es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de un río cercano a su vivienda, ella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con sus hijos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Gabina trabaja vendiendo golosinas de manera ambulatoria, ella cuenta con un pequeño triciclo el cual utiliza para realizar sus ventas, todas las mañanas desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la variedad de dulces y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Gabina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería (golosinas) tales como: caramelos, galletas, chupetines, piqueos, entre otros; de esta manera Gabina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ahorrar lo necesario para poder adquirir un nuevo triciclo, así ella seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para que junto a sus puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gabina, 42, lives in the city of Camaná with her two children. Unfortunately, for a number of reasons, she separated from her partner some years ago and has been the head of her household ever since and has put all of her efforts towards getting them ahead. Gabina is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic. In her free time she likes to go walk by the river near her house. She wasn't able to study for a career since she began working at a very young age to help her parents cover their expenses. Sometimes she cooks a delicious Lomo Saltado [beef stir fry] to share with her children.

With a lot of dedication and enthusiasm, Gabina works daily selling snacks door-to-door. She has a small tricycle that she uses for her sales. Every morning she starts working early and works for about 10 hours a day. She believes it's going well due to the variety of sweets and friendly treatment that she gives her customers.

Gabina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with their support she will be able to buy merchandise (snack food) like caramels, cookies, lollipops, appetizers, among other things. This way her business will be better stocked, which she hopes will increase her sales and her income. That will help her to save little by little in order to buy a new tricycle. She will continue working hard so that she and her kids can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy snacks like caramels, cookies, lollipops, appetizers, etc

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar, 24, is married and lives in downtown Msambweni. He is known to be honest and hardworking and, most of all, to have a strong desire to succeed. His wife is a housewife and he has worked as a teacher for some time. This is how he earns income to support his family. He is also a farmer, assisted by his wife. Omar has been farming for five years and he confesses that it has been good work. He grows a variety of vegetables which his wife sells from home and at the market. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilisers and planting materials. Omar's main desire is to see his home in excellent condition and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and planting materials.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 49-year-old married man who lives in Nabatieh with his wife and four children. He has been working as a blacksmith for 29 years.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the seventh time, in order to buy extra iron pillars for his industry. Issam’s clients believe in his good quality of work, and support him a lot to improve and expand his business.

He hopes to expand his business in the future and open a big factory that can ensure a good living and education for his family members.

loans.use: To buy iron pillars necessary for his business

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 59 años de edad, soltera no tiene hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ella pertenece a la localidad de Leon,lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del pais, y se caracteriza por ser un lugar tranquilo, con gente muy amable , acogedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabajadoras. Paula desde muy joven a tenido que luchar dia a dia para sobrevivir ya que por falta de recursos en su ninez y juventud no pudo estudiar, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde muy nina para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de hogar. en la actualidad ha tenido que emprender su propia actividad economica de la cual para ella es de vital importancia ya que es su medio de subsistencia, hoy en dia se siente orgullosa de tener este medio de vida y darse cuenta que tiene un trabajo digno la cual la hace sentir independiente economicamente.  tiene por actividad económica   una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 9 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio consisten en la venta  de productos de consumo diario al por menor como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan leche, gaseosas, frutas, verduras, entre otros. Paula le da las gracia a los prestatarios kiva por la ayuda que le brindan a los pequenos comerciante, y a la labor humanitaria que realizan con las personas de paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Paula, 59 years of age, unmarried does not have children under her responsibility, she is from the town of Leon, which is located in the western part of the country, which characterized by being a quiet place with very friendly people, warm, raring to get ahead, a good workers.

Paula from a very young age to had to fight every day to survive. Because of lack of resources in her childhood and youth, she was not able to study and had the need to work from a very young age to help her mother with the household expenses. Now, she has undertaken her own economic activity, which for her is of vital importance because it is her form of livelihood. Today she is proud to have this way of life and she has a decent work which makes her feel economically independent.

Her economic activity is a grocery store located in her home. For the last 9 years she has made a living from this activity. The business consists of the sale of products of daily consumption such as: rice, sugar, beans, bread milk, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, among others. Paula thanks all Kiva´s lenders for the help they give to small merchants, and the humanitarian work with persons from poor countries, as it is Nicaragua, to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to buy of products of daily consumption such as: rice, sugar, beans, bread milk, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber to stock in his workshop.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma runs a makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds) business. Thanks to her business income, she provides for her family and was able to pay for her children's education.

Mwanajuma is married to Mohamed, and they have two children.

She needs a 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy makuti for sale. She hopes to own a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds) for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell: fabric, straps and typical aprons.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
She is married with five children and they live in Mbengwi, Momo Division, North West Region, Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life which include the death of most family members, sickness in her family and poverty.

She joined GHAPE in the year 2003 and has taken out and repaid six loans with the recent loan being 200,000 FRS. She promises that, if given the new loan requested, she will buy a new motorbike for commercial purposes. She is positive her business will succeed, because she has been in the business for a long time. The bike will be given to her child, who will be solely responsible, and as such will take care to avoid accidents and also do his best possible to maintain the machine at all cost. The community will benefit from this business because the bike will help to transport farmers from their houses to the farms and also carry their produce to the market. It will also help to transport students to and from school at low prices and also transport workers to and from their job sites.

With the profit from the loan, she promises to educate her children and grandchildren and provide medication for her family. She will buy farm seedlings because she is involved in a little form of agriculture. She will also pay registration fees for her daughter, who will be writing the general certificate of education. 

She says she prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals and because all the members are educated before the loans are disbursed to ensure good management of their loans.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 54 years old and lives in Abasha district with his family:  his wife and 2 grown daughters. One of his daughters works as a shop assistant and gets a monthly salary. The main source of family income is the agricultural business.  Malkhaz owns 4 milk cows, a calf and a pig. The family produces and sells dairy products locally.  Besides these activities, Malkhaz cultivates a plot of land, where maize is grown. Malkhaz sells maize at the local market.

In addition, he is a tractor driver and provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers, earning a fee for the work. Malkhaz is a very hard-working man, with rich experience in his work. He has requested a loan to purchase a plot of land. He will sow maize and harvest and sell it at a good price. This will increase his family's income. With the increased income, Malkhaz will have an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Julius, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. 

With the anticipated profit business from the business, she will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand the daily farming business and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for school costs.

loans.name: Delina

texts.en:
Delina, 24, is a woman living in the town of Samburu with her spouse and four-year-old son, who she loves very much. She is a very hard-working, kind, enthusiastic person who together with her spouse focuses all efforts to move their family ahead. 

On her own initiative and with much effort and enthusiasm, Delina sells blocks from her home. She loves her job because it allows her to socialise with her family. She believes that she does well because she has no nearby competition and also because she provides good customer service.

Delina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they provide she’ll be able to improve her business. She wants to buy more blocks to sell. In this way, she will continue meeting her customer needs. She will continue striving and working to move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy more blocks to sell.

loans.name: Gidraph

texts.en:
Gidraph is 41 years old.  A businessman, he is married to Mary, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children.

Gidraph has been running a greengrocer business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Gidraph will use the loan to purchase vegetables and fruit for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Agnes  Nyokabi

texts.en: Agnes is 26 years old and married with two children who are in school. She sells clothes to support her family. She has been in the business for two years and has employed two people.  She also does farming to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management skills. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the 100,000 KES loan, Agnes will buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Pequeños Empresarios Group

texts.es:
PEQUEÑOS EMPRESARIOS

¡Saludos desde Perú!  Les presento al grupo Pequeños Empresarios.

Rosa es uno de sus miembros ella es conviviente y tiene 07 hijos, de los cuales 5 son independientes solo tiene a su cargo 2 menores que aun están en la escuela, con el fin de apoyarlos  trabaja en diferentes oficios. Rosa realiza limpieza en algunas casas pero su principal trabajo es la preparación de comidas para eventos. Ella ofrece sus servicios para diferentes reuniones como matrimonios, cumpleaños y diferentes fiestas sociales. Sus vecinos y amigos ya la conocen y la contratan frecuentemente, los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo los invierte para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Rosa quiere tener un negocio estable por eso iniciara su negocio de venta de golosinas y  su préstamo será una gran ayuda  ya que podrá comprar  una carreta para la venta de estos productos. Rosa está muy entusiasmada por saber que muchas personas de todo el mundo  la van a apoyar en su negocio y está muy agradecida.
*Rosa aparece en la foto vestida con casaca blanca.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! We introduce the group Pequeños Empresarios [Small Business Owners].

Rosa is one of the members. She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are grown while the youngest 2 remain in her care and are still in school. With the goal of supporting them she has different jobs. She cleans houses, but her main job is preparing food for events. She offers her services for different gatherings like weddings, birthdays and social parties. Her neighbors and friends know of her services and contract them frequently. She invests the income from her job in her children's studies. 

Rosa wants to have a stable business and so she has begun selling snacks. This loan will be a big help because she will be able to buy a cart to sell her products. Rosa is very excited because she knows that people from all over the world are going to support her business and she is very grateful. 

*Rosa appears in the photo wearing a white jacket.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell sweets.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 32-year-old married man and father of two children. Naji has worked in painting manufactured furniture for 15 years, giving him long experience to get and keep customers' trust and support. He works hard to please his customers and gain their loyalty.

Naji applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, to buy necessary equipment:  an air compressor and a power generator for improving his business. These items will help a lot in improving his business through producing requested items in a very short period of time with a high quality.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor and a power generator

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, all of whom are grown except one who attends school. Bendera owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for four years. Apart from this, she also gets income from her farm. 

Bendera learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuation and inflation on the cost of commodities. Bendera is applying for a loan of 10,700 KES to buy cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, and kerosene at wholesale. The extra income she makes will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her child. She aspires to expand and own a wholesale shop and be a supplier in the area.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, and kerosene at wholesale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old. She lives in the town of Samburu in Kenya with her husband Japhet and their two children. She sells bricks from her home and she says that it has helped her achieve some of the goals she had set.

Gladys has received a lot of orders from her customers, so she does not want to let them down. However, she does not have enough capital to meet this demand. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase more bricks for sale. Her dream is to open new businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more bricks for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old.  A businessman, he is single but supports his parents. He has been a hawker for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan  from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy more stock of watches, belts, torches and albums. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop and educate his siblings to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches, belts, torches and albums

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a farm from where he sells animals, a business he has been operating for four years. Apart from this, he earns a salary from employment.

Francis learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is high transport and fuel prices.

Francis is applying for a loan of 26,300 KES to buy cows and goats. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for the children. His plan for the future is to open another animal farm.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 39 years old, married to James, and blessed with four children aged 17, 16, 12 and 10 years. 

She operates a retail shop, a business she started 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has requested a second loan of KES 100,000 to purchase 10 crates of sodas, juices, Weetabix, cooking oil, bars of soap and washing detergent for resale. 

The profit she makes will aid her in purchasing additional stock. She dreams of owning a chain of businesses such as a supermarket with M-pesa (money transfer) shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 30 crates of sodas, Weetabix, bars of soap and washing detergent.

loans.name: Ernest Abi

texts.en:
Ernest is married with two children and they live in Mbengwi, Momo Division, North West Region,  Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life which include poverty, death of his loved ones, sickness in the family and other family problems.

Ernest joined GHAPE in 2009 and has taken and successfully repaid his loan twice. With the new loan requested, he plans to buy more provisions like bags of rice, cartons of soap, cartons of maggi and other items.  He holds strongly to the fact that his business will succeed because he has regular customers, he has been doing it for a long time and he is the only person who sells such items in that locality.  From this business, the community will have regular supply at all times, credit facilities will be offered to regular customers, goods will be sold at reduced prices and a variety of goods will be made available to the community to enable them to consume what they desire, not what they find available.

With the profit from this loan, he plans to educate his children, buy medication for his family and make sure his family eats well to avoid many illnesses.  Ernest says GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates, education before loan disbursement and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, maggi, salt, crayfish, sweets, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She owns a clothes business, a business she has been operating for ten years.

Hellen learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are prices and bad debts.

Hellen is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase ladies' and gents' clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. Her plan for the future is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase men's and ladies' clothes to resell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a shoe-making business, which he has been operating for 12 years. Apart from this, he also makes an income from farming.

George learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are high prices of the raw materials and fixing the prices of the finished goods.
 
George is applying a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy soles and leather for making shoes. His extra income will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to expand and become a supplier of his products.

loans.use: To buy soles and leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Kim Ly

texts.en:
Kim Ly is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs the business of selling gas, firewood and charcoal. He earns about $5 per day. 

Kim Ly is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a small car for her husband to carry his gas to sell in the village. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a small car for her husband to carry gas to sell in the village.

loans.name: Vincentine

texts.fr: Vincentine est  de 41 ans fiancée, mère de 3 enfants de 1 et 18 ans, deux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et  exerce une activité de commerce en détail où il vend des vivres frais   (plantains) dans un marché de la place e. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en allant acheter Elle même ses produits dans les brousses(un pick up de régimes de plantains et bananes), ça lui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, économiser pour leurs scolarités et avec le temps, réinvestir le reste dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Vincentine is 41 years old, engaged and the mother of three children aged between one and eighteen years old - two of whom attend school. She is a trader and is engaged in retail sales where she sells fresh foodstuffs (plantains) in a market on the main square.
She would like to grow her business by going to purchase the goods herself in the countryside (a truckload of banana and plantain clusters). That will avoid her being out of stock, as she often is. This loan will allow her not only to meet the needs of her already growing customer base, but also to increase her profits. Profits which will help her meet the family's living expenses, to save for their education and, in time, to invest the remainder in growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a truck of banana and plantain clusters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Agnes Chantal

texts.fr: Agnès est une femme de 37 ans, fiancée, mère de 02 enfants de 14 et 16 ans, tous deux vont à l'école.Elle a ouvert une blanchisserie dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà.Son savoir faire et la diligeance de ses services lui ont permis au fil du temps de conquérir et fidéliser une clientèle.Le coût élevé de ses détergeants et emballages lui cause souvent du tort parceque n'ayant pas un capital important pour se procurer tous ces produits en gros, d'où la rupture permanente de ses resèrves. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter les emballages et détergeants en gros, ce qui satisfaira sa clientèle et l'aidera à accomplir facilement ses tâches.Le bénéfice que lui apportera ce bénéfice sera réinvestit en partie dans son activité et le reste lui permetrra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnès is 37 years old, engaged and the mother of two children aged 14 and 16, who both attend school. She opened a laundry in a district of the capital city and she has been running it for two years now. Her knowledge and attention to detail have enabled her to win over a loyal customer base. The high cost of detergent and packaging often causes her problems - not having the capital to buy them in bulk, she is always running out of stock.
This loan will allow her to buy the detergent and packaging in bulk, which will please her customers and enable her to comfortably get the work done. The profits that this loan will generate will be invested in her business, and the remainder will allow her to meet her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase laundry detergents and packaging materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice est une jeune femme de 36 ans célibataire, mère de 02 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 12 et 16 ans tous deux vont à l'école. Elle a ouvert un atelier de couture qu'elle gère depuis 07 ans. sa compétence rie dans ce domaine lui a permis de conquerir et fidéliser une clientèle.Mais à cause de la petitesse de son capitale elle est obligée d'attendre qu'un client vienne avec un tissu pour coudre alors qu'il y a souvant des période de rareté et cela ne rapporte pas vraiment. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui lui permetta d'acheter des pagnes et petit matériel de couture qu'elle confectionnera pour revendre. Ceci augmentera non seulement sa clientèle mais aussi ses bénéfices. Le profit tiré l'aidera en partie à developper son activité et aussi à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a 36 year old young woman, a single mother of two children aged 12 and 16 - they both attend school. She started a sewing workshop which she has been running for seven years. Her expertise in this work has helped her get and keep loyal customers.
However, due to her lack of capital she has to wait until a customer brings in cloth for sewing; there are often periods without customers and that is not profitable. Therefore, she is requesting this loan which will allow her to buy traditional "pagne" cloths and small sewing equipment, which she will make into outfits to resell. This will increase both her customer base and her profits.
The profit generated will help her to develop her business, and also to meet her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloths and sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase racks of drinks and basic foodstuffs.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Прекрасная девушка из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Дилшода и ей 18 лет. Она из семьи колхозника. Ее родители занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница и кукуруза и их доход не достаточно для оплаты обучения Дилшоды в университете, так как в этом году она поступила в университет. Она является студенткой 1 курса Экономического Университета Таджикистана и должна оплатить годовой договор. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 925 долларов США для оплаты обучения в университете. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: A beautiful young woman from Tajikistan needs your support. Her name is Dilshoda and she is 18 years old. Dilshoda comes from a family of farmers - her parents cultivate crops such as wheat and corn. Their income is insufficient to cover the education of their daughter who entered university this year. Dilshoda is a first-year student at the Tajikistan University of Economics and needs to pay her tuition. She is requesting a loan of US$925 to pay for her education. She is hoping for and counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, aged 38, is a widowed mother residing in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. As a responsible mother, Mach cultivates rice on her existing farmland to generate income for the family. She has been doing this as the major source of her income for more than 20 years. Since she has a large farm, she typically yields a good income of $7.00 USD per day, from which she is able to satisfy her living needs and send all her children to school. 

Recently, two of her children have married and live with their new families, while the remaining one lives with her and helps her farm. Mach plans to use her generated income from farming to invest in germinating rubber tree seeds. After the trees are grown, she will sell them to local plantation owners for a profit. 

Due to insufficient funds, Mach is now asking for additional capital of $1,000 USD to purchase rubber tree seeds for germinating. She believes this loan will enable her to keep developing her business and thus become financially stable. She hopes that someday her family will be able to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rubber seeds for germinating.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is 52 years old. She is married and lives with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruit for more than four years, earning about $2 per day. Her husband is a boat repairer who earns about $3 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 each day. 

Sokhoeurn is requesting a loan of $800 to buy timber to repair her boat. By doing so, she will have a good boat to use for fishing in the rainy season. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase timber to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Felymar

texts.en:
Felymar is 56 years old, married, and has three children. She is a housewife and an entreprenuer who sews school uniforms, curtains and tablecloths to sell. She had been doing this for over 10 years now and usually earns P5,000 monthly. 

Now she is asking for a loan of P33,000 to buy thread, fabric and machine oils used in her sewing business. She has insufficient funds because some of her money was used to pay school fees and an allowance for her youngest child, who is currently attending college. 

With a continuous income from the business and the success of her children, the family will achieve a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and machine oils used in her sewing business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario lives at Estefania with his spouse and children. The couple had seven children. The youngest still attends college while the rest have settled into marriage and live separately from them.

Mario and his spouse manage a small "talipapa" (vegetable stand) and have been operating it for over five years now. They buy vegetables and fish and resell them to the people in their village. From the business, he earns 4,000 PHP each month. It goes for their meals, allowance and revolving capital, too. He is now asking for additional capital of 22,000 PHP to buy eggplant, beans, tomatoes and fish (milk and mud fish) to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and will also upgrade his revenue.

Someday, Mario hopes to acquire stable income so he can save part of it for unexpected expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, beans, tomatoes and fish to sell

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es: Diana es una humilde comerciante de frutas y verduras quien lucha día a día para mejorar las condiciones de vida, su esposo es albañil colabora con los gastos del hogar de esa manera se apoyan entre ambos para sacar adelante a sus hijas que son dos que todavía van a clases. Doña Diana necesita el crédito para compra de materiales de construcción para seguir avanzando con la construcción de su casa, con el crédito anterior logro levantar la obra, el techo lo dejo con zinc y plástico para poderse proteger del sol y la lluvia, su gran sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda y ver que sus hijos logren culminar una carrera profesional. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda KIVA a través de AFODENIC, ya que siendo una buena comerciante le dan la confianza de crédito para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Diana is a humble merchant of fruits and vegetables who fights day after day to improve her living conditions.  To contribute to home expenses her husband works as a brick layer.  This is how they support themselves to help their school aged daughters move forward.  Diana needs this loan to purchase home building materials so she can continue to develop the construction of her home.  With the previous loan she was able to work on her roof which she made with zinc and plastic to protect from the sun and rain.  Her dream is to finish the construction of her home and to see her children enter a professional career.  She appreciates the support from Kiva through AFODENIC now that they have confidence in giving her a loan to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase home construction material.

loans.name: Rovilyn

texts.en:
Rovilyn is 22 years of age and married with 1 child. She is a resident of San Vicente, Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She started her business through the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

In her 8th loan cycle, she wants to avail herself of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste. She hopes that her business will prosper so that she can provide all their financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste

loans.name: Felicidad's Group

texts.en:
Felicidad is 48 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children.

Felicidad is engaged in a dried fish vending business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell. 

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her business. Felicidad is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea is 34 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $5 each day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Kea is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and send her children to a good school. In addition, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 23 years old and a resident of Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. Hoeurn is married with a small kid who utterly relies on her care. Hoeurn, aside from her main duties of taking care of her family, helps her spouse earn income with her sewing skills. She works in a local garment factory where she can generate a decent salary for her household. She says she has been working in this field for three years already. 

Hoeurn comes to HKL for the first time to gain access to financial assistance to better her living situation. Hoeurn would like to acquire a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle to serve her family as transportation. With this purchase, Hoeurn and her husband can travel to their workplaces easily without paying for public transportation or taxi services. In the future, Hoeurn wants to have a convenience store, selling various kinds of merchandise to people in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to serve her family as transportation.

loans.name: Merle's Group

texts.en:
Merle is 48 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children.

Merle is engaged in making polvoron (powdered milk candy) and a hypo (a chemical used for water purification and cleaning) vending business, and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional ingredients for polvoron making and liters of hypo for sale.

Merle has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Merle hopes to expand her business. Merle is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for polvoron making and liters of hypo for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, les presento a un joven entusiasta, perseverante y muy dedicado en sus estudios, así se caracteriza Juan de 24 años de edad y con un futuro muy prometedor. Juan estudia ingeniería mecánica más de 6 horas por día a su vez también estudia mecánica automotriz ya que le apasiona mucho los autos. Está cursando el segundo año de su carrera automotriz y le da mucho empeño para obtener las mejores notas de su clase. Muestra de ello, se proyecta a futuro y desea acabar con ansia su carrera para poder comenzar a desempeñarse como ingeniero mecánico. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en pagar  las mensualidades de su universidad ya que sus padres no pueden costear todo el pago universitario del sueño de su hijo. Juan  se siente muy contento por el préstamo brindado y se sacrificara mucho para obtener las mejor notas y culminar su carrera con éxito. Desde ya les da un fuerte saludo y un enorme agradecimiento por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru!  We would like to introduce you to a keen, determined young man who is very committed to his studies.  Juan is 24 years old and has a very promising future ahead of him.  He is currently studying mechanical engineering for more than six hours a day and is also studying automotive engineering because he has a great passion for cars.  He is in the second year of his degree and he works very hard in order to obtain the best grades in his class.  He is planning for his future and is very keen to finish his degree so that he can start working as a mechanical engineer.  He plans to invest his most recent loan in paying his monthly university fees as his parents cannot afford to cover all of the cost of his university education.  Juan feels very happy to be receiving this loan and he will work as hard as possible to obtain the best grades and successfully finish his course.  He sends you his warmest wishes and also a lot of thanks for the help offered.

loans.use: to pay his monthly university fees

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.

Romeo has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Dionisia Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia Consuelo posee un negocio de venta de granos básicos ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace dieciocho años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, tiene tres hijos menores que están bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm. Su negocio lo inicio con  aporte de su esposo.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar al  por mayor frijoles y aceite aprovechando de esta manera una oferta con precios rebajados. Esto permitirá ofrecerle a su clientela precios más accesibles satisfaciendo la demanda, así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Los sueños de Doña Dionisia es que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Dionisia Consuelo has a business selling basic grains which is located in one of the markets in the city of León.  She has been working in this business for 18 years, providing for her family.  She has three children in her care.  Dionisia leaves home at 5.30am, opens her business at 6.00am and finishes work at 4.00pm.  She started her business with her husband's support.

Dionisia will use the loan that she has requested from CEPRODEL to buy beans and oil wholesale.  This will enable her to benefit from reduced prices.  In turn, she will be able to offer her customers more affordable prices and satisfy their demand.  This will make her more income and she will be able to improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.  

Dionisia's dream is for her children to complete degree courses.

loans.use: to buy beans and oil

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 52 years old and been raising hogs for more than three years. She is the mother of six children, one of whom still attends school. Rosalinda earns PHP 3,000 from each hogs she raises and sells. The profits are used to pay for school fees. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 because she has insufficient funds to sustain her hogs. She will buy feed and vaccines for the hogs to ensure their good nutrition and therefore she will be able to sell them at a profitable price. Someday, she hopes to increase her earnings for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbeque

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. For six years, Lucia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so she can provide education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea is 36 years old and one of the breadwinners of her family. She is the mother of three children who are students at the local public school. Chea struggles to generate more income, for her children's sake, by rice cropping on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for five years. However, her yields have been limited due to unpredictable weather (flood or drought). To supplement her income, she also sells Vietnamese crepes. Chea's group is composed of two members; both are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. Chea is applying for 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is asking for 600,000 KHR. As the leader, Chea will use her portion of the loan to buy more non-perishable ingredients to support her food-selling business. She hopes to earn more income from both of her businesses in order to keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm and non-perishable ingredients for her food-selling business

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am para iniciar sus labores a las 7:00am finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm, viaja a Managua una vez por semana a comprar  su producto. Ella es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo y  es de edad escolar, Inicio su negocio viajando a honduras y comercializaba su producto ambulante actualmente tiene puesto fijo.

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de nuevos productos que estén a la moda tales como: ropa interior, trajes para niños, toallas, sabanas, shores, camisa, etc. Permitiéndole atraer más clientela e incrementando las ventas y ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

Los sueños de la señora es lograr concluir con las mejoras de su vivienda, lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales coronando una carrera en un futuro.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is a merchant at one of the markets in the city of León. She leaves the house where she lives at 6:00 a.m. to start her work at 7:00, and she finishes at 5:00 p.m. She travels to Managua once a week to buy her products. She is the mother of four children, of whom only one is still in her care and of school age. She started her business by traveling to Honduras and selling her products as a mobile vendor, but she now has a fixed location. 

She will use the loan she is requesting from Ceprodel to buy new products which are in fashion, such as underwear, children's clothing, towels, sheets, shorts, shirts, etc. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales and her earnings to support her family. 

Her dreams are to be able to finish improving her home, and to help her children become professionals with a better future pursuing a career.

loans.use: to buy underwear, children's clothes, towels, sheets and other items to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena tiene un negocio de venta de calzado ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, lo inició de forma ambulante con ventas de ropa, actualmente tiene su puesto fijo con venta de calzado de toda índole donde ha logrado obtener mayor clientela. Sus compras las realiza al por mayor a comerciantes de la ciudad de Masaya. Es madre soltera de cinco hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad y ninguno está a su cargo.

Martha Lorena solicita este  crédito a CEPRODEL  para compra de sandalias y aprovechar, captar más clientes ya que en estas épocas hay mayores demandas de productos.

La señora sueña con poseer su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena has a business located in one of the markets of the city of León selling footwear.  She started her business as a street vendor selling clothing.  At present she has a fixed stand for selling shoes of every kind where she has managed to obtain a larger clientele.  She makes her wholesale purchases from the merchants in the city of Masaya.  She is a single mother of five children, all of whom are older and not in her care.

Martha Lorena is applying for this loan with Ceprodel in order to buy sandals, make progress and gain more customers since in these days there is a greater demand for products.

She dreams of owning her own well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy sandals manufactured domestically in Masaya.

loans.name: Rahmonberdy

texts.ru: Рахмонбетди 38 лет, женат на хорошей женщине, которую зовут Джамиля и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Его дети еще не совершеннолетние. Рахмонберди очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 12 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей яблоки, а также занимается выращиванием картофеля и скотоводством. Продажа яблоки является его основным бизнесом, но  последнее время у него мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и он не может придерживать своих клиентов. Рахмонберди должен расширить свой бизнес и для этого он должен купить яблоки. Рахмонберди запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони и надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rakhmonbetdi is 38 years old, is married to a wonderful wife, Dzhamilia, and is raising four children. His children are still minors. Rakhmonbetdi is a very industrious person and has more than 12 years of business experience. He sells apples; he also grows potatoes and raises livestock. Selling apples is his main business, but recently his clientele has been shrinking because of intense competition, and he hasn't been able to keep his customers. Rakhmonbetdi has to expand his business, and to do this he must buy apples. Rakhmonbetdi is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 somonis and looks forward to your help and generosity.

loans.use: To buy apples

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
La señora Mirna María posee un negocio de venta de plásticos ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace trece años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a toda su familia, es madre soltera tiene tres hijos pero solo dos  están bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:30 am, abre su negocio a las 7:00 am exhibiendo su producto y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm. Realiza sus compras dos veces por semana en la ciudad de Managua, su negocio lo inició en uno de los mercados de león como vendedora ambulante con un capital producto de ahorro y préstamos.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar al por mayor vasos, tazas, panas de todo tamaño, veladoras. Esto permitirá ofrecerle a su clientela precios más cómodos, gracias al crédito su negocio ha crecido con productos de mejor calidad así ha obtenido   mayores ingresos y ha mejorando su nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Los sueños de Doña Mirna es incrementar su inventario con nuevos productos, obtener mayores ganancias y que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mirna María has a business selling plastic goods which is located in one of the markets in the city of León.  She has been in this business for 13 years, providing for her whole family.  She is a single mother and has three children, only two of whom are still in her care.  She leaves home at 6.30am, opens her business at 7.00am, puts her products out on display and finishes work at 4.00pm.  She makes her purchases twice a week in the city of Managua.  Mirna started her business in one of the markets in León, working as an itinerant vendor.  She started the business with money from loans and savings.

Mirna will use the loan that she is requesting from CEPRODEL to buy glasses, cups, bowls and candle holders.  This will allow her to offer her customers more affordable prices.  Thanks to loans, her business has grown as she now has better quality products and makes more income.  She has managed to improve both her own quality of life and that of her family.

Mirna's dreams are to add new products to her stock, to make more profits and for her children to get degrees.

loans.use: to buy glasses, cups, bowls and candle holders

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
La joven Norma Elena posee un negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace diez años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y su hija de siete años de edad. 

Doña Norma se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 4:00 am para abrir a las 5:00 am y cierra su negocio a las 3:00pm.Labora de lunes a domingo  en este mismo horario Ella compra su producto a mayorista que viajan a la ciudad de Managua dos veces por semana. 

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo quiere para comprar al por mayor granos básicos para ser comercializados en  su negocio, también  tiene en su casa de habitación una pulpería, que también quiere invertir además de la venta de verduras para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos y precios más accesibles para satisfacer la demanda, lo cual tendría mayores ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. Su sueño es que crezca su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma Elena owns a vegetable sales business that she has operated in a Leon market for ten years.  She started the business to support her family.  She is married and has a seven-year old daughter.

Doña Norma works from 4:00am to 3:00pm, Mondays to Sundays.  She buys her produce at a wholesale market in Managua twice a week.    

Doña Norma is applying for a CEPRODEL loan, part of which she will use to stock her vegetable sales business and the rest to stock a corner grocery that she operates from her house.  The investment will allow her to provide more products to her customers at prices that they can afford.  She wants, she says, to increase her income so that she can better provide for her family.  For the future, she wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Damas Del Futuro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Damas del Futuro está formado por 13 mujeres quienes son familiares, amigas y vecinas, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una arquitectura colonial y lo moderna, es de clima frió, su gente es trabajadora y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nube, se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en este banco comunal, vive por la ciudadela Jaime Roldos en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 46 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de sus hijas son casadas y viven independientes, 2 de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan   económicamente y sus 2 últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y presta sus servicios conduciendo una buseta escolar, la casa en la que vive es construida en unión conyugal. 

La Señora. Nube se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su familia, también para apoyar económicamente a su hogar se dedica al comercio, vente  ropa, cosméticos y productos toperware (plásticos), esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, cosméticos y productos toperware para tener más variedad para su clientela. 

Como es una mujer emprendedora su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Damas del Futuro Communal Bank is made up of 13 women who are family members, friends, and neighbors.  They work in various jobs that allow them to contribute to the household finances and live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  This city has colonial and modern architecture and a cold climate, and the people there are hardworking and still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is Nube, who's on her third loan with this communal bank.  She lives near the Jaime Roldos residential complex in the city of Cuenca.  She's 46 and married, and has six children from this relationship.  Two of her daughters are married and live independently, two of her children work and help her financially, and the last two attend school in the town.  Her husband's a professional driver who drives a school bus.  Together they built the house they live in.

Nube works taking care of her home and family.  Also, to help her household financially she works in business selling clothing, cosmetics, and plastic Tupperware products.  She has done this work for 10 years and she works from Monday through Saturday with no fixed schedule.

She's going to invest her new loan in buying clothing, cosmetics, and Tupperware products to have more variety for her customers.

As she's a small businesswoman, her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and Tupperware products

loans.name: Ohunjon

texts.ru: Молодой, энергичный и целеустремленный человек нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут  Охунджон и ему 21  года, не женат и живет с родителями. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 2 года он занимается  скотоводством. У него 3  коровы и  7 барана. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Охунджон хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается купить мебель для своего дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A young, energetic and focused person needs your support, for he has recently experienced some financial problems. His name is Okhundzhon; he is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents. In order to provide for his family, he has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 2 years. He has 3 cows and 7 sheep. He has a large meadow where he grows hay for his animals. He sells the livestock after taking care of them for several months. He has many clients at the market. Okhundzhon wants to expand his business, but doesn't have the money for this. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 6000 somonis to buy livestock to expand his business. He plans to use the profits to buy furniture for his home. He looks forward to your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
La Señora Zeneyda posee un negocio de venta de productos lácteos en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, la señora sale de su casa de habitación 5:00 am ubicada en un municipio del departamento de león, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am para ofertar a toda su clientela, finalizando sus labores a las 12:00 pm. Por la tarde prepara sus productos para el día siguiente,  inició su negocio como vendedora ambulante con un pequeño capital el cual era  producto de su ahorro y aporte de su esposo, Zeneyda es  madre de tres hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo

Zeneyda solicita un crédito a Ceprodel  el que  utilizara  para gastos médicos (realizarle una cirugía) la cual le permitirá recuperar su salud y así continuar trabajando con su negocio, durante su operación su hija mayor se encargara de ayudarle con el negocio. Ella espera  recuperar su salud lo más pronto posible para continuar brindándoles el apoyo a sus pequeños hijos, y que sus sueños se le cumplan como la  mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Zeneyda Norma Elena owns a dairy sales business that she operates in one of the markets in Leon.  She leaves her rural town at 5:00am so that she can open her business in Leon at 6:00am.  She works until 12:00pm, then spends her afternoons making the products she needs for the next day.  She worked as a street vendor at first, slowly building the business with help from her husband and her own small savings.  Zeneyda has three children, two of whom still live at home.

Zeneyda is applying for a Ceprodel loan that she will use to pay medical expenses (surgery, specifically).  She has to recover her health so that she can continue working.  Her oldest daughter will carry on the business while she is recovering.  She hopes to recover quickly so that she can return to her business and support her family.  For the future, she wants to carry out improvements to her house.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is a farmer who raises pigs at home, while her husband, Phally, is a fisherman and farmer. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Two are married and live separately; one is a security guard, one is a garment worker, another one attends school and the other two are still young. 

Yon is a asking for a loan of $1,500 in order to assist in her rice farming by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller to assist in her rice farming.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Lang is 28 years old, and she is a married mother of three sons. 

She makes a living through 1.5 hectares of rice farmland. To add more income, she also raises pigs at home, while her husband works as a paid worker. From the current business that she has been with for several years, she is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day and save about 16,000 KHR each day for future needs. However, the main challenge for her rice is drought, which lowers her yield. 

Lang received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycles ago, while her other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her better support her current business. 

She is now leading her group of two to request a loan with VisionFund. With her portion, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and build on her savings to renovate her house. She hopes to earn more income from the crop yield and also enable her to have a decent house for living in so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 47 years old, with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virgie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgie has been raising pigs for five years, and she also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмаду 52 года. Он очень трудолюбивый человек,  женат и  имеет одного ребенка. Его ребенок еще нетрудоспособный, ему 16 лет. Ахмад начал  заниматься скотоводством и земледелием с детства. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, картофель, и другие сельхозпродукты. В настоящее время он  имеет 4 голов КРС. Уже более 20 -и лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена помогает ему в введении бизнеса. Ахмад хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму  900 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своего ребенка хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ahmad is 52 years old. He is a very industrious person, is married, and has one son. His son is 16, and is still too young to have a job. Ahmad has been working in animal husbandry and farming since childhood. He mainly grows wheat, potatoes, and other crops. He currently has four head of cattle. He has been working in this business for more than 20 years. His wife helps him run the business. Ahmad wants to expand this business, but does not have enough money for this. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 900 US dollars to buy livestock so he can expand his business. He plans to use the profits to provide his son with a good education and technology. He looks forward to your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath, aged 38, is a noble man who has tried very hard to achieve a good standard of living and provide a high-quality life and moral path for his family. He is married and the responsible father of four school-aged children. Someday he hopes to offer them a higher level of education. Nath farms rice and he uses his spare time to run a recycling business for additional income. From the two businesses, he is able to generate a suitable income of 18,000 KHR each day while his spouse earns about 12,000 KHR each day from her hog-raising business.

In order to sustain his recycling business, Nath needs additional capital for a large purchase of recycled materials. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from HKL and Kiva. He has borrowed with HKL seven times already. Nath found his previous loans to be very helpful in developing his business as well as his living conditions. He hopes that Kiva lenders will offer him constant help and he appreciates them for that.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 44-year old resident of Silanga, Tangub City. She provides for her child's needs with the 4,000 PHP she earns monthly from her piggery. Elsa started her business 4 years ago to supplement her husband's income. This year she joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a microfinance loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Elsa wants to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha and her husband, live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have two daughter. One is a married and the other one works for a Hotel in Phnom Penh. 

Sokha used to be a weaver, but she quit her weaving business. Her husband, Chhon is a fisherman. In addition, Sokha and her husband grow rice and mushrooms. 

She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase one more ox, because she has one already. She will use the oxen to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase one more ox to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar is now 39 years of age and has four single children attending school.

Sar is not fortunate to have a higher education due to the family’s financial constraints. Consequently, Sar chose to be in farming as her focused business for life. Sar has been working this type of business for over 10 years and she can earn approximately of 13,000 KHR each day. She grows various kinds of seasonal crops and vegetables besides rice. Her goal is to offer her children a good quality of life and good education. If it happens, it will be thanks to her efforts and sacrifices. 

Recently, Sar has had much work to complete at her rice field as well as plantation, where she must hire laborers to help her maintain this business. Because of the lack of funds, Sar is requesting a loan of 700,000 KHR to pay for labor costs. She believes the loan will be a big help for her to lessen her difficulties in maintaining their crops.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Nasreen Akhter's Group

texts.en: Nasreen Akhter is a 50-year-old hardworking housewife who is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Her husband has been running a general store for five years. He wants to purchase more products for it so he can offer a greater variety of goods to his clients, thereby increasing his monthly income. Nasreen, as a member of a four-person lending group, has requested a loan to purchase products for her husband's general store. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them.

loans.use: to purchase products for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 51 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. She has a small store that sells snacks. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more snacks to resell. 

Lilia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to resell

loans.name: Bat's Group

texts.en:
Bat, 50, is a villager from Kror Lanh District, located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, one of whom is still dependent on her. For the past 15 years, she has been making her living by rice farming on four hectares of farmland. To generate more income for her family, she also raises a pig. Every day she earns about 14,000 KHR, and she is able to save approximately 6,000 KHR each day. A lack of sufficient water is a big challenge for her rice farming and has affected her household’s income. 

Bat is leading a group of two borrowers, both of whom are applying for their second loans with VisionFund. The first loan helped Bat to increase her crop yield and enabled her to sell her harvest at the market for a profit. Bat and her group member are requesting new loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. Bat will use her portion to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this loan will provide her with a higher crop yield and enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Sakhoern's Group

texts.en: Sakhoern lives in Kandal Stoeng district, located in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a 58-year-old widow with six children, three of whom are working in a factory. To make a living, she has been farming on her one hectare of land for 35 years. She earns approximately USD 5 per day and is able to save less than USD 2. Sakhoern is now leading a group of three, all of whom are first-time clients with VisionFund, to take out a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Sakhoern will use her portion of the loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and to cover the costs of plowing her rice field. She hopes that this loan will provide her with a higher crop yield and maintain good progress toward improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing

loans.name: Ghieliza

texts.en: Ghieliza is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children. To make a living, Ghieliza sells fish while her husband is a fisherman. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 3,500 PHP per month from these activities. In 2008, Ghieliza joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Sopheak is a 24-year-old married woman who has no children. 

She has made a living through rice farming on one hectare of farmland and raising pigs while her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Involved in this business for one year, she can earn about 9,000 KHR per day and save about 4,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

Sopheak’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and this is the first microloan for her with VisionFund. Now leading her group to seek a loan, Sopheak will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed for her pig business. With this loan, she hopes to fatten her pigs and to set aside some money to buy additional plots of farmland in order to expand her rice-growing business so as to make her living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis is a silk weaver, while her husband, Sao, is a construction worker. They live in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three sons. Two attend school and another one is still young.

Malis is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy two cows to raise. She will be able to get extra income from selling the calves once the cows have babies.

loans.use: To buy two cows to raise.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 27 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Juan, con quien tiene tres hijos de 6, 4 y el último de ellos de tan solo 5 meses de nacido. Su casa es propia, la construyeron en un terreno que tomaron posesión por la necesidad de encontrar un lugar donde vivir.

Su trabajo es la venta de frutas de la región y diversas golosinas. Tiene un puesto instalado en la vereda de su casa, que está ubicada al costado de un puente muy transitado, lo que le da una gran oportunidad de ventas. Considera que tiene un negocio muy rentable por la fluidez de la clientela que tiene, desde niños escolares que van y vienen de una escuela cercana y por sus propios vecinos que siempre se acercan a comprar. Eventualmente, también vende gaseosas durante la semana, mientras que los sábados y domingos se dedica a vender detergentes y productos de limpieza a clientes que previamente ya le han hecho pedido. Lleva con la misma rutina de trabajo cerca de 10 años. Le gusta mucho estar en contacto con las personas y le ha sido muy complicado establecer su pequeño negocio, ya que anteriormente vendía ropa, pero no le pagaban a tiempo y eso le daba cierto temor de emprender otro negocio, a pesar de ello no se rindió y hoy tiene muchos planes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además de seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 500 soles, comprará más frutas, como naranjas, mandarinas y bananas. También invertirá en la compra de detergentes y otros productos de limpieza para continuar trabajando e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juanita, 27, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her husband, Juan, have three young children, 6-years, 4-years and 5-months old, respectively.  They built a house on land that they [took posession of?] because they needed a place to live.  

Juanita operates a retail business.  She sells fruits, snacks and other merchandise.  She operates the business from a stand in front of her house.  Many of her customers are passers-by who have to cross a nearby bridge.  Her customers range from neighbors to local school children and she mixes up the products she sells in order to provide what her customers want from day to day.  She sells soft drinks during the week and detergents and other household products at weekends.  She says that she has operated the business for 10 years and enjoys mixing with her customers.  She tells us, too, that she struggled at first because she had a clothing sales business before that barely paid and, consequently, she was reluctant to start another business.

This is Juanita's first MFP loan.  She is grateful, she says, for your help because the funds will help her meet her goals.  She adds that she is committed to working with the other members of her community bank and repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  

Juanita will use this 500 soles loan to buy fruit--oranges, mandarines, bananas, etc.--for her fruit sales business.  She will also buy other merchandise that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 63 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive junto a su esposo y su último hijo, en la casa que construyeron hace muchos años como producto de su trabajo. 
Mercedes tiene una bodega en su vivienda, donde vende todo tipo de abarrotes y gaseosas. Tiene muchos clientes, ya que en la cuadra donde vive no hay más bodegas y el trato que brinda a los clientes logra que se vayan contentos. Lleva 25 años y cuenta con la ayuda eventual de su esposo en la atención, mientras que su hijo genera ingresos adicionales con otro trabajo. Recuerda que cuando empezó con esta actividad no tenía muchos conocimientos de cómo hacerlo, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora es una experta vendedora y muy querida entre sus clientes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo, ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio. Además, afirma sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que todos sus miembros son personas responsables y muy comprometidas.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará más gaseosas y algunos abarrotes de mayor consumo, como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 63 years old and a hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and her youngest son in a house which, as a product of her work, they built some years ago. Mercedes has a general store in her home where she sells all types of groceries and soft drinks. She has many customers, since there are no other general stores in the block where she lives, and her good treatment of her customers leaves them content.
 
Mercedes has had her store for 25 years and she can count on help from her husband when needed. Her son generates additional income from his own work. Mercedes recalls that when she started this activity, she had almost no knowledge of how to do it, but in time, she learned and now, she is an expert at sales and much loved by her customers.

This is Mercedes' 2nd loan through MFP and she feels content with the financial help she is receiving, since it serves to advance her business. Moreover, she says she is very happy with her communal bank, and considers all the members to be responsible and very committed persons.

With the solicited 2,500 sols, she will purchase soft drinks and some high-demand groceries, including rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, milk, and other items.

loans.use: buy more soft drinks and high-demand groceries, such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, milk, and others for her store.

loans.name: Concepcion
